incorporatedCountry.description: The country where the business was incorporated or organized. English short name according to ISO 3166-1 standard.

incorporatedState.description: The state or province code (not full name) where the business was incorporated or organized. For example: CA.

maxScore.description: Number representing the maximum scoring result in the results.

scores.description: Object mapping result ID's to their score in the search results.

ContactType.description:
The type of contact.

`phone` and `whatsApp` should be provided in _[E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164)_ format.

`email` should be provided in *aaa@bbb.com* format.

`address` is the mailing address.

`fbMessenger` can be phone or email.

ContactAffiliation.description:
All contacts are associated with one borrower. Sometimes the contact represents information
about the borrower person themselves—e.g., the borrower's address. Sometimes the contact
represents information about a person affiliated with the borrower.

`self` - denotes contact information about the borrower. All `self` contacts are considered to be **first-party**.

`spouse`, `parent`, `guardian`, `executor`, `administrator`, `legal` and `otherRelative` - are
considered to be a **third-party**. Some regulations define these to be the **consumer** (aka the person)
for purposes of debt collection efforts. This means that a debt collector may communicate about the debt
with the consumer’s spouse, parent (if the consumer is a minor), guardian,
executor, or administrator (or with the attorney of any of these people).

Automated text messages (e.g. payment reminder) can only be sent to contactType=`phone`,
label=`personal` and affiliation=`self`.

ContactLabel.description:
The contact label.

A person's mobile phone should be labeled as `personal`.

A person's home address should be labeled as `home`.

A servicemember's military unit or commander contact should be labeled as `military`.

Automated text messages (e.g. payment reminder) can only be sent to contactType=`phone`,
label=`personal` and affiliation=`self`.

ContactStatus.description:
Describes the contact status as primary, secondary, additional or archived.
Within a set of contacts with the same `contactType` and `affilation`
only one `primary` and only one `secondary` contacts are allowed. There may
be multiple `additional` and `archived` contacts.

If a new contact is created as `primary` and there is an existing
`primary` contact with the same `contactType` and `affilation`,
the status of the existing contact will be automatically changed to
`additional`.

If a new contact is created as `secondary` and there is an existing
`secondary` contact with the same `contactType` and `affilation`,
the status of the existing contact will be automatically changed to
`additional`.

allOf.description:
The contact details. A contact can be email, phone, address,
etc. The `name` attribute is optional, and is useful for third-party contacts such as
spouse, attorney, etc.

personId.description: Identifier of the borrower to which the `contact` belongs.

receiveTextMessagesLastConsentAt.description: The date when the `receiveTextMessages` consent was obtained (aka set to `true`).

lastKnownConnectionDate.description:
The date obtained by the borrower to contact them or a past date in which the lender is
reasonably certain that the borrower could still be reached at that number. When contact
is created the `lastKnownConnectionDate` is equal to `createdAt::date`. This date is used
to monitor the disconnect status in the Reassigned Numbers Database (RND).

lastDisconnectCheckDate.description:
The date when the system performed a disconnect check against the Reassigned Numbers Database.
If the value is empty, the disconnect check was not performed on the number. Applicable only to `contactType=phone`.

disconnectionStatus.description:
The disconnect status of a check that was performed on `lastDisconnectCheckDate`. If the value is empty, the disconnect check was not performed on the number. Applicable only to `contactType=phone`.

`disconnected` - the number is contained in the Reassigned Numbers Database (RND) and it has been disconnected since the `lastKnownConnectionDate`.
`connected` - the number is contained in the Reassigned Numbers Database, and it has NOT been disconnected since the `lastKnownConnectionDate`.
`noData` - the number and a permanent disconnect date are not contained in the Reassigned Numbers Database. `noData` value is treated as `disconnected` value in the rules related to outbound communications.

externalId.description:
A lender's identifier for an object. After the object is successfully created, a lender can use ID or externalId identifiers to fetch the object.

To fetch the object using externalId you need to add `ext-` to the URL.

Note: Don't add ext- to the identifier value. For example: if the external identifier is `ABCDE`, then pass externalId=ACBCE and NOT ext-ABCDE when creating the object.

name.description: Full name of a third-party contact. Only applicable for third-party contacts, such as `spouse`, `parent`, etc.

value.description:
The value of a contact. This attribute should be used for all contact types
except for address, which has dedicated attributes such as
`addressLine1`, `addressCity`, etc. You should use either `value`
or `address` attributes depending on the contact type. For example,
`+14155552671` for a contact type=`phone`. Or, `john.smith@domain.com`
for a contact type=`email`. We'll validate the format based on the contact type.

valid.description:
Identifies a contact as valid or invalid. A contact can become invalid for multiple reasons, such as wrong format,
invalid email domain, etc. This attribute can be changed by you or by Peach. If no value is provided, we will assume valid=`true`.

verified.description:
Identifies a contact as verified or unverified. Contact can be verified
via a verification code, verification link or a first-party outbound call.
The value can be changed by you or by Peach. If no value is provided, we
will assume verified=`false`.

receiveTextMessages.description: Allows using a `phone` type contact for text messaging.

authorizedThirdParty.description:
Signifies an individual authorized by the borrower to make purchases and
changes against the account that is the subject of the collection efforts.
This attribute is not applicable to contacts with affiliation `self`.

powerOfAttorney.description:
Designated an individual with power of attorney. This attribute can only
be set by agents upon receiving appropriate documents from the borrower
or their attorney. This attribute is not applicable to contacts with affiliation `self`.

name.description:
Represents special consents or permissions. Consents are typically
given in writing to a lender.

- `electronicComms` - Set to `revoked` if the borrower hasn't consented or
has revoked consent to electronic communications. Default: `consented`

- `contactPersonWork` - A borrower or their attorney gave a written
consent to contact borrower’s employer for debt collection. Default: `revoked`

- `contactPersonRepByAttorney` - Indicates whether a lender is
allowed to contact a borrower represented by an attorney. If the attorney
gave a written consent to interact with the borrower, set
to `consented`. Default: `revoked`

- `contactPersonUnusualTime` - A person or their attorney gave
written consent to interact with the person at some unusual
place or time. Default: `revoked`

- `autodialedColl` - Consent to receive autodialed or pre-recorded
collection calls from creditors or third-party collectors. If no
value is provided, we will assume autodialedColl is `consented`. For
more information read Telephone Consumer Protection Act (TCPA).
Default: `consented`

- `executeWageAssignment` - Set to `consented` if the person consented to
execute a wage assignment agreement. Default: `revoked`

- `contactServicememberUnitOrCommander` - Consent to contact a
servicemember's military unit or chain of command to collect on a debt. Default: `revoked`.

value.description: Consent can be granted and revoked by a borrower.

externalId.description:
A lender's identifier for an object.

After the object is successfully created, a lender can use ID or externalId identifiers to fetch the object.

To fetch the object using externalId you need to add `ext-` to the URL.

Note: Don't add ext- to the identifier value. For example: if the external identifier is `ABCDE`, then pass externalId=ACBCE and NOT ext-ABCDE when creating the object.

name.description: The name of the label. This is the name that will appear in the agent (and admin, if applicable) portals.

description.description:
An optional description of the loan label. Typically used to store additional details or
an explanation about the label. Not displayed in any user interfaces.

loanIds.description: The list of loans which have the specified label(s) and match the path and query parameters.
The unique identifier of the loans. Can be Peach or lender's external identifier.

BorrowerCampaign.description:
A borrower campaign is part of a system for exporting contact information
for borrowers or sending communications to borrowers in bulk.

A borrower campaign objects represents this campaign. It contains the information specifying from
where a campaign derives its input borrower list, a schedule for execution, and the format
for exporting that list.

The input borrowers list is defined by a Redash query. See `redashQueryUrl` for details.

anyOf.title: General
anyOf.description:
The URL of the Redash query from which to build the input.

The URL should look like https://{YOUR_REDASH_DOMAIN}/queries/{QUERY_ID}.

The output of this query is fed into the campaign system as input for
each new campaign run. (Note that the query is re-run on each campaign run.)

The query must produce a query result with at least the column `borrowerId`, e.g.:

```
borrowerId
4,
5,
...
````

Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
database IDs (integers).

For a detailed description of how to format your query result see other options
for this `redashQueryUrl` property.

anyOf.title: bulkSender
anyOf.description: Running a campaign with a bulk sender. The campaign bulk sender takes a Redash query result and maps each row to a call to the `/communcator/send` endpoint. ## Passing Custom Context Variables To pass data to the `context` field of the `/communcator/send` endpoint, you can include `context.<...>` prefixed fields in the query result. A query result which looks like this: ``` borrowerId,context.animal,context.utensil 100,bear,spoon 103,beaver,fork ... ``` ...will end up in requests to `/communicator/send` endpoint like: ``` { "borrowerId": "BO-XXXX-XXXX", // 100 "context": { "animal": "bear", "utensil": "spoon" } } ``` and ``` { "borrowerId": "BO-YYYY-YYYY", // 103 "context": { "animal": "beaver", "utensil": "fork" } } ``` ## Calculated Context Variables Certain preconfigured interaction subjects will automatically have their contexts populated if they are provided with the appropriate input data. For instance, a bulk sender with `autopayEnableReminder` subject will automatically have these variables calculated and passed as context to `/communicator/send`: `paymentDate`, `paymentAmount` and `overdueAmount`. For details on an individual interaction subject's requirements see the other options for this `redashQueryUrl` property.

anyOf.title: bulkSender: paymentDueDateReminder
anyOf.description:
Running a campaign with a bulk sender subject of `paymentDueDateReminder`:

These messages are intended to remind a borrower they have a payment due.

## Query Result Formatting
The Redash query results should look like:

```
borrowerId,loanId,loanPeriodId,
100,200,300,
103,205,305,
...
```

> Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
database IDs (integers).

## Calculated Context Variables

The following context variables are automatically calculated and passed to the
`context` field of `/communcator/send`: `overdueAmount`, `paymentDate`, `paymentDays`, `paymentAmount`, `fulfilledAmount`, `remainingAmount`.

## Targeting
You may select any borrower-loan and loan period. You MUST only select
loan periods in the future.

*WARNING:* Minimal sanity-checking is performed on which borrower-loan and
loan periods are selected. If you select invalid values, e.g., a loan period ID
in the past, then a message may still be sent.

anyOf.title: bulkSender: loanOverdueNthNotice
anyOf.description:
Running a campaign with a bulk sender subject of `loanOverdue{Nth}Notice`:

These messages are intended to remind a borrower of overdue loans.

## Query Result Formatting
The Redash query results should look like:

```
borrowerId,loanId
100,200,
103,205,
...
```

> Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
database IDs (integers).

## Calculated Context Variables

The following context variables are automatically calculated and passed to the
`context` field of `/communcator/send`: `overdueAmount`, `daysOverdue`.

## Targeting
You MUST select borrower-loans which are in an overdue state.

*WARNING:* Minimal sanity-checking is performed on which borrower-loan you are targeting.
If you select an invalid borrower-loan, e.g., a loan that is not overdue
then a message may still be sent.

anyOf.title: bulkSender: autopayPaymentReminder
anyOf.description:
Running a campaign with a bulk sender subject of `autopayPaymentReminder`:

These messages are intended to remind borrowers of upcoming payments
scheduled via the autopay system.

## Query Result Formatting
The Redash query results should look like:

```
borrowerId,loanId
100,200,
103,205,
...
```

> Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
database IDs (integers).

## Calculated Context Variables

The following context variables are automatically calculated and passed to the
`context` field of `/communcator/send`: `overdueAmount`, `paymentDate`, `paymentDays`, `paymentAmount`, `fulfilledAmount`, `remainingAmount`.

## Targeting
You MUST provide any target borrower-loans. For performance reasons you
should try to target loans which have autopay enabled.

If autopay is enabled for the given borrower-loan combination specified in
the query results row, then a message is sent if and only if there is
an upcoming scheduled payment configured. A message is only sent for the *next*
upcoming scheduled payment. The message will send regardless of how far in the future
the next upcoming payment date is.

*WARNING:* Minimal sanity-checking is performed on which borrower-loan you are targeting.
If you select an invalid borrower-loan, e.g., a loan paid in full, a message
may still be sent.

anyOf.title: bulkSender: loginFirstPaymentReminder
anyOf.description:
Running a campaign with a bulk sender subject of `loginFirstPaymentReminder`:

These messages are intended to remind borrowers of their first
upcoming payment if they have not yet logged into the borrower
portal.

## Query Result Formatting
The Redash query results should look like:

```
borrowerId,loanId
100,200,
103,205,
...
```

> Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
database IDs (integers).

## Calculated Context Variables

No context variables are automatically calculated.

## Targeting
You MUST provide any target borrower-loans.

*WARNING:* Minimal sanity-checking is performed on which borrower-loan you are targeting.
If you select an invalid borrower-loan, e.g., a loan with payments already made, a message
may still be sent.

anyOf.title: bulkSender: autopayEnableReminder
anyOf.description:
Running a campaign with a bulk sender subject of `autopayEnableReminder`:

These messages remind borrowers to enable autopay.

## Query Result Formatting
The Redash query results should look like:

```
borrowerId,loanId
100,200,
103,205,
...
```

> Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
database IDs (integers).

## Calculated Context Variables

No context variables are automatically calculated.

## Targeting
You MUST provide any target borrower-loans.

*WARNING:* No sanity-checking is performed on which borrower-loan you are targeting.
If you select a borrower that has already enabled autopay, they will still receive
a message here.

anyOf.title: bulkSender: autopayAmountChanged
anyOf.description:
Running a campaign with a bulk sender subject of `autopayAmountChanged`:

These messages inform borrowers that the amount of their
*next* autopayment has increased.

## Query Result Formatting
The Redash query results should look like:

```
borrowerId,loanId
100,200,
103,205,
...
```

> Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
database IDs (integers).

## Calculated Context Variables

The following context variables are automatically calculated and passed to the
`context` field of `/communcator/send`: `extraCharge`, `paymentDueDate`, `paymentAmount`.

## Targeting
You MUST provide any target borrower-loans.

Loans will be skipped if they do not have an upcoming autopay or it is detected
that `extraCharge == 0`.

anyOf.title: bulkSender: futurepayPaymentDueReminder
anyOf.description:
Running a campaign with a bulk sender subject of `futurepayPaymentDueReminder`:

These messages inform borrowers that there is an upcoming
future payment scheduled. (Note that "autopay" is a separate concept from
scheduled future payment. e.g., a borrower can schedule a single future payment
instead of enabling autopay.)

## Query Result Formatting
The Redash query results should look like (targetPaymentDate is optional):

```
borrowerId,loanId,targetPaymentDate
100,200,2023-01-01,
103,205,,
...
```

> Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
> database IDs (integers).
> Note that `targetPaymentDate` is optional and if it is `null` or not included
> then the message will be sent for only the *next* upcoming scheduled payment.

## Calculated Context Variables

The following context variables are automatically calculated and passed to the
`context` field of `/communcator/send`: `paymentDate`, `paymentAmount`, `overdueAmount`

## Targeting
You MUST provide any target borrower-loans.

Loans will be skipped if they do not have an scheduled future payment.

anyOf.title: bulkSender: loanRightToCurePersonalUnsecured
anyOf.description:
Running a campaign with a bulk sender subject of `loanRightToCurePersonalUnsecured`:

These messages inform borrowers that their loan is overdue and they need to
take action to prevent charge-off.

## Query Result Formatting
The Redash query results should look like:

```
borrowerId,loanId
100,200,
103,205,
...
```

> Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
> database IDs (integers).

## Calculated Context Variables

The following context variables are automatically calculated and passed to the
`context` field of `/communcator/send`: `chargeOffDate`,`daysOverdue`,`daysToChargeOff`,`overdueBalance`.

## Targeting
You MUST provide any target borrower-loans.

Loans will be skipped if it is not overdue. Loans will be skipped if they are already
in a `chargedOff` state.

anyOf.title: bulkSender: cardExpiresReminder
anyOf.description:
Running a campaign with a bulk sender subject of `cardExpiresReminder`:

These messages inform borrowers that their payment card will expire.

## Query Result Formatting
The Redash query results should look like (lastFour is optional):

```
borrowerId,loanId,lastFour
100,200,1234
103,205,5678
...
```

> Note that it is valid to use either public IDs (like `BO-XXXX-XXXX`) or internal
> database IDs (integers).
> Note that `lastFour` is an optional column

## Calculated Context Variables

The following context variables are automatically calculated and passed to the
`context` field of `/communcator/send`: `month`, `year`.

## Targeting
You MUST provide any target borrower-loans.

Loans will be skipped if there are no cards associated with the loan which are
expiring *in the future*. If there are multiple cards associated with a loan expiring,
then the *next* expiring card is selected.

You MAY optionally provide a `lastFour` column in your query results, in which
case a card's last four digits must match that, or the loan will be skipped.

redashApiKey.description:
The API key to use for querying Redash.

You can find your API key at https://{YOUR_REDASH_DOMAIN}/users/me.

schedule.description:
The schedule to run a campaign on, given in Peachy crontab time
specification format.

Peachy crontab is an extension to crontab(5) that adds a
time specification value 'P', which means "Peach
decides". Currently, the minute and hour fields must be 'P' (i.e.,
you can not specify the time of the day), and the
day-of-month, month, and day-of-week fields must NOT be 'P'.

Some examples of Peachy crontabs:
  `P P 1,15 * *`: Run on the 1st and 15th of every month
  `P P * * wed`: Run every Wednesday
  `P P * 10 *`: Run every day in October

See https://crontab.guru/ for an expression builder.

If `null` the campaign does not run on a schedule (and therefore
must be run manually).

contactExporterId.description: The ID of an existing contact exporter to use for this campaign.

bulkSenderId.description: The ID of an existing bulk sender to use for this campaign.

sftpSettings.description:
The SFTP settings to be used to upload the results of a campaign run.

At the completion of a campaign run, if these settings are specified, they
are used to SFTP upload the files created as a result of the run.

These files include the exporter contacts .csv file and the log file.

The file names for these files will be:
- `{CAMPAIGN_ID}_{TIMESTAMP}_query_results.csv`
- `{CAMPAIGN_ID}_{EXPORTER_ID}_{TIMESTAMP}.csv`
- `{CAMPAIGN_ID}_{EXPORTER_ID}_{TIMESTAMP}.csv`
- `{CAMPAIGN_ID}_{EXPORTER_ID}_{TIMESTAMP}_log.txt`

host.description:
Host of the SFTP server with which to connect.

This may be specified like `{hostname}` or `{hostname}:{port}`.

If no port is specified the default SFTP port of 22 is assumed.

password.description: Note: the password field is encrypted-at-rest using the secure tokenizer.

cdDir.description:
The directory to change to (via `cd`) on the server before performing the
file upload.

BorrowerCampaignRunStatus.description: The status of a campaign run

BorrowerCampaignRun.description:
A borrower campaign "run" is an object representing an execution of a campaign.
It contains metadata about the status of the execution of the run and the results
of the run, which are generally exported contact lists and logs.

borrowerCampaignId.description: The ID of the borrower campaign to which this campaign run belongs.

availableFiles.description: The list of files currently available for download via this campaign run's `.../download` endpoint.

ContactExporter.description:
A contact exporter represents instructions on how to transform a
campaign run into a finalized list.

contactMatchingCriteria.description:
Settings for selecting a person’s contact information to include in export data. An empty attribute
is not allowed. Multiple attributes act as “AND” filters. E.g., a contact must
have an affiliation of “self” AND a label of “home” in order to match. If multiple
values are specified for an attribute, the values act as “OR” conditions within that attribute.

label.description: Array of person's contact labels. If multiple values are provided, values act as OR condition.

contactType.description: Array of person's contact types. Currently only "Phone" is supported.

affiliation.description: Array of person's contact affiliations. If multiple values are provided, values act as OR condition.

status.description:
Array of person's contact statuses. The values of this enumeration are used for getting the contact
with the highest priority. Items with lower number have higher priority. If multiple values are
provided, values act as OR condition.

columnSettings.description:
A list of dictionaries where each dictionary specifies a field to include as a column in the result
file along with optional output column name.

field.description: The field name of the data source. All fields are relative to _the contact_. i.e., the `id` field is the contact's ID, and not the associated borrower's ID. Note that fields prefixed with `borrower...` are fields which will always return information about this contact's associated borrower. For example, if the contact has `affiliation=spouse`, the `borrowerDateOfBirth` field will contain the borrower's date of birth, and NOT contain the borrower's spouse's date of birth. Only the following values are currently supported: ## Contact Metadata - `affiliation` - This contact's affiliation with the borrower. For example, if this were a borrower's lawyer contact, this value will be `legal`; Or, if this were a borrower's own contact it would be `self`. - `externalId` - This contact's external ID, or `null` if it does not have one. - `id` - This contact's ID—starts with `CT-...` - `label` - This contact's label—one of: `personal`, `home`, `work`, `military` - `name` - This contact's full name. - `status` - This contact's status—one of: `primary`, `secondary`, `additional`, `archived` ## Associated Borrower Metadata - `borrowerCrmUrl` - The associated borrower's management page URL in the Peach CRM - `borrowerDateOfBirth` - The associated borrower's date of birth, formatted like YYYY/MM/DD - `borrowerFirstName` - The associated borrower's first name. - `borrowerId` - The associated borrower's ID—starts with `BO-...`. - `borrowerLastName` - The associated borrower's last name. - `borrowerMaidenLastName` - The associated borrower's maiden name. - `borrowerMiddleName` - The associated borrower's middle name. - `borrowerPortalUrl` - The associated borrower's loan portal page URL - `borrowerPreferredFirstName` - The associated borrower's preferred first name. - `borrowerPrimaryAddress` - The primary address for the associated borrower. ## Collections Related - `collectionsAmountOverdue` - The total amount overdue for the active collections case, or blank if there is no active case. (This is the same value as in the `totalAmounts.overdue` field of the active collections case.) - `collectionsCaseCrmUrl` - A URL to the active collection case in the Peach CRM for the associated borrower; or blank if there is no active case. - `consentsToAutodialedColl` — The value for the `AutodialedColl` consent. This consent identifies if the associated borrower has consented to received autodialed collection calls. If consent has been granted this value is `"consented"`, otherwise `"revoked"`. (If there was an error fetching this information this field could be `"error"`.) See Consents for more information on consents.

outputName.description:
Name of the column to use in exported CSV file. If not specified, then
use the `field` name.

checkCanInteractData.description: If set, screen contacts through Compliance Guard using provided data.

isAutodialed.description:
`true` if an autodialed call. If no value is passed, we'll assume
isAutodialed=`false`—meaning a manual call was performed.

For more information on why this is important reference the
Telephone Consumer Protection Act (TCPA).

externalId.description:
A lender's identifier for a resource.

After the resource is successfully created, a lender can use the Peach assigned ID OR
the `externalId` identifiers to fetch the resource.

### Fetching with `externalId`:

To fetch a resource using an `externalId`, you MUST use the prefix `ext-` in the URL.

For example, a loan with an external identifier of `ABCDE` would be referenced like `/api/people/BO-FAKE-IDNT/loans/ext-ABCDE`.

### Creating with `externalId`:

To create a resource with an external identifer, you MUST NOT use the prefix `ext-`.

For example, if the external identifier should be `ABCDE`, then pass
`{ externalId: "ACBCE", ... }` in the request body.

CaseConfigType.title: caseConfigType
CaseConfigType.description: Summary information about the case type configuration which produced the case.

CaseCreationProcedure.description:
The field indicating which procedure originally created this case.

This is used to mark when a system like, for instance, Compliance Guard 
automatically created a case, which allows a case to be 
differentiated from, for instance, manually created ones.

id.description: The unique identifier of the user who performed the action.

name.description: The name of the user who performed the action.

descriptor.description:
Short description of the user who performed the action.
Different systems may have different data available for a given user. The descriptor
gives the best available short description of the user. It prefers names, then email addresses,
then related IDs.

e.g.,
- "Borrower Tim Jones"
- "Borrower BO-ABCD-1234"
- "Peach Service User"
- "Agent Abigail Smith"
- "Agent bob@acme.com"
- "Agent EM-ABCD-1234"

ProcessStatus.title: status
ProcessStatus.description:
The status of a process. This can be updated by a lender or by Peach.

`initiated` - The lender was notified by a borrower, but no documents or
evidence have been provided yet. A grace period can be set.

`processing` - Peach matched the borrower to an external data source, or the
lender started an internal process to handle a case, complaint or dispute.

`completed` - The lender completed an internal process, case, complaint or
dispute. For example:
- A borrower reported identity theft, and the lender reviewed documents
and approved the claim.
- A borrower requested a verification of debt in writing, and the lender sent an email with
details.
- Peach notified the lender about a new bankruptcy, and the lender reviewed
the case and deemed it to be a false positive.

`canceled` - The lender couldn't complete an internal process and canceled
it. This can happen for various reasons, such as lack of
sufficient documentation.

`reopened` - The lender re-opened the case.

MatchDetails.title: matchDetails
MatchDetails.description: The fields that are for what levels the person is matched to a monitoring hit (i.e. bankruptcy)

CustomFields.title: customFields
CustomFields.description:
Custom fields are JSON key-value mappings. They are described by a `customFieldSchemas` property in the corresponding
`caseType`. This means that arbitrary fields cannot be added to in-flight cases.

objectType.description: Types of objects that can be associated with the case.

objectId.description: Peach unique identifier for the associated object.

CaseAssociation.title: caseAssociation
CaseAssociation.description: Objects are related to case, and may have an optional label.

relation.description:
This is only applicable to `objectType=case` associations.

The way to read the relation is: `caseId` `relation` `objectId`.
For example:

- There is an existing `caseId=111` `caseType=identityTheft`.
- There is an existing `caseId=222` `caseType=debtValidation`.
- The identity theft case is blocking verification of debt. To represent that relation:
- `caseId=111` in path parameter.
- `relation=blocks` in body.
- `objectId=222` in body.

createReviewTask.description:
If `true` create a task of type `reviewAutoCreatedCase`. Note: this field is NOT saved
on the case resource; it just creates a task.

people.description: List of borrower IDs associated with case

borrowerIds.description: List of borrower IDs associated with case

name.description:
The case name. If a name is not provided, the case name is taken from the case type.
For example, Identity Theft.

createdByUser.description:
Details of the user responsible for creating the case.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

owningEmployeeId.description:
The ID of the employee that owns this case. The case owner is the
preferred employee to process tasks relating to this case.

Case ownership must be enabled via setting
`tasks.enableCaseOwnership` to `true` in the company configuration.

autoCreated.description: True if the case was created by some automated method—i.e., not by a human.

statusUpdatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last status update.

statusUpdatedBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for last updating the case status.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

outcomeUpdatedBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for last updating the case outcome.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

snoozedAt.description: Time when the case was snoozed.

snoozedUntil.description: Date until the case is snoozed.

matchToDataSource.description: `true` if the person's details have been matched to an external data source.

lenderAck.description: The lender has acknowledged the auto-generated case.

workflowId.description: The ID of the workflow instance assigned to this case.

escalatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the case was escalated.

escalatedTeamId.description: The ID of the Team to which the case should be escalated.

escalatedEmployeeId.description: The ID of the Employee to which the case should be escalated.

escalationIsUrgent.description:
Boolean representing if this escalation is urgent. `null` if there
is no escalation.

creatingSupercaseId.description: The ID of the supercase if the case was created by one.

lastViewedAt.description:
The date-time at which the case was last viewed. 

i.e., when this case last had this request made:
`POST /api/people/{borrowerId}/cases/{caseId}/views`

lastViewedBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for last viewing the case.

i.e., the user which last made the request:
`POST /api/people/{borrowerId}/cases/{caseId}/views`

lastSubresourceUpdatedAt.description:
The date-time at which the case or it's subresources were last updated.

A case or case's subresources are considered updated when:

- an attribute of a Case is changed directly—e.g., it's name.
- a Snooze, Do Not Interact, Document Upload Link, or Note is created, deleted or updated.
- an Interaction, Document, Loan, or Transaction is associated or
  unassociated with the case.

lastSubresourceUpdatedBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for last updating a case or a case's subresources.
Can be an agent or automated system process. 

See `lastSubresourceUpdatedAt` for a description of subresources.

openedAt.description:
Represents the original date-time a case was created, either within 
Peach or in an external system. For cases created directly in Peach CRM, `openedAt` is identical to `createdAt`,
marking the initiation within Peach. Conversely, for cases migrated from external sources, `openedAt` reflects 
the time the case was originally established in the external system. The timestamp must include a timezone (or UTC offset).

owningEmployee.description:
Meta data about the owning employee of the case. The owning employee is the
preferred employee to process tasks relating to this case.

id.description: The ID of the employee that owns this case.

displayName.description:
The display name of the employee that owns this case. The display name is the full name 
of the employee or, if not available, the employee's email.

courtCaseFiledDate.description:
The bankruptcy court filing date. This is also when ‘automatic stay’
is invoked and creditors must stop calling borrowers or making
attempts to collect on his or her debt.

courtCaseNumber.description:
The unique identifier the courts use during the filing and review of
the bankruptcy.

courtCaseChapter.description:
The bankruptcy chapter code. One of four common types we support at
this time.

courtCaseDebtorDisposition.description: The outcome of the bankruptcy case decided by the court.

courtCaseDebtorDispositionDate.description: Date on which the disposition was decided by the court.

courtCaseLastStatus.description:
The latest-reported bankruptcy case status, not case outcome, as it
appears in the court.

courtCaseLastStatusUpdatedDate.description: Date on which the latest status of the bankruptcy case was updated.

courtCaseClosedDate.description: Date the bankruptcy case closed, and the case is no longer on the court docket.

creditorClaimDeadlineDate.description: The date a lender has to file a claim to be eligible for any bankruptcy proceeds.

anticipatedCaseCompletionDate.description:
In a bankruptcy chapter that leverages a reorganization and a new
payment plan (i.e. Chapter 13), record when the last payment is
expected to be received. This will trigger reminders to close out
the case.

listedOutstandingDebt.description:
When a bankruptcy is filed, the borrower lists all the creditors/loans
he/she knows to be outstanding. Sometimes he/she may forget to list
a loan/creditor, in which case the creditor may want to file a claim
to ensure that the loan is added to the list of accounts to include
in the bankruptcy.

interactionId.description: ID for the interaction that resulted in the case being opened

noticeReceivedDate.description: The written notification date, or oral notice as mandated by each state, of the cease communications. This is when the legal timeline begins.

maidenLastName.description: A person's maiden name, if applicable.

preferredFirstName.description:
A person's preferred first name. This name will be used for interactions
like emails, text messages, outbound calls, online portal, etc.
If no preferred name is provided, `firstName` will be used.

originalValue.description: The original value for name before an update.

Deceased.title: deceased
Deceased.description: Object describing a deceased borrower case

deceasedName.description: The name as reported by the data source.

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth as reported by the data source.

dateOfDeath.description: The date of death as reported by the data source.

dateOfDeathByAgent.description: The date of death as recorded by the agent.

exactDateOfDeathUnknown.description: In some cases, the exact date of death is unknown. When `exactDateOfDeathUnknown` is true, the `dateOfDeath` is only accurate to the month and year specified.

deceasedAddress.description: The address as reported by the data source.

deceasedNoticeReceivedDate.description:
The date we became aware of the consumer’s death. This is not the date of death.
This notice is received from our internal system.

deceasedNoticeReceivedDateByAgent.description: The date you became aware of the consumer’s death. This is not the date of death.

representativeOfEstateContactId.description:
Decedent account holder’s contact ID. It can be a legal representative,
or an appointed representative by the deceased.

representativeOfEstateContact.description: Contact details of the legal representative.

disputeNotice.description: ID for the interaction that resulted in the dispute case being opened

noticeReceivedDate.description:
The first time a Direct Dispute Notice was received from the borrower.
This is when the legal timeline begins.

disputeConfirmedReason.description: The dispute confirmed reason is only used when a case is confirmed as disputed.

disasterNumber.description:
Sequentially assigned number used to designate an event or incident
declared as a disaster. For more information on the disaster
process, www.fema.gov.

paProgramDeclared.description:
Denotes whether the Public Assistance program was declared for this
disaster. For more information on the program,
please visit: www.fema.gov.

hmProgramDeclared.description:
Denotes whether the Hazard Mitigation program was declared for this
disaster. For more information on the program,
please visit: www.fema.gov.

stateCode.description: The name or phrase describing the U.S. state, district, or territory.

fyDeclared.description: The fiscal year the disaster was declared.

disasterType.description:
Two character code that defines if the disaster is a Major Disaster
Declaration (DR), Emergency Declaration (EM), Fire Management
Assistance Declaration (FM), or Fire Suppression Authorization (FS).
For more information on the disaster process,
please visit: www.fema.gov.

incidentType.description:
Type of incident such as fire or flood. The incident type will
affect the types of assistance available. For more information on
incident types, please visit: www.fema.gov.

disasterCloseOutDate.description: Date all financial transactions for all programs are completed.

placeCode.description:
A unique code system FEMA uses internally to recognize
locations that takes the numbers “99” + the 3-digit county
FIPS code. There are some declared locations that don’t have
recognized FIPS county codes in which case we assigned a
unique identifier.

We map person's home zip code to FIPS code.

declaredCountyArea.description:
The name or phrase describing the U.S. county that was
included in the declaration.

lastRefresh.description: Date the record was last updated in the FEMA API data store.

reportReceivedDate.description:
The first time an identity theft report was received from the borrower.
This is when the legal timeline begins.

claimRejectedReason.description:
The rejected claim reason is only used when a case is deemed
‘not validated.’ Only one reason is associated with a set of associated loans.

MilitaryDuty.title: militaryDuty
MilitaryDuty.description: Object describing an active military duty case.

dutyStartDate.description: The duty start date. This is populated when Peach gets the first hit from the SCRA database.

dutyEndDate.description:
The duty end date. This is normally populated when duty ends. During ongoing duty, the
value will remain empty.

dutyServiceComponentDescription.description: Description of DoD's classification of service positions

dutyCertificateId.description: The certificate identifier used to locate a certificate in the certificate file.

dutyCertificateFile.description: The unique identifier for the downloaded certificate file from monitoring service.

dutyServiceMatchDate.description: The date that DMDC completed the SCRA match.

onDutyProtectionEligibility.description: The borrower's eligibility for the federal SCRA and/or state protections

claimingSCRArights.description: The borrower is claiming SCRA rights and protections

memberOfPennsylvaniaNationalGuard.description: The borrower is a member of Pennsylvania National Guard.

requestDate.description: Date the debt validation was requested.

currentStateResidence.description: Borrower's current state of residence. Use two character US state name abbreviations.

newYorkStateCity.description: If the borrower is a New York state resident, specify the city.

isFirstTimeCollection.description:
Indicates if this is the first time a collections case-type has
been created for this borrower. Canceled cases are not
considered.

overdueOrAcceleratedLoanCount.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `numberOfLoansOverdueOrAccelerated`.

Number of associated overdue or accelerated loans.

numberOfLoansOverdueOrAccelerated.description: Number of associated overdue or accelerated loans.

daysOverdue.description: Maximum number of days overdue among overdue or accelerated loans.

paid.description: Total amount paid on overdue and accelerated loans.

expected.description: Total amount expected to be paid on overdue and accelerated loans.

overdue.description: Total amount overdue on overdue or accelerated loans.

attempted.description:
The number of attempted case-associated phone interactions
with the borrower. Attempted statuses are those not in the
list of `scheduled`, `canceled`, `inProgress`, or
`succeeded`.

successful.description:
The number of successful case-associated phone interactions
with the borrower.

total.description: The total number of payment attempts (transactions) among overdue and accelerated loans.

failed.description: The number of failed payments (transactions) among overdue and accelerated loans.

total.description: The total number of payment attempts (transactions) among overdue and accelerated loans.

failed.description: The number of failed payments (transactions) among overdue and accelerated loans.

date.description: The date of the last successful payment (transaction) among overdue and accelerated loans.

amount.description: The amount of the last successful payment (transaction).

nextPayment.description: Closest upcoming payment due of overdue and accelerated loans.

amount.description: Upcoming payment amount.

count.description:
How many contacts were made in the last period, ending
today.

left.description:
How many contacts are left according to the intensity
configuration. `null` if this is not configured.

period.description: The length of the time period, in days.

date.description: The date on the contacts were made.

count.description: How many contacts were made on the given day.

promiseToPayDate.description:
Per borrower promise agents can select a date. Updated each time a new
promise to pay is made by the borrower. A borrower should only make
one promise to pay at a time.

promiseToPayAmount.description: Agent can enter the amount that a borrower promised to pay.

promiseToPayKept.description:
Agents can change the value. Partially means that a borrower actually
paid less than promised and therefore the borrower is still in
collection process.

cityStateProvincePostalCode.description: City, state, province, or postal code.

OFACSanctionedIndividual.title: oFACSanctionedIndividual
OFACSanctionedIndividual.description: Keyword parameters unique to OFAC sanctioned individuals.

sdnName.description: Name of the Specially Designated National.

sdnDateOfBirthList.description: Dates of birth. The date may be partial. For example: 10 Dec 1948 or 1959.

sdnAkaList.description: List of AKA's, in the format of "LASTNAME, Firstname".

sdnPlaceOfBirthList.description: Places of birth. For example: Cuba.

sdnProgramList.description: List of sanction program names. For example: SDNTK or SDGT.

sdnNationalityList.description: List of nationalities. For example: Tunisia.

ofacActionsRequired.description: The list of standard punitive actions.

caseId.description: Peach identifier of the case. The case object contains more details about the dispute, e.g. evidence information such as supporting documents.

status.description:
The status of the dispute. `unsubmitted` is the only valid status for a new purchase dispute.

`unsubmitted` - The dispute is pending submission to a processor/network.

`submitted` - The dispute has been submitted to a processor/network.

`expired` - The dispute has expired.

`won` - The dispute is won.

`lost` - The dispute is lost.

`canceled` - The dispute was canceled. Only `unsubmitted` disputes can be canceled.

disputedAmount.description: The disputed amount. Can be less than the original purchase amount. Sum of disputed amounts cannot exceed the original purchase amounts (regardless of disputes outcomes).

repostedPurchaseId.description: The identifier of the reposted purchase. When a borrower loses a dispute, the lender normally creates a new purchase in the amount of the dispute.

description.description:
The description of the purchase. Purchases in authorized status are shown in borrower portal but NOT on statements.
Purchases in `pending` or `succeeded` status are shown in borrower portal and on statements.  At least one of the attributes,
`description` or `merchantName` must be passed

pointOfSaleType.description:
- `online` - the purchase was made online on a website or in a mobile application.
- `physical` - the purchase was made in a store with a physical card or instrument.
- `recurring` - the purchase was made as part of a subscription service.

categoryId.description: The category identifier of the purchase.

merchantId.description: The merchant identifier where the purchase was made.

merchantName.description: The merchant name where the purchase was made. At least one of the attributes, `description` or `merchantName` must be passed.

metadata.description: Store any type of key/value pairs in the form of a JSON dictionary.

isValidMerchantId.description:
`true` - if the merchant ID exists in Peach Merchants table.

`false` - if the merchant ID doesn't exist in Peach Merchants table.
Credit card lenders normally should not create merchants details in Peach and `isMerchantIdValid` attribute can be ignored.
Point of sale lenders normally have merchants details in Peach and can use `isMerchantIdValid` attribute as needed.

externalCardId.description: The card identifier that was used for the purchase.

originalCurrencyAmount.description: The amount of the purchase before currency conversion.

originalCurrencyCode.description: The currency in which the purchase was made before currency conversion. Three letters according to [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217).

conversionRate.description:
The conversion rate that was used to convert the purchase amount from the `originalCurrencyCode` to the line of credit main currency.
For example:
   - Line of credit main currency code = `USD`
   - `originalCurrencyCode=GBP`
   - `originalCurrencyAmount=200.45`
   - `conversionRate=1.33`

Then `amount = 200.45 * 1.33 = 266.59`.

merchantCategoryCode.description: The merchant category code of the card acceptor (merchant).

InternalRefundDetails.description:
The details of how a refund was applied:

 - The system will first deplete any non-due principal. This amount will be stored as `refundNonDuePrincipalAmount`.
 - If any refund amount is left to apply, the system will create a transaction of type `serviceCredit` and
`serviceCreditType=refund`. This transaction will be applied on the Draw level first and any leftover amount will
 be applied on the LOC level (based on the loan type waterfall configuration for payments). This amount will be stored as
  `refundTransactionAmount`.
 - Any unapplied refund amount will be recorded as credit to the borrower (also called `reimbursementAmount`.)

refundTransactionId.description: Reference to the transaction ID of type service credit and serviceCreditType=refund. This is Peach Public ID.

refundNonDuePrincipalAmount.description:
Amount of refund that was applied to reduce the non-due principal of the draw.
The total amount of refund is equal to `refundNonDuePrinicpalAmount + refundTransactionAmount`.

refundTransactionAmount.description:
Amount of refund that was applied to as a transaction to reduce other balances of the draw and potentially other draws.
The total amount of refund is equal to `refundNonDuePrinicpalAmount + refundTransactionAmount`.

PurchaseDeclineReason.description: The reason the purchase was declined

mainText.description: The main decline reason text that is shown to the borrower

mainScriptForRep.description: The main decline reason script that a customer service agent can provide to the borrower.

id.description: The unique identifier of the purchase.

externalId.description: The external unique identifier of the purchase.

displayId.description: The purchase ID to show in the UI (Peach public or external).

drawId.description: The unique identifier of the draw that the purchase belongs to.

lineOfCreditId.description: The unique identifier of the line of credit that the purchase belongs to.

authorizationPurchaseId.description:
Peach’s unique (or lender’s external identifier) for the authorization purchase. This attribute is used to reference an initial authorization, so
lenders know which captures (purchase object(s) in Peach) are related to the original authorization.

type.description:
- `regular` - a regular purchase made by the borrower. Increases draw's balance.
- `refund` - a refund of the purchase made in the past. Decreases draw's balance.
- `cashBack` - cash back given to the borrower by the issuing institution.

status.description:
- `authorized` - the purchase is authorized and not yet `settled`. Authorized purchases are included in `openToBuy`, `utilizationAmount`, and `availableCredit` calculations; however, authorizations are not written to the ledger and are not included in total outstanding loan balances.
- `settled` - the purchase was settled.
- `pending` - the purchase is pending. `pending` purchases increases the draw balance similar to `settled`. Pending status is used mainly
    for visuals and normally shown in Borrower Portal and on statements.
- `canceled` - the purchase was canceled. `canceled` purchases reduce the draw balance. A new purchase cannot be created in `canceled` status.
- `declined` - the purchase was declined. `declined` purchases reduce the draw balance if the status changes from `pending` to `declined`. A new purchase can be created in `declined`status for record purposes (it will not impact the draw balance).
- `disputed` - The purchase was disputed for full or partial amount. `disputed` status is a terminal state and once set cannot be changed to another status. This status can not be set manually. Submitting a purchase dispute will set the purchase's status to `disputed`.

amount.description: The amount of the purchase. The amount can be updated only if the purchase status is `pending` or `authorized`. The amount and status of a purchase may be changed on the same call.

originalAmount.description: The original amount of the purchase when it was created. If the purchase amount changes after creation, `originalAmount` will not change.

purchaseDate.description:
This value is equal to the date part of the `authorizedAt` converted to the product timezone (e.g. Eastern or Pacific).
If `authorizedAt` is null, this value is equal to the date part of the purchase's `createdAt` converted to the product timezone.

This attribute is deprecated on purchase creation and will not be used by the system.

originalPurchaseId.description:
Peach's unique or lender's external identifier. Typically used for purchases of type `refund` which allows the lender to
reference the original purchase being refunded. For authorizations, please see `authorizationPurchaseId` attribute.

declineReason.description: The reason the purchase was declined

eligibleDisputeAmount.description: The maximum amount eligible to be disputed. The amount is dynamic and can change depending on past disputes. Sum of disputed amounts cannot exceed the original purchase amounts (regardless of disputes outcomes).

metadata.description: Store any type of key/value pairs in the form of a JSON dictionary.

authorizedAt.description:
The timestamp when the purchase was `authorized`. This value can be set by lenders at the time of purchase creation.
If the value is not set by the lender, it will be populated based on `authorizedAt` (if it is non-null) otherwise `createdAt` for the corresponding `authorizationPurchaseId`.
If the value is not set by the lender and no `authorizationPurchaseId` is set, this value corresponds to `purchase.authorized` event.
If the purchase was never in `authorized` status and none of the prior conditions are met, this value will be null.

settledAt.description: The timestamp when the purchase was `settled`. Corresponds to `purchase.settled` event.

effectiveAt.description:
The effective timestamp when the purchase was applied in the ledger. `effectiveAt` is equal to the timestamp when the purchase is set to
`pending` or `settled` status, whichever comes first. Changing the `effectiveAt` via the `Update purchase` endpoint will trigger a replay
of the line of credit. Keep in mind that an existing statement might've included the purchase based on the existing `effectiveAt` value
and the interest was accrued based on the existing `effectiveAt`. `effectiveAt` can be updated only if the purchase is in `settled` or `pending` status.

canceledDate.description: Date when the order was canceled.

cancelPolicyProvided.description: Whether the borrower was provided with a cancellation policy by the merchant.

expectedDate.description: Date the borrower expected to receive the order.

productDescription.description: Description of the merchandise or service that was purchased.

productType.description:
Type of product purchased.

`merchandise` - Tangible goods such as appliances.

`service` - Intangible goods such as ski lessons or internet subscription.

returnStatus.description:
Result of borrower’s attempt to return the product.

`succeeded` - The merchant accepted the return.

`merchantRejected` - The merchant rejected the return.

returnedDate.description: Date when the order was returned or attempted to be returned.

cardStatementDocumentId.description: Copy of the card statement showing that the product had already been paid for.

cashReceiptDocumentId.description: Copy of the receipt showing that the product had been paid for in cash.

checkImageDocumentId.description: Image of the front and back of the check that was used to pay for the product.

originalPurchaseExternalId.description: External Purchase identifier that the disputed purchase is a duplicate of. If the two or more purchases that are copies of each other (aka have exact same details), this is the original undisputed one.

receivedDate.description: Date when the product was received.

returnDescription.description: Description of the borrower's attempt to return the product.

returnStatus.description:
Result of borrower’s attempt to return the product.

`succeeded` - The merchant accepted the return.

`merchantRejected` - The merchant rejected the return.

expectedDate.description: Date the borrower expected to receive the order.

productDescription.description: Description of the merchandise or service that was purchased.

productType.description:
Type of product purchased.

`merchandise` - Tangible goods such as appliances.

`service` - Intangible goods such as ski lessons or internet subscription.

productDescription.description: Description of the merchandise or service that was purchased.

productType.description:
Type of product purchased.

`merchandise` - Tangible goods such as appliances.

`service` - Intangible goods such as ski lessons or internet subscription.

canceledDate.description: Date when the order was canceled.

receivedDate.description: Date when the product was received.

purchaseId.description: Peach identifier of the disputed purchase. You must supply this field or the `purchaseExternalId` when creating a case.

purchaseExternalId.description: The external identifier of the disputed purchase.

purchaseDisputeId.description: Peach identifier of the dispute object that belongs to the purchase.

disputeReason.description:
The reason for filing the dispute.

`canceled` - Service or merchandise was canceled.

`serviceNotAsDescribed` - The service was not as described.

`merchandiseNotAsDescribed` - The merchandise was not as described.

`duplicate` - There were multiple copies of a charge for a single purchase, or the charge was paid by other means.

`fraudulent` - The borrower did not make the purchase.

`notReceived` - Merchandise or service was not received.

`other` - All other types of disputes.

evidenceExplanation.description: Description of why the borrower disputes the purchase.

bureauDisputeNotice.description: ID for the interaction that resulted in the dispute case being opened

disputeReceivedDate.description:
The date the dispute was received. This is the date the ACDV was
placed in the data furnisher's queue.

disputeCode1.description: The nature of the consumer's dispute.

responseDueDate.description:
The date by which an ACDV response must be received from a data
furnisher. After this date, the ACDV is removed from the queue
and the originating agency will take action per the
specifications of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA).

fcraInfo.description:
Contains a description of the FCRA-mandated relevant information
received from the consumer pertaining to this dispute. This is a
free-form text area.

responseCode.description:
A code that indicates the action the data furnisher wants the
originating agency to take in response to the dispute.

typeId.description: Unique identifier of the case type.

CaseEscalation.title: Case Escalation
CaseEscalation.description:
Mark a case as needing special attention from a particular team or employee.
Only one of `escalatedTeamId` or `escalatedEmployeeId` may be specified
at one time.

If neither `escalatedTeamId` nor `escalatedEmployeeId` are specified then the
latest escalation is canceled.

escalatedTeamId.description: Escalate the case to the team specified by this team ID.

escalatedEmployeeId.description: Escalate the case to the employee specified by this employee ID.

note.description:
Create a case note with this content explaining why
the escalation or de-escalation took place

isUrgent.description:
If `true` this escalation is urgent and tasks related to this case escalation
should jump to the front of the agents' queues.

CaseEscalationDetailed.title: Detailed Case Escalation
CaseEscalationDetailed.description: A Case Escalation with additional details.

caseId.description: The ID of the escalated case.

caseName.description: The friendly name given to a case.

escalationTargetName.description: The name of the team or employee the escalation was assigned to.

DoNotInteractTheme.description:
Theme(s) for which outbound interactions with a borrower are blocked. Use value
`all` for all themes. `all` doesn't include `opsAccountCredentials`.
For example, use `opsCollDebt` to stop debt collection interactions.
At least one of the attributes, `channel` or `theme`, must be provided.

DoNotInteractEndDate.description:
A future date when interaction restrictions will be lifted.
The value format is date only, without time. If today is `endDate`, the
restriction will remain until the end of day in the product timezone.
If no value is provided, `doNotInteract` will remain in effect until
`Remove do not interact` is called or `endDate` is set to a date in the past.

fromHour.description:
From hour in the borrower’s home address timezone. Value range is 0-23. 0=Midnight...23=11 PM.
`fromHour` must be smaller than `toHour`.

toHour.description:
To hour in the borrower’s home address timezone. Value range is 0-23. 0=Midnight...24=Midnight of following day.
`fromHour` must be smaller than `toHour`.

DoNotInteractUpdate.title: doNotInteract
DoNotInteractUpdate.description:
The only data that can be updated after creation of a `doNoInteract` are external reference and
the ending date.

caseId.description: Identifier of the case to which the `doNotInteract` belongs.

personId.description: Identifier of the borrower to which the `doNotInteract` belongs.

channels.description:
Channel(s) for which outbound interactions with a borrower are blocked.
Use value `all` for all channels.

themes.description:
Theme(s) for which outbound interactions with a borrower are blocked. Use value
`all` for all themes. `all` doesn't include `opsAccountCredentials`.
For example, use `opsCollDebt` to stop debt collection interactions.

source.description:
How the `DoNotInteract` instance was created. This is used by the internal case processing to determine
whether to stop blocking interactions when the `Case` changes state. This may not be returned by
default depending on your configuration.

The possible values are:

* `api`: created by an external user through an authorized HTTP request to the API
* `service`: created by internal server process, or an API call from a recognized Peach service within the
virtual private cloud (VPC)
* `manual`: created by SQL or manual entry, this is prevented except for rare maintenance situations.

daysOfWeek.description: A list of days of week. Valid range is 1-7. 1=Monday...7=Sunday. For example: `[1, 2, 4]`.

timezone.description: The time zone where the borrower is located. If provided, the time zone will be used for restriction. If not provided, the system will use the borrower's home address time zone.

timesOfDay.description: A list of times of day in hours resolution.

contactLabels.description:
A list of contact labels.
A person's mobile phone is labeled as `personal`.
A person's work phone is labeled as `work`.
A person's home phone is labeled as `home`.
A person's home address is labeled as `home`.

allOf.description:
Channel(s) and theme(s) for which interactions with a borrower are blocked.
Interactions with theme=`outOpsServicing` cannot be blocked since they
are typically initiated by a borrower.

startDate.description:
The start date for blocking interactions with a borrower. The value format is date
only, without time. The start date can be a future date.
If the value is not provided, or equal to today's date, or a date in the past, then the
`doNotIteract` will be effective as soon as we process the request.

NoteCategory.description: Specifies the nature of a Note

NoteResponse.title: A borrower, case, supercase or interaction note
NoteResponse.description: A borrower, case, supercase or interaction can have a note associated with it. Each note can only be associated with one of these objects.

caseId.description: Identifier of the case that the note belongs to.

supercaseId.description: Identifier of the supercase that the note belongs to.

interactionId.description: Identifier of the interaction that the note belongs to.

important.description: Set to `true` if the note is important.

pinned.description:
Specify that this note should be sorted to the top of the list
by default.

sensitiveData.description: Indicates whether the note contains sensitive information.

edited.description: Indicates whether the note was edited.

archived.description: Set to `true` if the note has been archived.

taskableInstruction.description: Set to `true` if the note is intended to be an instruction which creates a review task.

createdBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for creating the note.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

updatedBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for last updating the note.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

archivedBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for archiving the note.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

deletedBy.description: Latest user identifier who deleted the note.

by default.

edited.description: Indicates whether the note was edited.

ValidAddress.description: Identifies the address as valid or invalid.

allOf.description: Contains details about an entity that legally represents a borrower.

status.description: Legal representative's status.

phone.description:
The phone number of a legal entity. This should be provided in
[E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format.

otherPhone.description:
An additional phone number of a legal entity. This should be provided in
[E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format.

email.description: The email address of a legal entity.

otherEmail.description: An additional email address of a legal entity.

isExternal.description: A payment instrument marked `isExternal=true` is not verified and creates transactions for record purposes only. The `payment.instrument:external` permission is required to set this flag.

activeAt.description: The date and time at which the instrument was set to `active`.

inactiveAt.description: The date and time at which the instrument was set to `inactive`.

pendingAt.description: The date and time at which the instrument was set to `pending`.

failureReason.description: A failure code for the most recent transaction failure using this instrument.

failureDescriptionShort.description: Short text describing the failure reason. Normally displayed in UI.

failureDescriptionLong.description:
Detailed text describing the failure reason and any appropriate actions the borrower may take to fix the issue.
Normally displayed in UI.

externalId.description:
A lender's identifier for the instrument.

After the object is successfully created, a lender can use ID or externalId identifiers to fetch the object.

To fetch the object using externalId you need to add `ext-` to the URL.

Note: Don't add ext- to the identifier value. For example: if the external identifier is `ABCDE`, then pass externalId=ACBCE and NOT ext-ABCDE when creating the object.

status.description:
Status of the instrument. Can only be set if `isExternal=true`.

Statuses:

- `active` - the instrument can be charged.
- `pending` - the instrument is pending to be verified.
- `inactive` - the instrument is not active and cannot be charged.

When updating this field, only the following state transitions are allowed.

```
active --> inactive
pending --> active (only for payment instrument with isExternal=true)
pending --> inactive (only for payment instrument with isExternal=true)
inactive --> active (only for payment instrument with isExternal=true)
inactive --> pending (only for payment instrument with isExternal=true)
```

Note: if you update the status from `inactive` to `active` or `pending`,
the system will clear the following attributes: `inactiveReason`, `deletedAt`, `failureReason`,
`failureDescriptionShort`, `failureDescriptionLong`.

inactiveReason.description: The reason the instrument is inactive. Required when setting status=`inactive`.

verified.description:
Indicates whether the instrument has been verified.

User must have the `payment.instrument:skip.verification` permission to set this value to `true`, or
the payment instrument must be marked `isExternal=true`.

nickname.description: A nickname for the instrument. The nickname can be displayed in UI.

accountNumberLastFour.description:
The last two, three or four digits of the account number.
Normally, you should expect four digits. Two or three digits are returned when four digits are not available.

errorType.description: The error type. This describes the appropriate way to handle the error.

errorTypeByVendor.description: The error type as received from the vendor.

errorCodeByVendor.description: The error code as received from the vendor.

errorDescriptionInternal.description: The internal error description as received from the vendor.

errorDescriptionBorrower.description: The error description as received from the vendor for presentation to the borrower.

AccountLink.description: An object representing a link with a third party vendor (e.g. Plaid) that allows fetching additional account details.

accessToken.description: The vendor's access token for initial access. With Plaid, this can be the `public_token` provided by Plaid Link, or the `access_token` provided after exchanging the public token.

itemId.description: The vendor's item identifier. With Plaid, this is the `item_id`.

accountId.description: The identifier used to identify an account with the data vendor.

dataServices.description: A list of data services available with this link.

status.description: The status of the account link.

allOf.description: The most recent error that occurred while fetching data from this link.

errorCommunicationsSent.description: The number of times the user has been notified that the account link has failed and needs to be recreated.

lastErrorCommunicationAt.description: The date and time that the most recent error notification was sent to the user.

accountHolderType.description: Type of entity that is the account holder.

accountHolderName.description: For `personal` accounts, the full name of the account holder. For `business` accounts, the business name. This is not an account nickname. It should match the name on file for the account with the bank.

institutionName.description:
The name of the financial institution where this account resides. If empty, will default to the name associated
with the routing number.

accountNumber.description:
The full account number. Only provided if `showFullAccountNumber=true`.
User must have the `payment.instrument:read.sensitive` permission to get the full number.

cardType.description:
The type of card.

- For external payment instruments, this field is required, and does not require additional permissions.

- Otherwise, this field is not required, and using it requires permission `payment.instrument:force`.

cardNumberLastFour.description:
The last two, three or four digits of the card number.
Normally, you should expect four digits. Two or three digits are returned when four digits are not available.

cvv.description: The CVV, typically found on the back of the card.

expirationYear.description: The expiration year of the card.

expirationMonth.description: The expiration month of the card.

allOf.description: The billing address associated with the card. If `isExternal=false`, then `postalCode` is required.

cardNumber.description:
The full card number. Also called PAN. Only provided if `showFullAccountNumber=true`.
User must have the `payment.instrument:read.sensitive` permission to get the full number.

accountHolderType.description: Type of entity that is the account holder.

accountHolderName.description: For `personal` accounts, the full name of the account holder. For `business` accounts, the business name. This is not an account nickname. It should match the name on file for the account with the bank.

address.description: The address on the check. Typically located in the top left corner, under the account holder name(s).

payToTheOrderOfName.description:
The name of a person or organization designated to receive the funds,
such as "John Smith" or "Peach Finance, Inc". Defaults to "Cash",
used when you don't know the person or organization's exact name.

accountNumberLastFour.description:
The last two, three or four digits of the account number.
Normally, you should expect four digits. Two or three digits are returned when four digits are not available.

checkNumber.description: The check sequence number. Typically located in the top right corner of the check.

institutionName.description: The name of the bank where this account resides.

employeeId.description: The employee/borrower ID in the payroll system.

paySpecificDays.description:
The specific days on which paychecks are made. The allowed values for specific day(s) depends on the `payFrequency`.

 - `weekly` - provide one number in the valid range 1-7. 1=Monday...7=Sunday.
    For example: `[1]`.
 - `everyTwoWeeks` - provide one number in the valid range 1-14.
    First week: 1=Monday...7=Sunday.
    Second week: 8=Monday...14=Sunday.
    For example: `[1]`.
 - `twiceMonthly` - provide two numbers in the valid range 1-31. 1=first day of a month. Use `31` to indicate the last day of a month.
    For example: `[1, 15]` or `[15, 31]`.
 - `monthly` - provide one number in the valid range 1-31. 1=first day of a month. Use `31` to indicate the last day of a month.
    For example: `[1]`.

paycheckNetAmount.description: The amount of paycheck after taxes that is deposited to the borrower's bank account.

paymentNetworkMemberId.description: The borrower identifier in the payment network system.

institutionName.description: The name of the bank where this account resides.

routingNumber.description: The routing number from where the wire was sent.

wireNumber.description: The wire number. Must be unique.

institutionName.description: The name of the bank where this account resides.

accountNumber.description:
The account number.
If `isExternal=true` then the last two, three, or four digits of the account number can be provided.
Provide four digits if available, otherwise provide two or three digits.

sendNotice.description: When set to `true`, the system will send a `paymentMethodAdded` notice to the borrower.

cardNumber.description:
The card number.
If `isExternal=true` then only the last two, three, or four digits of the card number can be provided.
Provide four digits if available, otherwise provide two or three digits.

accountNumber.description:
The account number.
If `isExternal=true` then the last two, three, or four digits of the account number can be provided.
Provide four digits if available, otherwise provide two or three digits.

externalId.description:
A lender's identifier for the instrument.

After the object is successfully created, a lender can use ID or externalId identifiers to fetch the object.

To fetch the object using externalId you need to add `ext-` to the URL.

Note: Don't add ext- to the identifier value. For example: if the external identifier is `ABCDE`, then pass externalId=ACBCE and NOT ext-ABCDE when creating the object.

accessToken.description:
`public_token` provided by Plaid Link.

**NOTE**: Plaid Link tokens are associated with a specific Plaid API key. If you are performing a Plaid Link in your app/website
and pass it to the Peach API you will first need to set your Plaid API key in the Peach API. Please contact Peach Support
to get access to the Plaid API Key setting endpoint and instructions on how to use it.

If you wish to use your own Plaid Link token in the sandbox environment, please contact Peach Support as you might need
to configure your Plaid sandbox account in a certain way.

accountIds.description: List of Plaid account IDs selected by user, provided by Plaid Link

accountNumber.description:
The account number.
If `isExternal=true` then the last two, three, or four digits of the account number can be provided.
Provide four digits if available, otherwise provide two or three digits.

The account number from where the wire was sent. Must consist of only digits.
If `isExternal=true` then the last two, three, or four digits of the account number can be provided.
Provide four digits if available, otherwise provide two or three digits.

sendNotice.description: When set to `true`, the system will send a `paymentMethodUpdated` notice to the borrower.

dataServices.description: A list of data services available with this link.

lastErrorCommunicationAt.description: The date and time that the most recent error notification was sent to the user. When updated, `errorCommunicationsSent` is incremented.

createdAt.description: The date and time when this entry was fetched from the account link.

availableBalanceAmount.description: Indicates the balance that is available to spend net of any pending transactions. This balance should be used for insufficient funds (NSF) prevention use case.

currentBalanceAmount.description: Indicates the current balance that does not take pending transactions into account.

currency.description: The currency used. Use ISO currency codes.

allOf.description: If present, details of the error returned from the account link.

lastSuccessfulBalance.description: The most recent balance data from a successful check. If the most recent balance check resulted in an error, this object is populated with last successfully fetched balances, if they exist.

createdAt.description: The date and time when this data was fetched from the account link.

availableBalanceAmount.description: Indicates the balance that is available to spend net of any pending transactions. This balance should be used for insufficient funds (NSF) prevention use case.

currentBalanceAmount.description: Indicates the current balance that does not take pending transactions into account.

currency.description: The currency used. Use ISO currency codes.

CancellationReason.description:
The cancellation reason:

`technicalIssue` - loan was created due to a technical issue.

`wrongLoanTerms` - loan was created with the wrong terms.

`wrongBorrower` - loan was created on the wrong borrower.

`other` - for any other reason requiring cancellation.

PersonType.description:
A relation type between a borrower and a loan.

Use `coBorrower` as the value if there are two or more borrowers.

externalId.description:
A lender's identifier for a loan or a draw.

After the object is successfully created, a lender can use ID or externalId identifiers to fetch the object.

To fetch the object using externalId you need to add `ext-` to the URL.
