The scheduled amount. The actual amount charged can be lower from the
scheduled amount. It cannot be higher.

processingFeeAmount.description: Transaction processing fees that are charged by a payment processor.

processingFeeType.description:
Describes whether the processing fees are net or gross.
If it is a net fee, the amount of the fee is deducted from the amount of the transaction 'en route'.
If it is a gross fee, the amount of the fee is charged by the processor at the end the month.

failureDescriptionShort.description: Short text describing the failure reason. Normally displayed in UI.

failureDescriptionLong.description: Detailed text describing the failure reason and any appropriate actions the user may take to fix the issue.

processorFailureReason.description: The raw failure reason returned by the payment processor.

processorFailureDetails.description: The error details returned by the payment processor.

achReturnCode.description: The ACH return code indicating the reason the transaction failed.

reversedByTransactionId.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `reversedByTransactionIds` to obtain IDs of all reversing transactions.

Peach identifier of the transaction that reverses this one.

reversedByTransactionExternalId.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `reversedByTransactionIds` to obtain external IDs of all reversing transactions

Lender's external identifier of the transaction that reverses this one.

reversedByTransactionIds.description: Identifier(s) of the transaction(s) that reverse this one

id.description: Peach identifier of the transaction that reverses this one

externalId.description: Lender's external identifier of the transaction that reverses this one.

reversesTransactionId.description: The `id` of the original transaction that is being fully or partially reversed by this transaction.

reversesTransactionExternalId.description: The `externalId` of the original transaction that is being fully or partially reversed by this transaction.

reversedAmount.description:
The total amount of reversals associated with this transaction. See `reversedByTransactionIds` for reversal transaction details.
This amount is calculated by Peach and cannot be set or updated via API.

parentTransactionId.description: The ID of the real transactions that created this virtual transaction. Only relevant for virtual transactions.

createdBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for creating the transaction.
Can be an borrower, agent, or automated system process.

metaData.description: Store any type of key/value pairs in the form of a JSON dictionary.

customDisplayName.description:
A friendly description of the transaction. If provided, this value will be displayed in Peach UI/App and Statements (or can be used by lender in their App). If the value is not provided, the Peach UI/App and Statements logic will render the transaction name based on type and status. Make sure you provide value that makes sense to the borrower.
This is NOT what the borrower will see in their online bank or card account.

retryAttempt.description: Number of attempts to retry processing a failed transaction.

processorMerchantId.description: Applies to card transactions processed by Peach. The merchant ID used for processing a card transaction.

achConfirmed.description: Applies to ACH transactions processed by Peach. Set to `true` when the originating bank has confirmed receipt of the transaction.

achSameDay.description: Attempt to process this transaction with ACH Same Day processing.

achProcessedSameDay.description: The transaction was processed with ACH Same Day.

cancelShortDescription.description: Brief reason why the transaction was canceled.

cancelLongDescription.description: More detailed reason why the transaction was canceled.

retryOriginalTransactionId.description: The Peach identifier for the original transaction for which this is a retry.

ChargebackStatus.description:
The status of the chargeback.
  - `open` -  the chargeback was opened and is currently in dispute. The system assumes that the chargeback amount is temporarily taken and the
    `effectiveAmount` of the transaction is reduced by the chargeback amount. This might trigger a replay.
  - `closed` - the chargeback dispute period has closed, and the chargeback has been upheld. This is a terminal state and the chargeback cannot
    be reopened. The system assumes that the chargeback amount is permanently taken and the `effectiveAmount` of the transaction is reduced.
  - `reversed` - the chargeback dispute period has closed, and the chargeback has been reversed. The system assumes that the chargeback amount
    is permanently returned and the `effectiveAmount` of the transaction is increased back. This might trigger a replay.

The chargeback status impacts the transaction status is the following way:

For a transaction with a single chargeback, the chargeback status dictates the transaction status:
  - chargeback`status:open` → transaction `status:inDispute`
  - chargeback`status:closed` → transaction `status:chargeback`
  - chargeback`status:reversed` → transaction `status:succeeded`

For a transaction with multiple chargebacks, the following logic applied:
  - Any of the chargebacks in `status:open` → transaction `status:inDispute`
  - No chargebacks are in `status:open`, and any chargebacks are in `status:closed` → transaction `status:chargeback`
  - All chargebacks are in `status:reversed`→ transaction `status:succeeded`

externalId.description: The lender's identifer of the chargeback.

caseId.description: The identifier of an existing case.

amount.description: The amount of the chargeback. Defaults to the `actualAmount` of the transaction.

description.description: The description of the chargeback as received from the payment processor.

externalCaseNumber.description: The external case number of the chargeback in the payment processor system.

reasonCode.description: The reason code as received from the payment processor.

category.description: The chargeback category as received from the payment processor.

serviceCreditDetails.description: Information about credit. Only applies when `transactionType`=`serviceCredit`.

type.description: Type of the credit. Credit types are recorded differently in ledger/accounting.

sponsor.description:
Sponsor of the credit. Mainly used for ledger/accounting.

If `loanOwner`, the credit is recorded as expense in ledger/accounting.

If `loanServicer`, the credit is recorded as liability from the servicer.

If `merchant`, the credit is recorded as liability from the merchant.

reason.description: The reason why the payment was created.

effectiveAmount.description:
The net/effective amount of the transaction after taking into account chargebacks, reversals, and disputes. The amount is calculated as:
`effectiveAmount = actualAmount - reversedAmount - chargebackAmount`
This amount is calculated by Peach and cannot be set or updated via API.

chargebackAmount.description: The total amount of all Open and Closed chargebacks on this transaction.

isExternal.description:
A transaction marked `isExternal=true` is for record purposes only. A transaction with
an external `paymentInstrument` is automatically marked external.

isVirtual.description:
A transaction marked `isVirtual=true` is not a real transaction, but represents a part of another transaction.
This is used to store the principal/interest split on draws in Line of Credits as well as splits between multiple
installment loans that were applied as a single payment.

paidPrincipalAmount.description: The paid rounded amount allocated to principal

paidInterestAmount.description: The paid rounded amount allocated to interest

paidFeesAmount.description: The paid rounded amount allocated to fees

paidOverAmount.description: Stores any excess rounded amount that was not allocated to principal, interest or fees.

unroundedPaidPrincipalAmount.description: The paid unrounded amount allocated to principal

unroundedPaidInterestAmount.description: The paid unrounded amount allocated to interest

unroundedPaidFeesAmount.description: The paid unrounded amount allocated to fees

unroundedPaidOverAmount.description: Stores any excess unrounded amount that was not allocated to principal, interest or fees.

initiatingBorrowerId.description: The ID of the borrower who initiated the transaction.

allOf.description:
The document ID of a one-time payment consent given by the
borrower to debit their payment instrument.  The document is
stored in the HTML format and contains the disclosure shown to
the borrower at the time of the payment.  Required if
`previewMode=false` and Peach is processing payments (aka
`isExternal=false`) on behalf of the lender.

The document ID of a one-time payment consent screenshot
captured when a borrower made the payment.  Only applicable when
Peach App is used and company's
`config.evidence.captureScreenshot=true`.

autopayPlanId.description: Peach identifier of the autopay plan.

autopayPaymentIds.description: Peach identifiers of the autopay expected payments.

enablePrepayments.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE**
`true` if the borrower opts to apply any overpayment amount to prepayment of future obligations.
`false` if the borrower opts to apply overpayments to the current obligation.

If this field is not passed, we reference the `allowPrepayments` configuration on the loan type.

loanId.description: The unique identifier of the Loan.

drawId.description: The draw identifier for the transaction.

mainBorrowerId.description: The Peach identifier for the main borrower on the loan.

sendCancellationNotice.description: When set to `true`, the system will send `loanCanceled` notice to the borrower.

creditLimitAmount.description:
The credit limit amount for the line or draw. Only applicable to line of credit or installment loan with multiple
advances. For installment loans with multi-advances, it is the amount financed set at origination.

sendNotice.description: Whether the system sent `locCreditLimitChanged` notice to the borrower.

adverseActionReason.description:
The reason why the credit limit was changed. If passed, the copy used in the `locCreditLimitChanged` communication
template. Make sure to phrase the copy as a full sentence or paragraph.

externalId.description: The external unique identifier of the index rate.

indexDescription.description: The index interest rate description. For example: “1 Month LIBOR Rate” or “Custom rate”.

country.description:
Country. English short name according to
[ISO 3166-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) standard.

annualRate.description: The annual interest rate value for the period defined. Format is decimal. For example, 0.01 is 1% annual rate, 0.2 is 20% annual rate.

startDate.description:
The start date of the index rate. The start date is inclusive. When a new Index Interest Rate value is added, the
previous rate end date will be set to one calendar day before the new rate’s start date. If the new rate’s start
date is in the past, the Peach system will replay all “active” loans (to clarify, “active” loans at the time of
Index Interest Rate addition) with the new Index Interest Rate value and re-accrue loans’ interest. Replaying the
entire portfolio of loans might take time. It is recommended that the Customer set the new Index Interest Rate at night.

endDate.description:
The index rate end date. The end date is inclusive. Pass `null` if you do not know when the rate will expire. If
`null`, the rate is applicable until it changes.

annualRate.description: The annual interest rate value for the period defined. Format is decimal. For example, 0.01 is 1% annual rate, 0.2 is 20% annual rate.

endDate.description:
The index rate end date. The end date is inclusive. Pass `null` if you do not know when the rate will expire. If
`null`, the rate is applicable until it changes.

indexDescription.description: The index interest rate description. For example: “1 Month LIBOR Rate” or “Custom rate”.

FeeApiName.description:
The identifier of the dynamic fee configuration for this loan.
Only applicable to `type=dynamicFee` fee.

FeeDisplayName.description:
The display name of the fee. The display name of the fee is either set by `customDisplayName` (that can be passed in the API)
or by `displayName` that was configured in the loan type (this is the default value.)

loanId.description: The identifier of the loan that the fee is charged on.

amount.description: The fee amount.

originalAmount.description:
The original fee amount. Sometimes fee amounts are adjusted, such as when a borrower pays off the fee before the statement date,
as well as when the borrower has an overpayment in the ledger.

status.description:
- `scheduled` - the fee is expected to be charged in the future.
- `booked` - the fee was charged and is in the ledger.
- `modified`- the fee was charged, but the amount might have changed since it was booked.
- `canceled` - the fee was canceled, and the borrower is no longer expected to pay it.

createdDate.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `timestamps.createdAt`.**

The date on which the fee was created. Fees in scheduled status have `createdDate` but not `dynamicFeeDetails.chargeDate` because
they are not yet in the ledger. `originationFee` and `drawFee` are created and charged on the same day. `dynamicFee` can be created
but charged later.

scheduledDate.description:
The date when the fee is expected to be charged. This date is different from the `chargedDate` and `dueDate`.
This date should be used only for fees in `status=scheduled`.

dueDate.description: The date on which the fee is due.

dynamicFeeDetails.description:
Additional details about the fee. This object was historically used for `type=dynamicFee` only, but now it is used for all fee types.
Some attributes in this object are applicable only to `type=dynamicFee`. Please carefully read the description of each attribute.

loanFeeId.description:
The identifier of the loan fee in the system, used to cancel a fee if necessary.
Only applicable to `type=dynamicFee` fee.

loanFeeExternalId.description:
The lender's external identifier of the loan fee object in the system, can also be used to cancel the fee.
Only applicable to `type=dynamicFee` fee.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

createdBy.description:
Identifier of the `User` who created the fee.
Only applicable to `type=dynamicFee` fee.

chargeDate.description: The date a fee was charged to the ledger.

canceledDate.description:
The date a fee was canceled. `null` indicates an uncanceled fee.
Only applicable to `type=dynamicFee` fee.

canceledBy.description: Identifier of the `User` who canceled the fee.

transactionId.description:
The ID of the transaction; only relevant for NSF Fee.
Only applicable to `type=dynamicFee` fee.

capitalizedAmount.description:
The amount of fee that was capitalized. Only applicable to `dynamicFee` fees.

If the fee `amount` is different from the `originalAmount`, it can happen for a few reasons:
  1. The fee amount was changed and the loan was replayed. In that case, both `capitalizedAmount` and `creditedAmount` attributes are not used. This is only possible for `originationFee` or `drawFee` fees.
  2. Part or all of the fee amount was capitalized. In that case, the capitalized amount is represented by the `capitalizedAmount` attribute. This is only possible for `dynamicFee` fees.
  3. Part or all of the fee amount was “covered” by a credit amount (also called `reimbursementAmount`) available on the line of credit. In that case, the credited amount is represented by the `creditedAmount` attribute. This is only possible for `dynamicFee` fees. Only applicable to lines of credit.

For `dynamicFee`, if `capitalizedAmount` and `creditedAmount` are not `null`, the follow equation should be true:
`originalAmount - amount = capitalizedAmount + creditedAmount`

creditedAmount.description:
The amount of the fee that was “covered” by a credit amount (also called `reimbursementAmount`) available on the line of credit. Only applicable to `dynamicFee` fees.

If the fee `amount` is different from the `originalAmount`, it can happen for a few reasons:
  1. The fee amount was changed and the loan was replayed. In that case, both `capitalizedAmount` and `creditedAmount` attributes are not used. This is only possible for `originationFee` or `drawFee` fees.
  2. Part or all of the fee amount was capitalized. In that case, the capitalized amount will be represented by the `capitalizedAmount` attribute. This is only possible for `dynamicFee` fees.
  3. Part or all of the fee amount was “covered” by a credit amount (also called `reimbursementAmount`) available on the line of credit. In that case, the credited amount will be represented by the `creditedAmount` attribute. Only applicable to lines of credit. This is only possible for `dynamicFee` fees.

For `dynamicFee`, if `capitalizedAmount` and `creditedAmount` are not `null`, the follow equation should be true:
`originalAmount - amount = capitalizedAmount + creditedAmount`

createdAt.description:
The timestamp when the fee was created in the system. Created does not mean booked / charged.
A fee in `scheduled` status should have `createdAt`, `scheduledDate` and `dueDate`, but not `dynamicFeeDetails.chargeDate`.
This is because the fee is not in the ledger yet.

previewMode.description: If `previewMode=true`, the loan doesn't change and no changes are saved to the database.

retroactivelyAccrueInterest.description:
`true` to accrue interest (as usual) for periods occurring when the loan was frozen. `false` to make
periodic payments occurring during the frozen period interest-free.

shiftDueDates.description:
`true` to defer the periodic payment amounts associated with periods that fall in the frozen period to one or
more new periods generated at the end of a loan. `false` to keep the amounts in unfrozen periods.

sendNotice.description: When set to `false`, the system will NOT send a `loanUnfreeze` notice to the borrower.

effectiveDate.description:
The effective date of the loan acceleration. The date should be the current date in the local timezone.
Passing in `"today"` will also set the field to today's date.

sendNotice.description: When set to `false`, the system will NOT send a `loanAccelerated` notice to the borrower.

reversedAcceleratedAmount.description: The amount of the acceleration reversal.

effectiveDate.description:
The effective date of the loan charge-off. The date should be the current date in the local timezone.
Passing in `"today"` will also set the field to today's date.

chargedOffReason.description:
The reason for loan charge off:

`term` means the loan was charged off per loan type configuration after X days overdue.

`fraudulent` means the loan was charged off for fraudulent reason.

`bankruptcy` means the loan was charged off because of bankruptcy.

`legal` means the loan was charged off because of some legal reason.

sendNotice.description: When set to `false`, the system will NOT send a `loanChargedOffUnsecured` notice to the borrower.

reversedChargeOffAmount.description: The amount of the charge-off reversal.

LoanRate.description:
Loan can have multiple rates. If two or more `interestRate` overlap on the same date we use the lowest value.
If two or more `promoRate` overlap on the same date, we take the sum of the promo rates for the given day, and cap this rate at the maximum interest rate for the given day (to avoid accruing negative interest).

id.description: Unique identifier of the interest or promo rate.

status.description:
The status of the rate.
`active` - the rate is active.
`inactive` - the rate is inactive as it was removed.

annualRate.description: The annual interest or promo rate for the period defined. Format is decimal. For example, 0.01 is 1% annual rate, 0.2 is 20% annual rate.

startDate.description: The rate start date. The start date is inclusive.

endDate.description:
The rate end date. The end date is inclusive.
If `null` then the rate is applicable until the end of the loan.

setAtActivation.description:
`true` if the rate was set at loan activation. Rates set at activation cannot be removed
without a special permission. Rates set after activation are set as `false` and do not
require a special permission for removal.

InterestRate.title: Interest rate
InterestRate.description: An interest rate on a loan.

interestType.description:
The interest type. The interest type cannot be changed after the loan status changes to `originated` and onward.
Interest rates defined as `spread` will calculate an absolute rate by adding the relative loan rate (aka spread)
provided here to the Index Interest Rate effective on the date the interest is accrued. In case the Index Interest
Rate is not set, the system will assume that the Index Interest Rate value is zero on the date the interest is accrued.

Interest rates defined as `absolute` will use the value as provided here without adding the Index Interest Rate.

PromoRate.title: Promo rate
PromoRate.description:
A promo rate on a loan. If the annual interest rate is 0.25 and the promo rate for the corresponding
period is 0.05, the net interest rate after application of the promo rate would be 0.2.

isEndExistingRates.description:
If true, the system will set all existing rates that have `endDate=null` to the new rate's `startDate` minus one calendar day. Use this flag
carefully as it might impact ALL existing rates. For example:

  - A loan has one existing rate of 0.05 with `startDate=2021-07-01` and `endDate=null`.
  - A new rate of 0.01 is added with `startDate=2021-08-05` and `isEndExistingRates=true`.
  - The rate of 0.05 will be updated, and the end date will be set to `endDate=2021-08-04`.

Note that only rates with `endDate=null` will to be updated. If an existing rate has a defined end date, that rate will not be modified.

SendNoticeCancelAutopay.description:
When set to `false`, the system will NOT send a `loanPaymentScheduleChanged` notice to the borrower.

Note: Changing the loan terms will automatically cancel an existing Autopay (if enabled). A borrower,  an agent or
API caller needs to turn on / enable a new Autopay plan after the loan terms change is completed. If the loan has Autopay enabled:
 - When `sendNotice=false`, the system will NOT send an `autopayCanceledBySystem` notice.
 - When `sendNotice=true`, the system will send an `autopayCanceledBySystem` notice in addition to the applicable loan terms notice.

previewMode.description: In `previewMode=true`, the loan doesn't change, and no changes are saved to the database.

agreementDocumentId.description:
The document descriptor ID corresponding to the accepted loan term change agreement. This is required unless
`previewMode=true` or `isShowRevisedTermsOnFrequencyChange=false` on the loan type.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

DeltaTerms.description:
The delta change in interest, fees, calendar days, and number of due dates. Only relevant for installment loans. For
non installment loans, `deltaTerms` fields will be null.

deltaInterestAmount.description:
A positive amount indicates the additional interest that the borrower is expected to pay as a
result of the change. A negative amount indicates savings in interest the borrower is expected to
benefit from as a result of the change.

deltaFeeAmount.description:
A positive amount indicates the additional fees that the borrower is expected to pay as a result of
the change. A negative amount indicates savings in fees the borrower is expected to benefit from as
a result of the change.

deltaDurationDays.description:
A positive number indicates number of calendar days that the loan's term is extended as a result of the
change. A negative number indicates the number of calendar days that the loan's term is shortened as a result
of the change.

deltaDueDatesNumber.description:
A positive number indicates the number of additional due dates that were added to the loan schedule. A negative
number indicates the number due dates that were removed from the loan schedule.

previewMode.description: If `previewMode=true`, the loan doesn't change and no changes are saved to the database.

selectedDueDate.description: The selected due date to defer. It can be the due date of the current period or a future due date in the loan schedule.

newDueDate.description:
The proposed new due date, chosen from an existing due date after the selected date. The
`addAfterLastDueDate` field should be toggled to false if utilizing this option.

addAfterLastDueDate.description:
`true` to move the new due date to a date after the last due date. The date will be calculated
based upon the existing loan cadence. The `newDueDate` field should be left empty if utilizing this option.

agreementDocumentId.description: The document descriptor ID corresponding to the accepted loan term change agreement.

waiveFee.description: `true` to charge a fee for deferral of a due date. The fee amount is defined as part of the loan type.

dueDateDeferralFeeAmount.description: The due date deferral fee amount

recurringAmount.description: The requested recurring amount under the new payment plan.

duration.description: The remaining duration - in months starting from the current day - under the new payment plan.

annualRate.description: The annual interest rate for the period defined. Format is decimal. For example, 0.01 is 1% annual rate, 0.2 is 20% annual rate.

startDate.description: The start date of the period. The start date is inclusive.

endDate.description: The end date of the period. The end date is inclusive.

isCancelFees.description: When set to `true`, the system will waive any fees that were charged during the period.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

previewMode.description: If `previewMode=true`, the loan doesn't change and no changes are saved to the database.

bufferToPushOutSchedule.description:
When deferring during the first period, this represents the number of calendar days that will be added to
today's date. The resulting date will be used to push out due dates (today's date + buffer days). Interest
will continue to accrue.

When deferring after the first period, we defer all due dates that fall between "today's date"
and "today's date + buffer days" to the end of the loan one by one. If the current date falls on a due date,
it will not be deferred as the period has ended.

agreementDocumentId.description: The document descriptor ID corresponding to the accepted loan term change agreement.

waiveFee.description: `true` to charge a deferral fee. The fee amount is defined as part of the loan type.

customPaymentPlanExternalId.description:
A lender's identifier for a payment pay plan.

After the object is successfully created, a lender can use ID or externalId identifiers to fetch the object.

To fetch the object using externalId you need to add `ext-` to the URL.

Note: Don't add ext- to the identifier value. For example: if the external identifier is `ABCDE`, then pass externalId=ACBCE
and NOT ext-ABCDE when creating the object.

customPaymentPlanAmount.description:
Amount required to be fulfilled for each payment plan period. The `amount` provided should be the recurring amount rather than the total amount
of the plan. Peach’s system will use the amount provided to determine whether the borrower is past due and report to bureaus accordingly (if applicable).
Note: Any fees added during the duration of the payment plan must also be paid in order for the borrower to remain “current”.

`amount` can be higher or lower than the borrower’s originally contracted amount. Peach’s system will revert to the recurring amount after the payment
plan end date if the loan still has a balance at the end of the payment plan.

Do not pass this attribute if the payment plan type is `interestAndFees`.

customPaymentPlanType.description:
Determines how the system will calculate payment plan payments during the payment plan’s `numberOfPeriods`.

`fixedAmountAndFees` - the payment plan payment amounts will be set as a recurring `amount`. Note that any configured recurring
fees (e.g. service fees) will also be included in the payment plan amount unless explicitly canceled. `amount` must be passed at
the time of payment plan creation when using this option.

`interestAndFees` - the payment plan amounts will be calculated by Peach’s system as “interest only”. Note that any configured
recurring fees (e.g. service fees) will also be included in the payment plan amount unless explicitly canceled. Do not pass `amount`
when using this option.

customPaymentPlanSelectedDueDate.description:
The due date of the period from which to begin the payment plan. If `selectedDueDate` is not provided upon payment plan creation,
the system will use the current period due date as the `selectedDueDate`. If `selectedDueDate` is provided, it must be for a due date in the future.

customPaymentPlanNumberOfPeriods.description:
The number of periods during which the payment plan terms are effective. Represented as the number of `paymentFrequency` periods. The system will
begin counting the `numberOfPeriods` from the period represented by the `selectedDueDate`.

The `numberOfPeriods` of the payment plan must take place within the existing loan duration. Moreover, if `isExtendLoanDuration` is `true`,
the `numberOfPeriods` must end on or before the last period of the loan. If `isExtendLoanDuration` is `false`, then `numberOfPeriods` for the payment
plan must end on or before the second to last payment.

For example, if the payment plan `frequency=weekly` and `numberOfPeriods=6` and the remaining loan duration is 12, the payment plan will be created with a
6 weeks duration during which the designated payment plan `amount` is in effect. Any subsequent periods after the payment plan has ended will revert
to the original periodic payment amount.

customPaymentPlanIsExtendLoanDuration.description:
If `true`, the system may adjust and increase the loan `duration` beyond the current end date to accommodate the payment plan. If `false`, the
system will not add additional periods beyond the current loan `duration`.

customPaymentPlanCancellationReason.description:
The cancellation reason:

`canceledByUser` - payment plan was canceled by an agent or borrower.

`loanTermsChanged` - loan terms changed.

`loanChargedOff` - loan was charged off.

`loanAccelerated` - loan was accelerated.

`otherPaymentPlanOffered` - another payment plan was offered.

`other` - for any other reason requiring cancellation.

customPaymentPlanReasonDetails.description: The reason for payment plan cancellation. This is typically entered by an agent canceling a payment plan via the front end.

status.description:
The payment plan status. Once a payment plan is created, it is, by definition, `active`. Once all
periods in a payment plan period have passed, it will change status to `inactive`. If a payment plan
is canceled, it will change status to `canceled`.

creationCaseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

createdBy.description: Identifier of the `User` who created the payment plan.

cancellationCaseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

canceledBy.description: Identifier of the `User` who canceled the payment plan.

previewMode.description: In `previewMode=true`, the loan doesn't change, and no changes are saved to the database.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.
An identifier for an existing case.

sendNotice.description: When set to `false`, the system will NOT send a `loanPaymentScheduleChanged` notice to the borrower.

CreditLimitPercentage.description:
The draw's credit limit as a percentage of the loan's credit limit. Lenders can set and update `creditLimitAmount`,
`creditLimitPercentage`, or both. If both values are set, the system will use the lower value. The format is decimal.
For example, 0.01 is a 1%, 0.2 is a 20%.

MinPaymentCalculation.description:
The logic to calculate the minimum payment amount when a statement is created.
All interest accrued in the period and fees are always part of the minimum payment amount.

If `includeOverLimitAmount` is set to `true`, the minimum payment amount will include the
over limit amount at the time of statement generation as part of the required minimum payment.

Using `percentageOfPrincipal`, lenders can also control what percentage of the outstanding principal
will be added to the minimum amount.

Statement logic adds up all draws calculated minimum payment amounts and sets the total as the statement
minimum amount. If the `loanType.statement` object is configured such that `includeOverdueAmountInMinPayment`
is set to `true`, the statement minimum payment amount will include the loan/line overdue amount as part of
the required minimum payment on the statement.

percentageOfPrincipal.description:
Percentage of draw's outstanding principal. The range is 0-1. The format is decimal. For example, 0.01 is a 1%, 0.2 is a 20%. This is
used when the draw is not amortized or the draw's amortization term has passed.

minAmount.description:
The minimum periodic amount. For example: $15.00. The minimum will be only enforced if the draw doesn’t have an amortized amount.
The minimum will not be enforced if the principal of the draw is zero.

Example:
- Outstanding draw principal is $100.00.
- `percentageOfPrincipal=0.01` (aka 1%).
- Interest rate is 2% per month.
- `minAmount=15`.
- Interest amount per month is: $100.00 * 2% = $2.00.
- Minimum amount is: $2 + $100.00 * 1% = $3.00.

The minimum payment will be set to $15.00 and not $3.00. The split between principal and interest will be: `interest=$2.00` and
`principal=$13.00`.

minInterestChargeAmount.description:
The minimum amount of interest charged in a period. If the draw has accrued interest in a billing period, but the amount calculated
is less than the `minInterestChargeAmount`, the system will add additional interest amount to the draw's interest bucket to equal
the `minInterestChargeAmount`.

includeOverLimitAmount.description:
The system first calculates the draw minimum amount, which includes accrued interest,
fees and some percentage of the outstanding principal.

If `includeOverLimitAmount=true`, the system would add an over limit amount to the minimum amount.
The over limit amount is calculated as `max(utilizationAmount - creditLimitAmount, 0)`
at the time of statement generation.

DrawAtOrigination.description: This object contains loan details and terms as they were shown to a borrower at origination.

aprNominal.description:
The nominal APR of the loan at origination. Pass both `aprNominal` and `aprEffective` even if they are equal.

This field is deprecated for Line of Credit and Draw. You can still pass the value, and it will be stored on the object.
However, it will not be used/displayed anywhere. The system will use the interest rate values of Line of Credit and Draws
and show them as the APR (for example, on the statement.)

aprEffective.description:
The effective APR of the loan at origination. Pass both `aprNominal` and `aprEffective` even if they are equal.

This field is deprecated for Line of Credit and Draw. You can still pass the value, and it will be stored on the object.
However, it will not be used/displayed anywhere. The system will use the interest rate values of Line of Credit and Draws
and show them as the APR (for example, on the statement.)

drawFeeAmount.description:
The amount of the draw fee. The draw fee will be due on a due date of the period the draw was activated.
Pass only one of the following values, `drawFeeAmount` or `drawFeePercentageOfPrincipal`.

drawFeePercentageOfPrincipal.description:
The percentage of the purchases total amount. The system will calculate the draw fee amount based on the total
of purchases in the period the draw was activated. The draw fee will be due on a due date of the period the draw
was activated.  Pass only one of the following values, `drawFeeAmount` or `drawFeePercentageOfPrincipal`.

serviceFeeAmount.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `dynamicFees.feeAmount`.

The service fee amount that will be charged recurrently. Only required if the service fee `amountLogic` is configured as
`type=passedAtOrigination`. In all other cases, the system will calculate the fee based on pre-configured logic.

serviceFeeCapAmount.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `dynamicFees.feeCapAmount`.

The maximum amount of the service fee that can be charged over the life of the loan or draw. Only required if the service fee
`capLogic` is configured as `type=capPassedAtOrigination`. In all other cases, the system will calculate the fee based on pre-configured
logic.

autoAmortization.description:
Draws can be automatically amortized based on lender needs. Amortization of the draw allows borrowers to pay it back over a longer period
of time. If the draw is not amortized, the minimum amount due will be calculated based on the `minPaymentCalculation` logic.

The system will automatically amortize the draw only ONCE in the first period in which a purchase was ever made. If more purchases
were made in the following periods, the system will NOT automatically re-amortize the draw. If you need to re-amortized the `draw` you should
call the `Amortize draw` endpoint.

Note:
- If the loan type is configured to accrue interest as `accrualMethod=compoundWithFees`, there is a known limitation to the draw amortization
calculation logic.
- The draw amortization calculation will be done using the `compound` method and not `compoundWithFees`. To ensure that the system calculates
interest accurately, amortized draws should NOT include any fees.

amortizationMethod.description:
Loan amortization method.

`equalPayments` - the system will amortize the loan or draw making recurring payments equal (except maybe for the last payment).
Most installment loans are expected to use this method.

`interestPaymentsBalloonPrincipal` - the system will amortize the loan or draw making recurring payments equal to interest only
and the last payment will include the entire principal. Keep in mind that if you set `interest.periodAccrualDurationType=actual`,
the recurring payment amounts will be different every period for monthly and twice monthly frequencies. This is because a month
can have 28, 29, 30 or 31 days and interest accrued will vary based on the number of days in the month.

There are additional limitations to be aware for `interestPaymentsBalloonPrincipal`. For installment loans, Autopay can only be
aligned to due dates. It means that `autoPay.allowedFrequency.isDueDatesAvailable` must be set to `false`. This way the system
will only allow Autopay to be aligned to the loan frequency and due dates.

amortizationLogic.description:
- `amortizeAfterEachPurchase` - indicates whether the system needs to amortize and re-amortize the draw when a new purchase is posted over `duration`
periods. If no new purchases were posted, the system will not re-amortize the draw.
- `aggregatePurchasesInPeriod` - indicates whether new purchases during a period should be "aggregated", added to outstanding draw principal and amortized
over `duration` periods automatically when the period ends. If no purchases were posted in a period, the system will not re-amortize the draw.

duration.description:
The duration of the draw as a number of `paymentFrequency` periods of the line of credit. Only applicable if the draw needs to be amortized. Pass one of the values
only, `duration` or `periodicPaymentAmount`.

periodicPaymentAmount.description: The recurring payment amount. The system will calculate the needed duration. Pass one of the values only, `duration` or `periodicPaymentAmount`.

gracePeriod.description:
The logic to handle grace period benefit. If the Draw is subject to grace period, then the `gracePeriod` object must be passed.
A grace period benefit exists with respect to a specific balance (aka Draw) when a borrower does not have to pay interest on that
specific balance. If the `gracePeriod` is not passed, the system will assume that grace period benefit is not applicable to the Draw.

isGracePeriodApplicable.description: Set to `true` if grace period is applicable to the Draw.

numPeriodsToRestoreGrace.description:
Number of periods to wait after the grace period benefit was revoked, and before it can become eligible again. To take advantage
of the grace period, the borrower must pay their account balance in the amount of `graceCondition` on time for the number of billing
periods provided in `numPeriodsToRestoreGrace`.

nickname.description: The draw's nickname as displayed in the UI.

ratesValidation.description: This object contains information on whether actual rates exceed the rate ranges defined on the loan type.

isClosed.description: Indicates whether the Draw is closed. If `true`, new Purchases cannot be created.

current.description: This object contains some draw details that were modified after origination.

periodicPayment.description: The most recent amortized periodic payment that was calculated on `lastAmortizedAt`.

drawType.description:
Describes the type of line of credit purchases associated with the draw. Typically used in credit card use cases
in which lenders set up draws specifically to be used for cash advances, balance transfers, etc.

`cashAdvance` - must be set in order for Peach's system to automatically associate ATM withdrawal and other
  cash-specific transactions with a specific draw. See Create card issuer endpoint and `drawMapping` attribute for additional configuration details.

`balanceTransfer` - enables lenders to create a draw that will house balance transfer transactions.

`regularPurchase` - enables lenders to create a draw used for day-to-day purchases. If this attribute is set,
  Peach's system will automatically associate purchases with this draw based on the card issuer `drawMapping` logic.

authorizedAt.description:
The timestamp when the purchase was `authorized`. This value can be set by lenders at the time of purchase creation.
If the value is not set by the lender, it will be populated based on `authorizedAt` (if it is non-null) otherwise `createdAt` for the corresponding `authorizationPurchaseId`.
If the value is not set by the lender and no `authorizationPurchaseId` is set, this value corresponds to `purchase.authorized` event.
If the purchase was never in `authorized` status and none of the prior conditions are met, this value will be null.

amount.description: The amount of the purchase.

effectiveAt.description:
The effective timestamp when the purchase was applied in the ledger. `effectiveAt` is equal to the timestamp when the purchase is set to
`pending` or `settled` status, whichever comes first. Changing the `effectiveAt` via the `Update purchase` endpoint will trigger a replay
of the line of credit. Keep in mind that an existing statement might've included the purchase based on the existing `effectiveAt` value
and the interest was accrued based on the existing `effectiveAt`. `effectiveAt` can be updated only if the purchase is in `settled` or `pending` status.

The timezone is UTC for this timestamp and the format is ISO.
For example, in order to set a purchase `effectiveAt` to July 28th 2022, 10:44 am PDT, send `2022-07-28T17:44:00Z`

externalId.description: The lender's identifier for the purchase.

originalPurchaseId.description:
Peach's unique or lender's external identifier. Typically used for purchases of type `refund` which allows the lender to
reference the original purchase being refunded. For authorizations, please see `authorizationPurchaseId` attribute.

authorizationPurchaseId.description:
Peach’s unique or lender’s external identifier for the authorization purchase. This attribute is used to reference an initial authorization, so
lenders know which captures (purchase object(s) in Peach) are related to the original authorization.

declineReason.description: The reason the purchase was declined

ExternalId.description:
A lender's identifier for a promise to pay plan.
After the object is successfully created, a lender can use ID or externalId identifiers to fetch the object.
To fetch the object using externalId you need to add `ext-` to the URL.
Note: Don't add ext- to the identifier value. For example: if the external identifier is `ABCDE`, then pass 
externalId=ACBCE and NOT ext-ABCDE when creating the object.

ResponseStartDate.description: The start date of the promise to pay plan, equal to the `startDate` of plan's first promise period.

ResponseEndDate.description: The end date of the promise to pay plan, equal to the `dueDate` of plan's last promise period.

id.description: The promise to pay plan ID.

loanId.description: The unique loan identifier that the promise belongs to.

schedule.description: Promise to pay plan periodId(s) and amount(s).

periodId.description: Unique identifier of the period created for the promise to pay plan.

dueDate.description: The due date of the promised amount.

amount.description: Amount of the promise to pay period.

status.description:
The status of the promise to pay plan. 

`scheduled` - promise to pay has been created but has not yet started. Typically used when the lender wants to 
start a promise as of a specific date. Communications will not be triggered and tasks will not be assigned to 
agents for promise to pay plans in `scheduled` status. Peach's system will transition the status of the promise
to pay plan to `active` on the `startDate` unless the lender cancels the promise to pay beforehand. 

`active` - promise to pay plan is in effect. To check if the borrower is on and behind the schedule, see the `
isOverdue` attribute.

`kept` - promise to pay final period end date has passed and the borrower has met the promised amount(s) by the 
promise's final period end date. This status is a terminal state.

`broken` - promise to pay final period end date has passed and the borrower has not met the promised amount(s) 
by the promise's final period end date. This status is a terminal state.

`canceled` - promise to pay plan was canceled. This status is a terminal state.

isOverdue.description: The borrower has not met one or more promised amounts by the promised due date.

caseId.description: The ID of the case associated with the promise to pay plan.

cancellationReason.description:
The reason for canceling the promise to pay plan.

`canceledByUser` - Promise to pay plan was canceled by an agent or borrower.
`loanChargedOff` - loan was charged off during the promise period.
`loanAccelerated` - loan was accelerated during the promise period.
`otherPromisePlanOffered` - another promise plan was offered.
`other` - for any other reason requiring cancellation.

reasonDetails.description: Additional details about the reason for canceling the promise to pay plan.

RequestStartDate.description:
The start date of the promise to pay plan. If `startDate` is not provided upon promise to pay plan creation,
the system will use the created date (i.e. “today”) as the `startDate`. If `startDate` is provided, it must be a date in the future.
Notes:
- If you are providing a `schedule` object, you should not pass the `startDate`. In case both are provided in the 
  request, a `400 Bad Request error` will be returned.
- If Peach's system creates the schedule based on `frequency`,`specificDays` and `duration` passed, the system will 
  schedule Promise to Pay Periods starting after the `startDate`.

previewMode.description:
In `previewMode=true`, the Promise to Pay Plan and corresponding Promise Period Objects will be
returned for preview without committing the object to database

frequency.description:
The agreed payment frequency of the promise. Peach's system will use the desired frequency to create promise to pay period(s) so the lender can monitor progress against promised payment dates and amount paid. 
`weekly`, `everyTwoWeeks`, `twiceMonthly`, and `monthly` options create multiple promise to pay periods, according to the `duration`.
`singleTerm` creates a promise with a single period and desired duration of X calendar days or a specific date that should be passed in `specificDays`. 

Note: 
- If `frequency` is passed to the endpoint, ensure that `duration` and `amount` are also provided.
- If you are providing a `frequency` object, you should not pass the `schedule`. In case both are provided in the 
  request, a `400 Bad Request error` will be returned.

specificDays.description:
Specific days designate the day(s) that due dates will fall on. The allowed values for specific
day(s) depends on the `paymentFrequency`.

`weekly` - provide one number in the valid range 1-7. 1=Monday...7=Sunday.

For example: [1].

`everyTwoWeeks` - provide two inputs. The first input (required) is an integer in the valid range 1-7. 1=Monday...7=Sunday.

The second input is a date that indicates when to start the cycle. If the second input is not passed, the system will default
to the first valid start date based on the first input (the day of week passed in). If this date is provided then it can override
the minimum due date gap specified on the loan type.

For example: [1, "2020-09-16"].

`twiceMonthly` - provide two numbers in the valid range 1-31. 1=first day of a month. Use 31 to
indicate the last day of a month.

For example: [1, 15] or [15, 31].

`monthly` - provide one number in the valid range 1-31. 1=first day of a month. Use 31 to indicate
the last day of a month.

For example: [1].

`singleTerm` - provide one number to indicate duration as a number of calendar days or provide a valid calendar date in the
future. For example: [90] or ["2020-09-16"].

For `weekly`, `everyTwoWeeks`, `twiceMonthly`, `monthly`:
If specificDays is left null, then the system will calculate due dates according to the paymentFrequency relative
to the origination or activation date (or use existing specific days in the case of change due date).

For `singleTerm`:
The specificDays is mandatory.

duration.description:
The duration of the promise to pay plan as a number of `frequency` periods. For example:
if `frequency=weekly` and `duration=6`, the promise will be created with 6 weeks duration and will have 6 
periods all with the same amount.

Note: 
- If `duration` is passed to the endpoint, ensure that `frequency` and `amount` are also provided.
- If you are providing a `duration` object, you should not pass the `schedule`. In case both are provided in the 
  request, a `400 Bad Request error` will be returned.

amount.description:
Amount required to be fulfilled for each period of the promise to pay plan. Peach's system will use the amount
provided to trigger any required promise `status` transitions.

Note: 
- If `amount` is passed to the endpoint, ensure that `frequency` and `duration` are also provided.
- If you are providing an `amount` object, you should not pass the `schedule`. In case both are provided in the 
  request, a `400 Bad Request error` will be returned.

schedule.description:
To create a custom promise to pay schedule with varying amounts or irregular periods, pass a `schedule` when 
creating the promise to pay plan. 
Note:
Either `schedule` object or schedule descriptor attributes (`startDate`, `frequency`, `specificDays` 
, 'duration' and 'amount') can be passed to create a promise to pay plan. In case both are provided in the 
request, a `400 Bad Request error` will be returned.

dueDate.description: The due date of the promised amount.

amount.description: The promised amount.

caseId.description: The ID of the case associated with the promise to pay plan.

sendNotice.description:
When set to `true`, Peach's system will send a notice to the borrower about the promise to pay plan.
Note: If `sendNotice` is not passed, the system will default to `true`.

cancellationReason.description:
The reason for canceling the promise to pay plan.

`canceledByUser` - Promise to pay plan was canceled by an agent or borrower.
`loanChargedOff` - loan was charged off during the promise period.
`loanAccelerated` - loan was accelerated during the promise period.
`otherPromisePlanOffered` - another promise plan was offered.
`other` - for any other reason requiring cancellation.

reasonDetails.description: Additional details about the reason for canceling the promise to pay plan.

cancellationCaseId.description: The case to associate with this promise to pay plan cancellation.

drawId.description:
The draw identifier. If provided, the system will attempt to apply the payment to the specified draw. Any excess will be applied to
the rest of LOC/Draws based on the multi-waterfall that is defined for the line of credit type.

isExternal.description: A transaction marked `isExternal=true` is for record purposes only. A transaction with an external `paymentInstrument` is automatically marked external.

externalId.description: A lender's identifier for a transaction.

status.description:
The transaction status. May only be passed when `isExternal=true`.

External transactions can be created in: `scheduled`, `initiated`, `pending`, `succeeded`, or `failed`.
External transactions are applied to the loan balance immediately when created with status `initiated`, `pending`, or `succeeded`. Otherwise,
they will be applied the first time they are updated to one of these statuses.

`scheduled` - payment or credit was scheduled for a future date that has not arrived yet. The payment has not applied to a loan yet.

`initiated` - payment was initiated and sent to a payment processor. The payment is applied to a loan. This status is used normally for ACH.

`pending` - payment was acknowledged by the payment processor and is being processed. For ACH the payment can be in pending status for a few days.

`succeeded` - payment was completed successfully.

`failed` - payment failed and was removed from the loan effective as of `initiated`, `pending` or `succeeded` status effective date. The system replays the loan as if the payment never happened.
It will also re-accrue interest since then.

`inDispute` - payment is in dispute (typically because of chargeback). The payment is removed from the loan effective as of `initiated`, `pending` or `succeeded` status effective date. The system replays the loan as if the payment never happened.
It will also re-accrue interest since then. Disputed payment can be for partial amount.

`canceled` - payment or credit was canceled. Payment can be canceled only if the current status is `scheduled`.

`chargeback` - payment was disputed and ruled against the lender. The payment was returned to the original payment instrument. Chargeback payment can be for partial amount.

failureReason.description: The transaction failure reason. This value is ignored except when creating an external transaction with `status=failed`

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument identifier that was charged.

actualAmount.description:
The actual amount that was processed. The system never debits
more than the loan outstanding balance.

scheduledAmount.description:
The scheduled amount. The actual amount charged can be lower from the
scheduled amount. It cannot be higher.

amount.description: The amount of the payment.

scheduledDate.description:
This attribute should be used only for transactions that are scheduled in the future. Transactions that should be processed now/today,
leave the attribute empty and the system will set appropriate date and timestamp values based on the API call time.

effectiveDate.description:
This attribute can be used only during the migration process of loans from another system to Peach. Any value passed for `active` loans will be ignored.

The effective date of the transaction in the product timezone. This attribute can be used for transactions with `isExternal=true` only.
The date must be in the past or today. Make sure to provide `effectiveTimeOfDay` also.

allOf.description:
The effective time of day on `effectiveDate` in the product timezone. This attribute can be used for transactions with `isExternal=true` only. Required if `effectiveDate` is passed.

Note: for migration only, the value must be after 2AM in the product timezone.

createdBy.description:
Identifier of the user responsible for creating the transaction.
Can be a borrower, service agent or automated system process (such as Autopay).

enablePrepayments.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE**
`true` if the borrower opts to apply any overpayment amount to prepayment of future obligations.
`false` if the borrower opts to apply overpayments to the current obligation.

If this field is not passed, we reference the `allowPrepayments` configuration on the loan type.

allOf.description:
The document ID of a one-time payment consent given by the
borrower to debit their payment instrument.  The document is
stored in the HTML format and contains the disclosure shown to
the borrower at the time of the payment.  Required if
`previewMode=false` and Peach is processing payments (aka
`isExternal=false`) on behalf of the lender.

The document ID of a one-time payment consent screenshot
captured when a borrower made the payment.  Only applicable when
Peach App is used and company's
`config.evidence.captureScreenshot=true`.

drawId.description:
The draw identifier. If provided, the system will attempt to apply the payment to the specified draw. Any excess will be applied to
the rest of LOC/Draws based on the multi-waterfall that is defined for the line of credit type.

status.description:
The transaction status.

`scheduled` - payment or credit was scheduled for a future date that has not arrived yet. The payment has not applied to a loan yet.

`initiated` - payment was initiated and sent to a payment processor. The payment is applied to a loan. This status is used normally for ACH.

`pending` - payment was acknowledged by the payment processor and is being processed. For ACH the payment can be in pending status for a few days.

`succeeded` - payment was completed successfully.

`failed` - payment failed and was removed from the loan effective as of `initiated`, `pending` or `succeeded` status effective date. The system replays the loan as if the payment never happened.
It will also re-accrue interest since then.

`inDispute` - payment is in dispute (typically because of chargeback). The payment is removed from the loan effective as of `initiated`, `pending` or `succeeded` status effective date. The system replays the loan as if the payment never happened.
It will also re-accrue interest since then. Disputed payment can be for partial amount.

`canceled` - payment or credit was canceled. Payment can be canceled only if the current status is `scheduled`.

`chargeback` - payment was disputed and ruled against the lender. The payment was returned to the original payment instrument. Chargeback payment can be for partial amount.

actualAmount.description:
The actual amount that was processed. The system never debits
more than the loan outstanding balance.

scheduledAmount.description:
The scheduled amount. The actual amount charged can be lower from the
scheduled amount. It cannot be higher.

serviceCreditType.description: Type of the credit. Credit types are recorded differently in ledger/accounting.

serviceCreditSponsor.description:
Sponsor of the credit. Mainly used for ledger/accounting.

If `loanOwner`, the credit is recorded as expense in ledger/accounting.

If `loanServicer`, the credit is recorded as liability from the servicer.

If `merchant`, the credit is recorded as liability from the merchant.

amount.description: The amount to credit the borrower's balance.

effectiveDate.description:
This attribute can be used only during the migration process of loans from another system to Peach.
Any value passed for active loans will be ignored.

The effective date of the transaction in the product timezone.
This attribute can be used for transactions with `isExternal=true` only. The date must be in the past or today.
Make sure to provide `effectiveTimeOfDay` also.

allOf.description:
The effective time of day on `effectiveDate` in the product timezone. This attribute can be used for transactions with `isExternal=true` only. Required if `effectiveDate` is passed.

Note: for migration only, the value must be after 2AM in the product timezone.

scheduledDate.description:
This attribute should be used only for transactions that need to be applied now/today or are scheduled in the future.
Transactions that should be processed now/today, leave the attribute empty and the system
will set appropriate date and timestamp values based on the API call time.
If a future date is provided, the service credit will be scheduled for the future date and
won't be applied to the ledger until then.

To apply service credit with an effective date in the past, two steps are required:
- Post service credit with an empty `scheduledDate.` The system will apply the service credit now/today.
- Call "Backdate transaction" endpoint to move the service credit to a past date.

createdBy.description:
Identifier of the user responsible for creating the transaction.
Can be a borrower, service agent or automated system process (such as Autopay).

enablePrepayments.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE**
`true` if the borrower opts to apply any overpayment amount to prepayment of future obligations.
`false` if the borrower opts to apply overpayments to the current obligation.
If this field is not passed, we reference the `allowPrepayments` configuration on the loan type.

drawId.description:
The draw identifier. If provided, the system will attempt to apply the payment to the specified draw. Any excess will be applied to
the rest of LOC/Draws based on the multi-waterfall that is defined for the line of credit type.

isExternal.description: A transaction marked `isExternal=true` is for record purposes only. A transaction with an external `paymentInstrument` is automatically marked external.

externalId.description: A lender's identifier for a transaction.

status.description:
The transaction status. May only be passed when `isExternal=true`. External transactions can be created in: `scheduled`, `initiated`, `pending`, `succeeded`, or `failed`,

`scheduled` - payment or credit was scheduled for a future date that has not arrived yet. The payment has not applied to a loan yet.

`initiated` - payment was initiated and sent to a payment processor. The payment is applied to a loan. This status is used normally for ACH.

`pending` - payment was acknowledged by the payment processor and is being processed. For ACH the payment can be in pending status for a few days.

`succeeded` - payment was completed successfully.

`failed` - payment failed and was removed from the loan effective as of `initiated`, `pending` or `succeeded` status effective date. The system replays the loan as if the payment never happened.
It will also re-accrue interest since then.

`inDispute` - payment is in dispute (typically because of chargeback). The payment is removed from the loan effective as of `initiated`, `pending` or `succeeded` status effective date. The system replays the loan as if the payment never happened.
It will also re-accrue interest since then. Disputed payment can be for partial amount.

`canceled` - payment or credit was canceled. Payment can be canceled only if the current status is `scheduled`.

`chargeback` - payment was disputed and ruled against the lender. The payment was returned to the original payment instrument. Chargeback payment can be for partial amount.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument identifier that was charged.

actualAmount.description:
The actual amount that was processed. The system never debits
more than the loan outstanding balance.

scheduledAmount.description:
The scheduled amount. The actual amount charged can be lower from the
scheduled amount. It cannot be higher.

amount.description: The amount of the payment.

scheduledDate.description: If provided must be a date in the future.

effectiveDate.description:
The effective date of the transaction in the product timezone. This attribute can be used for transactions with `isExternal=true` only.
The date must be in the past or today. Make sure to provide `effectiveTimeOfDay` also.

allOf.description:
The effective time of day on `effectiveDate` in the product timezone. This attribute can be used for transactions with `isExternal=true` only. Required if `effectiveDate` is passed.

Note: for migration only, the value must be after 2AM in the product timezone.

createdBy.description:
Identifier of the user responsible for creating the transaction.
Can be a borrower, service agent or automated system process (such as Autopay).

allOf.description:
The document ID of a one-time payment consent given by the
borrower to debit their payment instrument.  The document is
stored in the HTML format and contains the disclosure shown to
the borrower at the time of the payment.  Required if
`previewMode=false` and Peach is processing payments (aka
`isExternal=false`) on behalf of the lender.

isExternal.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Updating this field does not modify the transaction.

A transaction marked `isExternal=true` is for record purposes only. A transaction with
an external `paymentInstrument` is automatically marked external.

isVirtual.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Updating this field does not modify the transaction.

A transaction marked `isVirtual=true` is not a real transaction, but represents a part of another transaction.
This is used to store the principal/interest split on draws in Line of Credits as well as splits between multiple
installment loans that were applied as a single payment.

paidPrincipalAmount.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Support for this field will be removed in the future.

The paid amount allocated to principal

paidInterestAmount.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Support for this field will be removed in the future.

The paid amount allocated to interest

paidFeesAmount.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Support for this field will be removed in the future.

The paid amount allocated to fees

paidOverAmount.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Support for this field will be removed in the future.

Stores any excess amount that was not allocated to principal, interest or fees.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of when the statement was created.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp of when the statement was updated. On update, the system will create a new version of the statement.

deletedAt.description: The timestamp of when the statement was deleted.

version.description:
The version of the statement. When a statement is updated, we don't delete the old version.
We create a new version of the statement. The most recent version of the statement is returned.

billingCycleStartDate.description: The start date of the statement billing cycle.

billingCycleEndDate.description: The end date of the statement billing cycle.

paymentDueDate.description: The due date of the statement.

documentDescriptorId.description: The statement's document descriptor ID. To get the actual document, use the "Download document content" endpoint.

minimumDueAmount.description:
The minimum or recurring amount due for this period (also called obligation). This amount is a sum of interest
accrued, fees and part of a principal. This amount does not net any payments or service credits made in the period.

newBalanceAmount.description: The new balance amount for the period.

statementLogicVersion.description:
The statement logic version. When a new statement is generated, it will use the current loan type `statementLogicVersion` value.
That version is also stored on each statement object. When/if the statement is regenerated, it will use the
`statementLogicVersion` value from the statement object vs. loan type. This guarantees that the system uses the same
logic as the original statement.

- Version `1` - first/original statement logic. All loan types created before the release of the version `2`, would be set to `1`. When a lender is ready, they can ask Peach to upgrade to version `2`. All statements that were generated before the release of version `2` would be marked as version `1`.
- Version `2` - second statement logic that was introduced in Q2 2024.

amount.description: The amount of the activity.

dateOfActivity.description: The date the activity was posted.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the activity.

referenceNumber.description: The reference number or identifier of the activity.

amount.description:
The effective amount of the activity that was applied in the ledger in the current or a past period. `amount` and `originalAmount` are expected to be equal unless something happened to the activity after the activity was originally applied in the ledger.

Example 1:
A payment was originally processed for $100.00 from the borrower's bank account.
Later, $30.00 was reversed (the $30.00 was sent back to the borrower’s bank account).
The `amount` would be equal to $70.00.
The `originalAmount` would be equal to $100.00

Example 2:
A service fee of $10.00 was supposed to be charged.
A line (e.g. credit card) had a credit balance of $3.50 (in other words, $3.50 was owed to a borrower).
The `amount` would be equal to $6.50.
The `originalAmount` would be equal to $10.00.

It’s important to understand how `amount` is used to calculate either:
One of the “total” attributes such as `totalPaymentsForThisPeriod`.
Or, the `totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod`.

When `isAdjustment=true`, the `amount` is reflected in the `totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod`. This is because the reported activity impacted one of the past periods, the loan was replayed and the balance was adjusted. Keep in mind that `totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod` can be different from the activity `amount`. For example:
A payment was originally processed for $100.00 two periods ago.
Later, the payment was disputed by a borrower and the chargeback was accepted for the full amount of $100.00.
If the line accrues interest, the `totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod` would be different from $100.00 because additional interest was accrued.
The `amount` would be equal to $0.00.
The `originalAmount` would be equal to $100.00.
The `totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod` would be more than $100.00.

When `isAdjustment=false`, the `amount` is used to calculate one of the “total” attributes: `totalPaymentsForThisPeriod`, `totalFeesForThisPeriod`, etc.

originalAmount.description: The original amount of the activity that was applied in the ledger before any changes or adjustments.

drawId.description: The draw identifier that the activity belongs to. Only applicable to line of credit and the following activity types: `fee`, `purchase`, `purchaseDispute`.

isAdjustment.description:
`false` if the activity was originally applied in the ledger in the current period. In other words, it’s not an adjustment of an activity that was already reported in a past period.

`true` if the activity was reported in the current period but it impacted one of the past periods. In other words, the activity is a change or an adjustment of one of the prior activities that was reported in a past period.
When an activity with an effective date in one of the past periods is reported, the balance impact is captured in the `totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod` attribute. Keep in mind that `totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod` can be different from the activity `amount`.

Example:
  - A payment was originally processed for $100.00 two periods ago. That activity was reported as `isAdjustment=false`.
  - Later, the payment was disputed by a borrower and the chargeback was accepted for the full amount of $100.00. The chargeback activity would be reported as `isAdjustment=true`.
  - If the line accrues interest, the `totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod` would be different from $100.00 because additional interest was accrued.
  - The `amount` would be equal to $0.00.
  - The `originalAmount` would be equal to $100.00.
  - The `amountForTotals` would be equal to $0.00.
  - The `totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod` would be greater than $100.00.

dateOfActivity.description:
The date when the activity was created. Also called “transaction date”. Most activities will have `dateOfActivity` equals to `effectiveDate`.

In some cases, `dateOfActivity` can be different from `effectiveDate`. For example:
  - A credit card purchase was made and authorized on Mar 11, 2023.
  - The purchase was captured/settled on Mar 13, 2023.
  - dateOfActivity is Mar 11, 2023.
  - effectiveDate is Mar 13, 2023.

effectiveDate.description:
The date when the activity was applied in the ledger. Also called “post date”. Most activities will have `dateOfActivity` equals to `effectiveDate`.

In some cases, `dateOfActivity` can be different from `effectiveDate`. For example:
  - A credit card swipe/purchase was made and authorized on Mar 11, 2023.
  - The purchase was captured/settled on Mar 13, 2023.
  - `dateOfActivity` is Mar 11, 2023.
  - `effectiveDate` is Mar 13, 2023.

referenceNumber.description: Peach Public ID of the underlying object that created the activity.

referenceNumberExternal.description: External ID of the underlying object that created the activity. If the corresponding object doesn’t have an `externalId`, the attribute value will be `null`.

displaySign.description: The sign that should be displayed next to the amount.

version.description:
The version of the statement. When a statement is updated, we don't delete the old version.
We create a new version of the statement. The most recent version of the statement is returned.

billingCycleStartDate.description: The start date of the statement billing cycle.

billingCycleEndDate.description: The end date of the statement billing cycle.

paymentDueDate.description: The due date of the statement.

documentDescriptorId.description: The statement's document descriptor ID. To get the actual document, use the "Download document content" endpoint.

daysInBillingCycle.description: The number of calendar days in the billing cycle (also called period).

minimumAmountDue.description:
The minimum or recurring amount due for this period (also called obligation). This amount is a sum of interest accrued,
fees and part of a principal. This amount does not net any payments or service credits made in the period.

totalInterestForThisPeriod.description:
For LOC:
  Total amount of interest accrued on draws in the period. The interest amount accrued on each draw is truncated to the nearest cent and
  the sum of the truncated values is reported by this field.
For installment loan:
  If the period is still open, the amount will be accrued interest in the period plus expected interest to be accrued until the due date.

totalFeesForThisPeriod.description: Total amount of fees charged in the period.

totalPaymentsForThisPeriod.description: Total of payments made in the period.

totalPaymentReversalsForThisPeriod.description: Total of payments reversed/returned to the borrower in the period.

totalCreditsForThisPeriod.description: Total of credits applied in the period.

totalRefundsForThisPeriod.description: Total of refunds applied in the period.

totalCreditReversalsForThisPeriod.description: Total of credits reversed/canceled in the period.

totalAdjustmentsForThisPeriod.description:
In some cases account balances can be adjusted because some event changed in the past.
For example: late return of a payment or interest changed for a period in the past.
When such adjustments are made this attribute reflects the net adjusted amount.

overdueAmount.description: Overdue amount as of the statement date and corresponding period.

fulfilledAmount.description: The total amount of payments and service credits applied towards minimumAmountDue.

remainingAmount.description: The total amount remaining to be paid by the borrower after accounting for payments and service credits applied in the period.

overpaymentsAmount.description:
In the case that loan policy allows, this represents the amount of overpayments applied to the period. Overpayments will only arise when
an obligation (aka `minimumAmountDue`) is completely fulfilled.

newBalanceAmount.description: New balance (also called statement balance) of the account as of the statement date and corresponding period.

creditBalanceAmount.description: The total amount of money that the lender owes to the borrower.

newPrincipalBalance.description: Principal balance of the account as of the statement date and corresponding period.

yearToDateFeesCharged.description: Total amount of fees charged in the current year from 01/01/YYYY to the statement date.

yearToDateInterestCharged.description:
Total amount of interest charged in the current year from 01/01/YYYY to the statement date. This field is computed as the sum
of the interest accrued by the draws on this line and then rounded to the nearest cent.

isDisplayLatePaymentWarning.description:
If `true`, the statement should show a special warning amount late fees - “Late Payment Warning” paragraph.
If the product type doesn’t have any late fees the system will return `false`.

lateFeeUpToAmount.description: The maximum amount of late fee that can be charged in the period (if the borrower doesn’t pay on time). The attribute will have value if `isDisplayLatePaymentWarning` is `true`.

year.description:
The year of the statement. Year-to-date fields are calculated based on this value.
Usually the `endDate` of the statement period is the reference for the year. The exception is when the `statementDate`
is before the `endDate`, in which case `statementDate` is the reference for the year.

lastPeriodPrincipalPaid.description: Principal amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) in the statement corresponding period.

lastPeriodInterestPaid.description: Interest amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) in the statement corresponding period.

lastPeriodFeesPaid.description: Fees amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) in the statement corresponding period.

lastPeriodTotalPaid.description: Total amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) in the statement corresponding period.

lastPeriodOverPaid.description:
Excess amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) that was not allocated to principal,
interest or fees in the statement corresponding period.

ytdPrincipalPaid.description: Principal amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) year to date, from 01/01/YYYY to the statement date.

ytdInterestPaid.description: Interest amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) year to date, from 01/01/YYYY to the statement date.

ytdFeesPaid.description: Fees amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) year to date, from 01/01/YYYY to the statement date.

ytdTotalPaid.description: Total amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) year to date, from 01/01/YYYY to the statement date.

ytdOverPaid.description:
Excess amount paid (by the borrower or via credit) that was not allocated to principal,
interest or fees year to date, from 01/01/YYYY to the statement date.

autopay.description: The Autopay details at the time of statement generation. Note: Autopay plan can be canceled any time by the borrower, agent (on behalf of the borrower) or system (e.g. bank account closed).

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument ID with which this autopay plan will be charged through.

date.description: The due date of the expected payment.

amount.description: The amount of the expected payment.

name.description:
The borrower name. If the borrower is a person, the value will be `firstName` + `lastName`.
If the borrower is a business, the value will be `businessName`.

statementLogicVersion.description:
