The statement logic version. When a new statement is generated, it will use the current loan type `statementLogicVersion` value.
That version is also stored on each statement object. When/if the statement is regenerated, it will use the
`statementLogicVersion` value from the statement object vs. loan type. This guarantees that the system uses the same
logic as the original statement.

- Version `1` - first/original statement logic. All loan types created before the release of the version `2`, would be set to `1`. When a lender is ready, they can ask Peach to upgrade to version `2`. All statements that were generated before the release of version `2` would be marked as version `1`.
- Version `2` - second statement logic that was introduced in Q2 2024.

totalAmountDue.description:
The total amount due for the period as of the time when the statement was generated. It represents the sum
of the minimumAmountDue and overdueAmount minus any payments or service credits applied in the period.

prepaidAmount.description: Amount paid in the period prior to due date.

recurringAmount.description: The most recent amortized recurring amount.

totalAdvancesForThisPeriod.description: The total amount of advances made in the period.

UtilizationAmount.description:
The loan or draw utilization amount. In other words, the amount of credit limit used by the borrower. Only applicable to line of
credit or installment loan with multi-advances.

For line of credit only:
The amount is calculated based on the loan type creditLimit.utilizationCalculation configuration. For example: line of credit utilization can
be calculated as sum of principal buckets only without any interest or fees.

The amount can be negative. Negative amount happens only when total amount of payments made by the borrower plus the total amount of
service credits exceeded the line or draw balance. Any future purchases will first deplete the overpayment amount.

minAmountDue.description: The minimum amount due of the draw/sub-line for the period.

fulfilledAmount.description: The total amount of payments and service credits applied towards `minAmountDue``.

remainingAmount.description: The total amount remaining to be paid by the borrower after accounting for payments and service credits applied in the period.

overpaymentsAmount.description:
In the case that loan policy allows, this represents the amount of overpayments applied to the period. Overpayments will only arise when an
obligation (aka `minAmountDue`) is completely fulfilled.

nameOfBalance.description: The name of the balance (also called draw/sub-line).

apr.description: The net interest rate (also called APR), interest rate minus promo rate, of the draw/sub-line as of the last day of the period (aka `billingCycleEndDate`).

isVariableRate.description: `true` if the rate is variable. `false` if the rate is fixed.

totalPurchasesForThisPeriod.description: Total of new purchases on the draw in the period corresponding to the statement.

interestCharged.description:
The amount of interest accrued in the period. This value is computed by truncating (to the nearest cent) the interest accrued in this period.
This is amount is equal to the sum of `interestChargedDetails.interestCharged` amounts in the `interestChargedDetails` array.

balanceEndOfPeriod.description: The draw/sub-line remaining balance at the end of the period.

interestChargedDetails.description: Details of interest charged in the period.

interestRate.description:
The net interest rate that the balance accrued interest for `numberDays`. If the draw has a single interest rate, the value is also called
APR of the draw/sub-line. If the draw was created in the middle of the period or was paid off before the period ended, the system will count
days as `interestRate=0`.

numberDays.description: Number of days in the period that principal was subject to the `interestRate`. Sum of `numberDays` in the array is equal to the number of days in the period.

balanceSubjectToInterestRate.description:
The average balance of draw/sub-line that was subject to the `interestRate`. Calculated by adding the principal amount on days with `interestRate`
divided by `numberDays`. Also called Average Daily Balance.

interestCharged.description: The net interest rate (also called APR). Calculated as interest rate minus promo rate of the draw/sub-line as of the last day of the period (aka the billingCycleEndDate).

gracePeriod.description: If `true`, the account is eligible for the benefits of "grace period".

totalPurchasesForThisPeriod.description: Total of new purchases in the period corresponding to the statement.

totalCashBacksForThisPeriod.description: Total of cashBacks applied in the period.

creditLimit.description:
The credit limit amount for the line or draw. Only applicable to line of credit or installment loan with multiple
advances. For installment loans with multi-advances, it is the amount financed set at origination.

locClosedDate.description: The date LOC was closed. If LOC is closed, new purchases are not allowed. Closed LOC can still have outstanding balance.

isDisplayMinimumPaymentWarning.description: If `true`, the statement should show a special warning amount minimum payment - “Minimum Payment Warning” paragraph and table.

minimumPaymentWarning.description: The details required to show the Minimum Payment Warning table in the statement.

minimumPaymentDuration.description:
The number of years it should take to pay off the balance if the borrower makes the minimum payment only.
*Per regulations*:
If the minimum payment repayment estimate is less than 2 years, the card issuer must disclose the estimate in months.
Otherwise, the estimate must be disclosed in years and rounded to the nearest whole year.

minimumPaymentDurationMonths.description:
The number of months it should take to pay off the balance if the borrower makes the minimum payment only.
*Per regulations*:
If the minimum payment repayment estimate is less than 2 years, the card issuer must disclose the estimate in months.
Otherwise, the estimate must be disclosed in years and rounded to the nearest whole year.

minimumPaymentTotalCostAmount.description: The estimated total amount (or cost) the borrower is expected to pay if the borrower makes the minimum payment only.

comparedToPaymentAmount.description: The payment amount that the minimum amount is compared to.

comparedToDuration.description:
The number of years it should take to pay off the balance if the borrower pays the `comparedToPaymentAmount` only.
*Per regulations*:
If the minimum payment repayment estimate is less than 2 years, the card issuer must disclose the estimate in months.
Otherwise, the estimate must be disclosed in years and rounded to the nearest whole year.

comparedToDurationMonths.description:
The number of months it should take to pay off the balance if the borrower pays the `comparedToPaymentAmount` only.
*Per regulations*:
If the minimum payment repayment estimate is less than 2 years, the card issuer must disclose the estimate in months.
Otherwise, the estimate must be disclosed in years and rounded to the nearest whole year.

comparedToTotalCostAmount.description: The estimated total amount (or cost) the borrower is expected to pay if the borrower pays the `comparedToPaymentAmount` only.

date.description: The due date of the expected payment.

status.description:
The status of the expected payment.

`booked` - borrower is or was expected to make the payment.

`modified` - the amount was modified at some point and different from the original amount.

`canceled` - borrower is or was not expected to make the payment.

`processed` - a payment has been scheduled for this expected payment.

amount.description: The amount of the expected payment.

originalAmount.description:
The amount of the expected payment at creation. The `amount` will change as a result of refreshing
expected payments, but the `originalAmount` will stay the same.

principalAmount.description:
The portion of the `amount` allocated to principal.
Available only for `paymentType=periodicPayment`.

interestAmount.description:
The portion of the `amount` allocated to net interest.
Available only for `paymentType=periodicPayment`.

interestBeforeDiscountAmount.description:
The interest amount that was accrued before promo rate(s) or any discount.
Available only for `paymentType=periodicPayment`.

isDeferred.description: `true` if the amount of this expected payment has been deferred before.

dynamicFeeDetails.description: When `paymentType`=`dynamicFee` this will contain details of the dynamic fee.

loanFeeId.description: The loan fee identifier in the system.

dynamicFeeTypeId.description: The dynamic fee type identifier in the system.

apiName.description: The API name of the dynamic fee. For example: 'lateFee' or 'breatherFee'.

displayName.description: The display name of the dynamic fee as shown to the borrower in the UI. For example: `Late Fee` or `Breather Fee`.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument ID with which this autopay plan will be charged through.

agreementDocumentId.description: The document descriptor ID corresponding to the autopay agreement document.

type.description:
Indicates how Autopay amount will be calculated for each closed statement.

`statementMinimumAmount` - an Autopay will debit the statement minimum amount for the period.

`statementMinimumAmountPlusExtra` - an Autopay will debit the statement minimum amount for the period plus
extra amount. The extra amount is typically applied to principal. This is ONLY applicable to non-amortized
line of credit loans.

`statementBalanceAmount` - an Autopay transaction will debit the statement balance for the period. This is ONLY applicable to non-amortized
line of credit loans.

extraAmount.description: The extra amount that the borrower agrees to pay if `type=statementMinimumAmountPlusExtra`.

isAlignedToDueDates.description:
`true` - the Autopay transactions will be processed on the loan's due dates.

`false` - the Autopay transactions schedule will be different from the loan's due dates schedule.

If `isAlignedToDueDates=false` then `paymentFrequency` and `specificDays` must be provided.

paymentFrequency.description: The Autopay payments frequency. `Weekly` frequency is not supported for line of credit.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument ID with which this autopay plan will be charged through.

agreementDocumentId.description: The document descriptor ID corresponding to the autopay agreement document.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument ID with which this autopay plan will be charged through.

agreementDocumentId.description: The document ID for the signed autopay agreement. Required if `previewMode=false`.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

sendNotice.description: When set to `false`, the system will NOT send a `autopayPaymentMethodUpdated` notice to the borrower.

previewMode.description: In `previewMode=true`, the loan doesn't change, and no changes are saved to the database.

isAlignedToDueDates.description:
`true` - the Autopay payments will be aligned and processed on the loan's due dates.

`false` - the Autopay payments schedule will be different from the loan's due dates schedule.

If `isAlignedToDueDates=false` then `paymentFrequency` and `specificDays` must be provided.

If the frequency and specific days of autopay matches the loan, we assume that it is `isAlignedToDueDates=true`.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument ID with which this autopay plan will be charged through.

agreementDocumentId.description: The document ID for the signed autopay agreement. Required if `previewMode=false`.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

sendNotice.description: When set to `false`, the system will NOT send a `autopayEnabled` notice to the borrower.

previewMode.description: If `previewMode=true`, the loan doesn't change and no changes are saved to the database.

amountType.description:
Indicates how Autopay amount will be calculated for each closed statement.

`statementMinimumAmount` - an Autopay will debit the statement minimum amount for the period. The statement minimum
amount is defined as the sum of the expected payment amounts in the given period.

`statementMinimumAmountPlusExtra` - an Autopay will debit the statement minimum amount for the period plus
extra amount. The extra amount is typically applied to principal. In any given autopay period, if the
'statementMinimumAmountPlusExtra' is greater than the outstanding balance on the line of credit, we only debit
up to the amount of the latter.

`statementBalanceAmount` - an Autopay transaction will debit the statement balance as of the statement creation
date for the given period.

extraAmount.description: The extra amount that the borrower agrees to pay if `type=statementMinimumAmountPlusExtra`.

isAlignedToDueDates.description:
`true` - the Autopay transactions will be processed on the loan's due dates.

`false` - the Autopay transactions schedule will be different from the loan's due dates schedule.
If `isAlignedToDueDates=false` then `offsetFromDueDate` must be provided.

offsetFromDueDate.description:
Number of calendars days before due dates when Autopay payments are processed.
If `isAlignedToDueDates` is false, it is required to specify the offset from the due dates. Depending on whether there are 1 or 2 auto-payments
per period, the array should include either 1 or 2 integers.

  - `onceAPeriod` - borrower can choose X days before the due date. Provide one number in a valid range between "1" and "statement to due date"
  days (e.g. 14 or 21). For example: `[5]` means the Autopay will be processed 5 calendar days before a given due date.
  - `twiceAPeriod` - borrower can choose two offsets, in other words, Autopay will process half the amount on the first Autopay date, and half
  the amount on the second Autopay date. Both days are "offsets", with "0" meaning on the due date. For example: `[5, 0]` means the first Autopay
  payment will be scheduled and processed 5 days before the due date, and the second Autopay payment will be scheduled and processed on the due date.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The payment instrument ID with which this autopay plan will be charged through.

agreementDocumentId.description: The document ID for the signed autopay agreement. Required if `previewMode=false`.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

sendNotice.description: When set to `false`, the system will NOT send a `autopayEnabled` notice to the borrower.

OpenToBuyAmount.description:
The amount of available credit a borrower has based on the `utilizationAmount` and transactions’ hold day end date.
The difference between `availableCreditAmount` and the `openToBuyAmount` is that `availableCreditAmount` doesn't take into account
transactions' hold days. In other words, `availableCreditAmount` is more optimistic. Only applicable to `lineOfCredit`.

OverLimitAmount.description:
The amount of credit used above the `creditLimitAmount` for the line of credit or draw. Only applicable to line of credit products.
Calculation is `max(0, utilizationAmount-creditLimitAmount)`, meaning that the over limit amount will only be > 0 if utilization
is greater than credit limit. Otherwise, over limit amount will always be 0.

allOf.description: The up-to-date loan balances as of the time of inquiry.

outstandingBalances.description:
When a loan is `active`, outstanding balances combine non-due, due, and overdue balances. When a loan is
`accelerated`, outstanding balances are equal to non-accrual balances. When a loan is `chargedOff`,
outstanding balances are equal to charged-off balances.

outstandingTotalAmount.description:
The total outstanding balance sums outstanding principal, interest, and fees. Also called the loan payoff amount.

If the loan is charged off, the outstanding totalAmount will be equal to the `chargedOffTotalAmount`.

outstandingFeesAmount.description:
The fees portion of the `outstandingTotalAmount`.

`outstandingFeesAmount` is the sum of `outstandingOriginationFeesAmount`, `outstandingDrawFeesAmount`, `outstandingLateFeesAmount`, and `outstandingModificationFeesAmount`.

outstandingBalancesWithPromo.description:
Promotional balances represent various balances needed to be paid in order to exercise the same-as-cash or
other promotional program.

outstandingTotalAmount.description: The remaining amount needed to be paid in order to exercise the same-as-cash or other promotional program.

nonDueBalances.description: Non-due balances represent balances that are not yet due.

nonDueTotalAmount.description: The total non-due balance sums non-due principal, interest, and fees.

nonDueFeesAmount.description:
The fees portion of the `nonDueFeesAmount`.

`nonDueFeesAmount` is the sum of `nonDueOriginationFeesAmount`, `nonDueDrawFeesAmount`, `nonDueLateFeesAmount`, and `nonDueModificationFeesAmount`.

dueBalances.description: Due balances represent balances that are currently due.

dueTotalAmount.description: The total due balance sums due principal, interest, and fees.

dueFeesAmount.description:
The fees portion of the `dueFeesAmount`.

`dueFeesAmount` is the sum of `dueOriginationFeesAmount`, `dueDrawFeesAmount`, `dueLateFeesAmount`, and `dueModificationFeesAmount`.

overdueBalances.description: Overdue balances represent balances that are overdue.

overdueTotalAmount.description: The total overdue balance sums overdue principal, interest, and fees.

overduePrincipalAmount.description: The overdue principal portion of the `overdueTotalAmount`.

overdueInterestAmount.description: The overdue interest portion of the `overdueTotalAmount`.

overdueFeesAmount.description:
The fees portion of the `overdueFeesAmount`.

`overdueFeesAmount` is the sum of `overdueOriginationFeesAmount`, `overdueDrawFeesAmount`, `overdueLateFeesAmount`, and `overdueModificationFeesAmount`.

nonAccrualBalances.description: Non-accrual balances represent balances that are non-accrual.

nonAccrualTotalAmount.description: The total non-accrual balance sums non-accrual principal, interest, and fees.

chargedOffBalances.description: Charged-off balances represent balances that are charged-off.

chargedOffTotalAmount.description: The total charged-off balance sums charged-off principal, interest, and fees.

paidBalances.description: Paid balances represent the amounts paid to date.

paidTotalAmount.description: The total payment and service credits made from the start of the loan to the date of inquiry. Excludes reimbursements.

paidPaymentsAmount.description: The total amount of payments applied to the loan until today, excluding reimbursements.

paidCreditsAmount.description: The total amount of service credits applied to the loan until today.

paidReimbursementsAmount.description: The total amount of reimbursements applied to the loan until today.

paidPrincipalAmount.description: The total amount of principal paid until today.

paidInterestAmount.description: The total amount of interest paid until today.

paidFeesAmount.description: The total amount of fees paid until today.

paidOverAmount.description: Stores any excess amount that was not allocated to principal, interest or fees.

interestAccruedTotalAmount.description: The total interest accrued - net of interest discount and foregone interest - from the start of the loan to the date of inquiry.

interestDiscountTotalAmount.description: The total interest discount from the start of the loan to the date of inquiry.

forgoneInterestCapAmount.description:
The amount of foregone interest that exceeded the interest cap amount. This is only
applicable to loans that had `totalInterestCapAmount` set to `true` at loan origination.

forgoneInterestRoundingAmount.description:
The amount of interest that was forgone because of rounding. Applicable only to:
 1. Lines of credit (and draws) with minimum payments
 1. Lines of credit (and draws) with balloon amortization
 1. Installment loans with balloon amortization

interestAccruedYearToDateAmount.description: The amount of interest accrued year-to-date not including interest discounts and forgone interest.

interestAccruedYearToDateForStatementAmo.description:
This amount should be used for statements. The amount of interest accrued year-to-date not including
interest discounts and forgone interest.

The Peach system accrues interest on a "following" day based on the principal balance at the end-of-day of a prior day.
The interest effective date is the "following" day. For example, interest that accrues on `2022-01-01` is based on the
principal balance at the end-of-day of `2021-12-13`. The interest is effectively booked to the ledger on `2022-01-01`.

When summarizing year to date interest for a statement, the interest that was accrued effectively on `2022-01-01` should
be part of the 2021 year (in the example above). This is the main difference between the `interestAccruedYearToDateAmount`
and `interestAccruedYearToDateForStatementAmount` fields.

feesChargedYearToDateAmount.description: The amount of fees charged year-to-date.

overdueNumberDays.description: If the loan is currently overdue, this represents the number of days the loan has been overdue.

reimbursementAmount.description: The total amount that a lender owes to the borrower. After a reimbursement is processed, the amount is reduced accordingly.

creditLimitAmount.description:
The credit limit amount for the line or draw. Only applicable to line of credit or installment loan with multiple
advances. For installment loans with multi-advances, it is the amount financed set at origination.

availableCreditAmount.description:
The available credit amount to use of the loan or draw. Only applicable to line of credit or installment loan with multi-advances.
If the borrower exceeded their credit limit, the `availableCreditAmount` will be zero.

calculatedAt.description: Timestamp when the balances were calculated.

allOf.description: The projected loan balances as of the time of inquiry.

expectedTotalAmount.description: The total amount the borrower is projected to pay under the assumption of continued on-time payments.

projectedPayoffDate.description: Date for when the loan is expected to be paid off, assuming current balances and expected payments or autopays.

projectedTotalDueBalanceTenDays.description:
This is the projected loan total due balance in 10 calendar days from today. The difference between today's
`outstandingTotalBalance` and the estimate in 10 days is only the interest that would accrue on the loan.

effectiveDate.description: The date at which this ownership structure came into effect.

promoTypeId.description: The promotional program type's unique identifier.

externalId.description: A lender's unique identifier for a specific promotional program.

status.description:
The promotional program status on a specific loan.

  `pending` - the promotion was created but was not activated yet.

  `active` - the promotion is active.

  `canceled` - the promotion has been canceled for a reason. The reason provided in the `promoCancelReason` attribute.

  `exercised` - the promotion was successfully exercised.

promoType.description: The promotional program type. A loan can have only one promotional program of each type.

displayName.description: The promotional program name as it is shown to borrowers.

description.description:
A legal description of the promotional program as it should be communicated and shown to borrowers. If the
description is provided, borrowers will see the description in the Borrower Portal.

promoDurationDays.description:
The promotional program duration as a number of calendar days. If `promoDurationDays` is passed, the system will
calculate the `promoEndDate`. Pass only one of the attributes, `promoEndDate` or `promoDurationDays`.

promoGracePeriodDays.description: The promotional program grace period as a number of calendar days.

sacDisqualifyOverdueDays.description:
The number of loan overdue days that would disqualify the promotional program. Any occurrence of`sacDisqualifyOverdueDays`
or more of number days overdue during the promotional period would disqualify (aka cancel) the promotional program.

metaData.description: Store any type of key/value pairs in the form of a JSON dictionary.

promoEffectiveEndDate.description:
The promotional program effective end-date inclusive of the `promoGracePeriodDays`. If the `promoGracePeriodDays` is
not passed, the `promoEffectiveEndDate` will be equal to the `promoEndDate`.

promoCanceledBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for canceling the promotion program.
Can be an borrower, agent, or automated system process.

promoCancelReason.description:
The cancellation reason.

  `expired` - the promo expired.

  `disqualified` - the promo was disqualified for various reasons.

  `borrowerOptedOut` - the borrower decided to opt out from the promotional program.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

sacExcercisedRateId.description: The unique rate ID that was created to set on the loan in order to exercise the promotion rate.

sacRemainingAmountToExercise.description: The remaining amount needed to satisfy the Same-As-Cash promotion. Only returned if `promoStatus=active`.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

externalId.description: A lender's unique identifier for a specific promotional program.

status.description:
The promotional program status on a specific loan.

  `pending` - the promotion was created but was not activated yet.

  `active` - the promotion is active.

  `canceled` - the promotion has been canceled for a reason. The reason provided in the `promoCancelReason` attribute.

  `exercised` - the promotion was successfully exercised.

promoDurationDays.description:
The promotional program duration as a number of calendar days. If `promoDurationDays` is passed, the system will
calculate the `promoEndDate`. Pass only one of the attributes, `promoEndDate` or `promoDurationDays`.

promoGracePeriodDays.description: The promotional program grace period as a number of calendar days.

sacDisqualifyOverdueDays.description:
The number of loan overdue days that would disqualify the promotional program. Any occurrence of `sacDisqualifyOverdueDays`
or more during the promotional period would disqualify (aka cancel) the promotional program.

metaData.description: Store any type of key/value pairs in the form of a JSON dictionary.

caseId.description: An identifier for an existing case.

sendNotice.description: When set to `true` the system will send a `promoProgramCanceled` notice to the borrower.

InteractionAgentOutcome.description:
Provides details on the outcome of the interaction according to an agent.

Note this captures the "human" outcome of an interaction: e.g., Did you talk the person you intended
to? Did the other chat recipient become unresponsive?

For the "technical" status of an interaction, see `statusDetails`. e.g., : Did it fail to
send? Was it blocked by Compliance Guard?

- `voiceSpokeWithFirstParty` - Agent spoke with borrower
- `voiceSpokeWithThirdParty` - Agent spoke with someone other than the borrower
- `voiceLeftVoicemail` - Agent left voicemail
- `voiceReachedVoicemailNoMessageLeft` - Agent reached voicemail but did not leave a message
- `voiceRangNoPickup` - Phone rang, no voicemail was reached, and the call ended, or the agent hung up
- `voiceLineBusyNoRing` - Agent reached busy phone line
- `voicePickedHungUp` - Agent heard call pick up and immediate hang up
- `voiceDisconnectedWhileQueuedOnHold` - Caller hung up while on hold
- `voiceUnexpectedDisconnect` - The call was unexpectedly disconnected
- `voiceFailedToInitiate` - Outbound voice call could not start for some reason
- `voiceNumberDisconnected` - Outbound voice call to disconnected phone number

AssociatedLoanId.description: The ID of a Loan. This marks a particular loan as associated with this interaction.

AssociatedLoanIds.description: The IDs of several loans. This marks several loans as associated with this interaction.

sensitive.description:
Set this flag if this interaction has sensitive information. The flag
is used for proper authorization of access to the information.

isExternal.description:
Boolean indicating the source of an Interaction. If `true`, the
interaction was supplied by the lender via API. If `false`,
the interaction was created by Peach.

externalId.description:
The lender's identifier for the interaction.

After the object is successfully created, a lender can use ID or externalId identifiers to fetch the object.

To fetch the object using externalId you need to add `ext-` to the URL.

Note: Don't add ext- to the identifier value. For example: if the external identifier is `ABCDE`, then pass externalId=ACBCE and NOT ext-ABCDE when creating the object.

previousInteractionId.description:
If a previous interaction identifier is provided, the current and
previous interactions will be linked. This can either be Peach's or a lender's
external identifier.

twilioErrorCode.description:
Raw error code from Twilio SMS service. The full list of codes
can be found at https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/errors .

isTransactional.description:
`true` when this interaction is considered "transactional".

Transactional interactions are those which are sent via an automated system in response
to an event or some action taken. e.g., an email sent to confirm a payment was made is transactional;
likewise an email sent to confirm a password change is transacrtional. Examples of
non-transactional messages would be: those sent by an agent in response to a customer request,
for collections, or for marketing.

It's important to mark these messages correctly, because different laws may apply to messages
depending on if they're considered "transactional".

Note: Can be `null` for interactions sent before the transactional-ness was added to the API.

createdBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for initiating the interaction.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

contactExternalId.description:
The lender's identifier of the contact information.

This should not include any `ext-` prefix as we know this is an external ID field.

statusUpdatedAt.description: The time of a status update.

agentOutcomeUpdatedAt.description: The datetime of the last `agentOutcome` update.

statusDetailsUpdatedAt.description: The datetime of the last `statusDetails` update.

endedAt.description:
End time of the interaction. This attribute is optional and is used
for logging only.

For CRM-managed `voice` interactions, a call is considered ended
when either the borrower or the agent disconnects.

templateVersionId.description: Peach internal template identifier that was used to render the interaction.

sendAt.description:
If set, records the time that the associated notification was Scheduled
to be sent.

supercaseBulkOperationId.description: If a `SupercaseBulkOperation` created this interaction, this is that ID

failureDescriptionShort.description: Short text describing the failure reason. Normally displayed in UI.

failureDescriptionLong.description: Detailed text describing the failure reason and any appropriate actions the user may take to fix the issue.

complianceGuardRuleId.description:
The Compliance Guard rule identifier that blocked the interaction.
Only applicable if the `statusDetails=blockedByComplianceGuard` and a rule actually blocked the interaction.
In some cases the interaction can be blocked before rules are checked (e.g. a borrower is missing an address).
In such a case the `complianceGuardRuleId` will be empty/null.

channel.description: The channel by which an interaction occurs.

content.description: The content and attributes of the message sent. Normally in JSON format.

PhoneNumber.description:
An E.164 formatted phone number—a phone number prefixed with a `+` and
a country code. (Note that in the United States this is `+1`)

channel.description: The channel by which an interaction occurs—always `voice` for `VoiceInteraction`

twilioConferenceSid.description: The Twilio conference SID for this voice interaction.

twilioConferenceFriendlyName.description: The Twilio conference friendly name for this voice interaction.

recordingConsentGiven.description: `true` if the borrower has given consent to record the call.

recordingStartedAt.description:
The date-time at which the recording of this voice call started, or `null`
if there is no recording.

recordingDuration.description:
The duration of the recording of this voice call in seconds, or `null` if there
is no recording.

voicemailStartedAt.description:
The date-time at which the voicemail left for this call started, or `null`
if there is no voicemail.

voicemailDuration.description:
The duration of the voicemail of this voice call in seconds, or `null` if there
is no voicemail.

isAutodialed.description:
`true` if an autodialed call. If no value is passed, we'll assume
isAutodialed=`false`—meaning a manual call was performed.

For more information on why this is important reference the
Telephone Consumer Protection Act (TCPA).

holdDuration.description:
The amount of time the inbound caller was on hold before
speaking to an agent, in seconds. `null` if the caller wasn't on
hold.

inboundCallAcceptedBy.description: Details of the user responsible for accepting the inbound call task.

email.description:
The email address—must include an `@` symbol.

The email must be formatted like the string `abby@example.com`—it cannot be like the
string `Abby Doe <abby@example.com>`.

name.description: The name associated with the email address

channel.description: The channel by which an interaction occurs—always `email` for `EmailInteraction`.

emailMessageId.description:
The contents of the `Message-ID` header, the unique [RFC5322
email message
ID](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5322.html#section-3.6.4)
associated with this email. `null` if the header wasn't present
in the email.

emailInReplyTo.description:
The contents of the `In-Reply-To` header, the unique [RFC5322
email message
ID](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5322.html#section-3.6.4)
associated with the email being replied to. `null` if the header
wasn't present in the email.

emailReferences.description:
The contents of the `References` header, a structured string of
[RFC5322 email message
IDs](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5322.html#section-3.6.4) that
identify the messages making up the email thread. `null` if the
header wasn't present in the email.

allOf.description: The email information of the sender

content.description:
The content of the email.

This is `null` when the interaction is marked as `sensitive=true` and the requesting user
does not have permission to read sensitive content.

value.description:
The HTML body of the email.

**WARNING**: The HTML content of the email could be received from untrusted
sources. Caution should be used rendering it into a webpage. The data should
be sanitized and/or escaped. See https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/xss/.
The plain text of the email body.

participant_sid.description: SID of the participant that sent the message

employeeId.description: If this is an employee participant, the employee ID of the employee.

borrowerId.description: If this is a borrower participant, the borrower ID of the borrower.

identity.description: A unique string tracking the user in the Twilio chat system

channel.description: The channel by which an interaction occurs—always `text` for `TextInteraction``.

twilioConvoSid.description: The Twilio conversation SID associated with this interaction. (Only valid for interactions with a channel of text or chat)

participants.description:
Each "property name" of this object is a participant SID and each value is an object
describing the participant.

employeeId.description: If this is an employee participant, the employee ID of the employee.

borrowerId.description: If this is a borrower participant, the borrower ID of the borrower.

identity.description: A unique string tracking the user in the Twilio chat system

channel.description: The channel by which an interaction occurs—always `chat` for `ChatInteraction`

twilioConvoSid.description: The Twilio conversation SID associated with this interaction. (Only valid for interactions with a channel of text or chat)

participants.description:
Each key of this object is a participant SID and each value is an object
describing the participant.

channel.description: The channel by which an interaction occurs—always `mail` for `MailInteraction`

status.description: HTTP status code.

CanInteractCommonProps.description:
The common parameters of a request to determine whether the interaction is
allowed based on the history of interactions with a borrower and the
associated cases.

Either a `theme` or `subject` is required.

checkAtCompanyNoon.description:
If `true`, do time-based checks based on noon today, instead of
now. This does not override other reasons a check can fail: the borrower
having a Do Not Interact in place, having reached the interaction
frequency limit, etc.  This is useful for generating borrower campaigns
in the morning to be carried out during business hours.

Where possible, it’s always better to check permission right before an
action. Many things can change (payments are made, other automated
interactions are sent, consents/addresses can be updated) from when you
plan something to happen to when it actually happens. Lenders are
responsible for ensuring it is still permissible to conduct the
interaction.

isAutodialed.description:
`true` if an interaction is prerecorded or autodialed call. This attribute
is relevant when channel=`voice`. If no value is passed, we'll assume
isAutodialed=`false` (meaning manual call). If isAutodialed=`true` and
the contact's consentAutodialedCall=`false` we'll return result=`false`.
For more information read Telephone Consumer Protection Act (TCPA).

contactId.description: An identifier of an existing contact.

contactExternalId.description: The lender's identifier of the contact information.

creatingMessageId.description: The message ID responsible for creating this event.

discriminator.description: String indicating the type of the parent object.

parentId.description: Unique identifier of the parent object for the event.

effectiveAt.description: The date and time at which the event was effective. This may differ from the date of creation.

sendNotice.description: Whether a notice was sent to the borrower

adverseActionReason.description: The reason why the credit limit was changed.

creditLimitPercentage.description: The draw's credit limit as a percentage of the loan's credit limit

dueDate.description: The due date associated with the period.

isOverdue.description: The new obligation status to be recorded

supercaseBulkOperationId.description: If a `SupercaseBulkOperation` created this event, this is that ID

previousInteractionId.description: If a previous interaction identifier is provided, the current and previous interactions will be linked. This can either be Peach's or a lender's external identifier.

context.description: Additional context to be passed when creating a message from preset templates for communication

attachments.description: An optional list of documents to attach to the outgoing email.

ownerId.description: Payment instrument owner's unique identifier. Currently, the owner can be a borrower, investor, broker or payment processor.

ownerType.description: Type of owner of the payment instrument.

amount.description: The amount of the chargeback
The amount of the chargeback

reversedTransactionId.description: Unique identifier of the original transaction.

amount.description: The amount of the reversal

reversedAmount.description: The sum of all of the reversals of the original transaction.

isReplay.description: `true` if capitalization was updated after the overdue date.

fileName.description: The name of the ACH file.

achFileId.description: The ACH File upload monitoring record ID.

fileDestination.description: The destination where we are going to store the ACH File.

interestAccruedAmount.description: The amount of interest accrued. Only set for daily loan maintenance and catchup interest accrual.

eventId.description: The creatingMessageId of the event that caused the balance change.

balances.description: The balances of the loan after the balance change. Contains a subset of the fields found in the Get loan balances response body.

calculatedAt.description: The date and time the balance was calculated.

availableCreditAmount.description:
The available credit amount to use of the loan or draw. Only applicable to line of credit or installment loan with multi-advances.
If the borrower exceeded their credit limit, the `availableCreditAmount` will be zero.

outstandingBalances.description:
When a loan is `active`, outstanding balances combine non-due, due, and overdue balances. When a loan is
`accelerated`, outstanding balances are equal to non-accrual balances. When a loan is `chargedOff`,
outstanding balances are equal to charged-off balances.

outstandingTotalAmount.description:
The total outstanding balance sums outstanding principal, interest, and fees. Also called the loan payoff amount.

If the loan is charged off, the outstanding totalAmount will be equal to the `chargedOffTotalAmount`.

overdueBalances.description: Overdue balances represent balances that are overdue.

overdueTotalAmount.description: The total overdue balance sums overdue principal, interest, and fees.

VerificationStatus.description:
The status of the verification.

- `pending` - Verification is pending and answers can still be provided.
- `succeeded` - Verification was successfully completed.
- `failed` - Verification failed—the maximum number of answer attempts was reached.
- `insufficientKnowledge` - Verification could not be created because there is not enough information about the person to generate questions.
- `expired` - Verification timed out and was expired.

VerificationQuestionCategory.description:
The category of questions to include.

- `inBorrowerPortal` indicates the answer to this question can
be found in the borrower portal.
- `knownToBorrower` indicates the answer to this question
is not found in borrower portal (and therefore must be known by the borrower).
- `presetSecret` indicates the answer to this question was preconfigured by the borrower previously.

memo.description: The text of the memo for the agent

isSuccess.description: `true` if this attempt to answer the questions was successful.

allOf.description:
Object describes a borrower verification process. When a borrower initiates a phone call their
identity should be verified before they are allowed to make changes to their account.

agentUserId.description: An identifier of the agent performing the verification

maxAttempts.description:
The maximum number of times an attempt can be made to answer all the questions. If `maxAttempts`
are made without success, then this verification's status is set to `failed`.

questions.description: The questions that were generated and must be answered.

attempts.description:
Represents the attempts to answer the questions associated with this borrower verification.
The responses are intentionally not included for privacy and security. There can only be a maximum
of `maxAttempts`. There can only be one successful attempt. A successful attempt is one with
`isSuccess` set to `true`.

verificationTypeId.description:
The ID of the borrower verification type to use when creating the verification.
If `null`, then use the default borrower verification type.

answers.description:
The list of answers to the questions for this verification. Ordering is not important, but the
`questionId` must match the ID of the question to which the answer corresponds. *All* of the
answers must match the stored information about the borrower in order for the verification
to be successful.

questionId.description: The identifier for the question being answered.

text.description:
The response text. This must match the stored information about the user.
Different questions have different methods for matching the response text. For instance, some
questions will match in a case-insensitive manner, or expect a date-formatted string, or
allow for a few misspelled characters (e.g., in a name).

Team.description: A team is a named grouping of Employees

name.description: The name of the team—e.g., "Engineering", "Operations", "Customer Support". Must be unique.

externalId.description: The lender's external identifier of the team.

email.description: The group email (or listserve) associated with this team.

employeeCount.description: The number of employees on this team.

allOf.description: An employee in the company

user.description: The user associated with this employee

userId.description: The ID of the user associated with this employee

managerEmployeeId.description: The ID of the employee's manager

jobName.description: The name of position in the company—e.g., "CEO", "Agent", "Supervisor"

id.description: A unique identifier for the employee

externalId.description: The lender's external identifier for the employee.

roles.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `roleIds`.

List of role IDs to associate with this user upon creation.

associatedPersonId.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `borrowerId`.

The ID of the borrower to be associated with this user.
Only applicable when `userType` is set to `borrower`.

borrowerId.description:
The ID of the borrower to be associated with this user.
Only applicable when `userType` is set to `borrower`.

allOf.title: permission
allOf.description: A permission is assigned to a role, which allows designated users within a company to perform an action

action.description: The name of the handler function that is allowed

companyId.description: Unique ID for the company that owns the permission

allOf.description:
A role is a collection of permitted actions that can be performed by a user within the context of a single
company.

companyId.description: Company that the role is associated with

permissions.description: Array of Permission objects associated with the role

name.description: The default name for instances of that type. The name could be shown in UI.

description.description: The description for instances of that type. The description could be shown in UI.

status.description:
The type status. A new type is normally created in the `draft` status. After you finish
with the type configurations and ready to create instances of that type, update the status to `active`.

You can also update an existing type. Each update will create a new version of the type.
Only one version of the type can be `active`. We'll automatically change the previous version to `deprecated`.
Instances in-flight will continue to use the previous version(s).
New instances will be created using the `active` version.

derivedFromTypeId.description: The type identifier that this type was derived from.

companyId.description: The company identifier of the type.

FieldName.description: Name of the field as known in the API (e.g. `typeId` not `type_id`).

DataType.description: The field type of data. Used for properly parsing the field value.

name.description: Field name as displayed in UI.

description.description: A helpful description of what the field is and does. Displayed in UI.

required.description: Indicates whether this field is required on a new case creation.

displayOrder.description: Desired order of the field appearance in UI. Use whole numbers. For example, `3` will be placed after `1`.

default.description: The default value of the field.

enum.description: The list of valid values. Applicable to `dataType=string`, `integer` and `real`.

length.description: The length of the field if applicable. For example, `string` can be limited to 50 characters.

minValue.description: The minimum value. Applicable to `dataType=integer` and `real`.

maxValue.description: The maximum value. Applicable to `dataType=integer` and `real`.

displayPrefix.description: A prefix to display before the field value. For example, a field `amount` can have a prefix `$` to display `$100`.

displayPostfix.description: A postfix to display after the field value. For example, a field `amount` can have a postfix `USD` to display `100 USD`.

CaseTypeAssociation.title: objectAssociation
CaseTypeAssociation.description: Objects are related to `CaseType`, and may have an optional label.

objectType.description: Types of objects that can be associated with the case.

objectId.description: Peach unique identifier for the associated object.

loanTypeId.description:
The optional identifier of a loan type. This is useful when a
lender has two or more financial products and need different case types per product.

workflowTypeId.description:
The optional identifier of a workflow type. Instances of the workflow
type are created for processing cases of this type.

enable.description: Enable or disable using these settings to create reminder tasks.

config.description: Configuration fields for when to create reminder tasks. Varies per case-type. See Smart Reviews for more in-depth documentation.

copyOf.description: The ID of case type to copy and advance the version number

caseType.description:
The base case type for your case. If you choose any special type, except for `generic`, your case
type will inherit all the attributes of that special type.

onCondition.description:
Array of conditions for case fields values. `and` operator is used if multiple conditions
are provided. For example:
- A `bankruptcy` case has two fields, `chapter` and `dispositionCode`.
- If two conditions are created: first `chapter=chapter17`, second `dispositionCode=dismissed`.
- The logical condition will look like: `chapter=chapter17` **and** `dispositionCode=dismissed`.

operator.description:
The value of the case `fieldName` is compared to `value` using this logical operator.
For example, bankruptcy case `fieldName=chapter` can be compared with `value=dismissed` using `eq` (equal operator).

`eq`=equal, `gt`=greater than, `ge`=greater or equal, `lt`=less than, `le`=less or equal, `ne`=not equal.

templateId.description: Communication template identifier to create and send notification.

delay.description: Length of time after a triggering condition to wait before sending notification.

unit.description: Time units for setting the `delay` time.

channel.description:
Channel(s) for which outbound interactions with a borrower are blocked.
Use value `all` for all channels.

theme.description:
Theme(s) for which outbound interactions with a borrower are blocked. Use value
`all` for all themes. `all` doesn't include `opsAccountCredentials`.
For example, use `opsCollDebt` to stop debt collection interactions.

duration.description:
Number of days during which the interactions will be blocked.
We start counting from the day conditions are met.

unit.description: Indicates how to count days provided in `duration`.

externalId.description: A lender's identifier for the investor.

legalName.description: The legal name of the investor.

currency.description:
The currency that the investor will receive settlements in. Use ISO currency codes.

Set to `USD` for all investors, other currencies are not supported yet.

contactEmail.description: The email of the investor's primary contact person.

contactName.description: The name of the investor's primary contact person.

contactPhone.description: The phone number of the investor's primary contact person.

default.description:
Mark this investor as the default investor.

At loan creation, if no investors are specified in the `atOrigination.investors` attribute, the investor with `default=true` is
added with `shares=1` (100%).

If a new investor is created and there is another investor with `default=true`, the system will set `default=false` for the other investor.

VerificationType.description: The object describing how to perform borrower verifications

expirationInSecs.description: How many seconds each verification session has until it is marked as expired.

maxSessionsRecentPast.description:
Throttles maximum verification sessions a borrower can initiate within
"the recent past". Where recent past time length is configured via `recentPastSecs`.

recentPastSecs.description:
The number of seconds into the past which is considered the "recent past"
for the purposes of throttling verifications. See: `maxSessionsRecentPast`.

maxAttemptsPerSession.description: The number of attempts to answer the verification questions a borrower is allowed.

enabledQuestionIds.description:
List of question IDs the system will consider when randomly selecting questions
for verification; if `null` then all available questions will be considered.
([See all available questions](#operation/peach.borrower_verification.handlers.borrower_verification_questions_get_all)).

questionSelectionCriteria.description:
Object describing which and how many questions (at a minimum) to select at random.
(Only questions with IDs present in `enabledQuestionIds` will be considered.)

exactMatchCount.description: The number of questions matching this type to include.

id.description: The promotional program type's unique identifier.

externalId.description: A lender's unique identifier for a specific promotional program type.

status.description:
The promo type status. A new type is normally created in the `draft` status. When you are ready to offer
the promotional program type on loans, update the status to `active`.

If the status changes to `deprecated`, the promotional program cannot be used on new loans. Loans in-flight
will continue to be eligible to the deprecated promotional program.

displayName.description: The promotional program name as it is shown to borrowers.

description.description:
A legal description of the promotional program as it should be communicated and shown to borrowers. If the
description is provided, borrowers will see the description in the Borrower Portal.

metaData.description: Store any type of key/value pairs in the form of a JSON dictionary.

loanTypeId.description: The loan type identifier. This is created specifically for each lender's loan product by Peach.

PeriodicPaymentAmount.title: Periodic Payment Amount
PeriodicPaymentAmount.description:
The amortized periodic payment amount excluding fees. Keep in mind that the last payment
can be different from the `periodicPaymentAmount`.

AmountFinanced.description: The amount of principal on origination or draw.

PrincipalAmount.description:
The amount of principal at origination. Lenders should only pass this value if `principalAmount` is different from `amountFinanced`.
If a value is provided, the system will use `principalAmount` as the loan principal for interest calculations and amortization. The value should be greater than `amountFinanced`.
If a value is not provided, the system will:
- Set `principalAmount = amountFinanced`.
- Use `amountFinanced` as the loan principal for interest calculations and amortization.

TotalInterestCapAmount.title: Total Interest Cap Amount
TotalInterestCapAmount.description: The maximum amount of interest the borrower will ever pay. If not applicable, set to `null`.

startDate.description: The start date of the loan or line of credit. Passing in `"today"` will set the field to today's date. In the case of the predefined loan type configuration, `"today"` will be converted to the date in the product timezone.

discountProgramIds.description:
The identifiers of the discount programs provided at origination. A discount program
has to be created before it can be applied to loans.

serviceFeeAmount.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `dynamicFees.feeAmount`.**

The service fee amount that will be charged recurrently. Only required if the service fee `amountLogic` is configured as
`type=passedAtOrigination`. In all other cases, the system will calculate the fee based on pre-configured logic.

serviceFeeCapAmount.description:
**DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Use `dynamicFees.feeCapAmount`.**

The maximum amount of the service fee that can be charged over the life of the loan or draw. Only required if the service fee
`capLogic` is configured as `type=capPassedAtOrigination`. In all other cases, the system will calculate the fee based on pre-configured
logic.

personAddressId.description:
This is the existing identifier of a borrower's address contact information
(Peach's unique or lender's external identifier). If passed during origination,
the address will be stored on the loan object as a reference. This field, or the
mutually exclusive `personAddress` field containing an address directly, is
required.

loanId.description: An identifier of a loan for which to track interactions

LOCPaymentFrequency.description: The frequency of the due dates schedule. For line of credit, 'weekly' is not allowed.

startDate.description: The start date of the loan or line of credit. Passing in `"today"` will set the field to today's date. In the case of the predefined loan type configuration, `"today"` will be converted to the date in the product timezone.

PersonAddressId.title: Address where a loan was originated.

personAddressId.description:
The address where a loan was originated. If an address was already created in Peach's system,
a lender can pass the borrower's contact information identifier. (Peach's unique or lender's
external identifier). Alternatively, the lender can provide address details in the
`personAddressAtOrigination` attribute.

drawDuration.description:
The duration of the draw as a number of `dueDatesFrequency` periods.
For example:
- if `dueDatesFrequency=monthly` and `duration=6`, it's a draw with 6 months duration and will have 6 due dates.

drawStartDate.description: The draw start date. Passing in `"today"` will set the field to today's date. In the case of the predefined loan type configuration, `"today"` will be converted to the date in the product timezone.

periodCalculationType.description:
`dueDate` - this configuration allows borrowers to have the same due date every month
(for example, the 15th, 28th, or the last day of every month). In this configuration,
the statement date is calculated as an offset from the dueDate and might be a different day of the month every period.
The system will calculate the first period using the dueDate in reference to the following
attributes: `dueDateType`, `dueDateAdjustment`, `atOrigination.paymentFrequency`, `atOrigination.specificDays` and
`atOrigination.bufferToPushOutSchedule`. The subsequent periods are calculated as recurring due dates.
Using the calculated `dueDate` as an "anchor", the first `statementDate` will then be calculated as a
negative "offset" from the first due date. The "offset" is represented as a number of calendar days based on
loan type `locStatementCreationDaysOffset` configuration.

`statementDate` - this configuration allows borrowers to have the same statement date every month
(for example, the 15th, 28th, or the last day of every month). In this configuration,
the due date might be a different day of the month every period.
The system will calculate the first period using the `statementDate` as an "anchor" and take the following attributes
into account: `atOrigination.paymentFrequency`, `atOrigination.specificDays` and `atOrigination.bufferToPushOutSchedule`.
The statement date can only be a calendar day, and it cannot be forced as a business day. Once the statement date is set,
the system will calculate the first due date based on the `dueDateType` and `dueDateAdjustment` attributes.
The first due date will be calculated as a positive "offset" from the first statement date.
If the `dueDateType=business`, then we might need to adjust the due date. The "offset" is represented as
number of calendar days based on the loan type's `locStatementCreationDaysOffset` configuration.
The following periods are calculated as recurring statement dates (similar to the first period).
Only applies to line of credit, not installment loans.

AccrualMethodWithoutCompoundWithFees.description:
`simple` - the system will accrue interest on outstanding principal buckets/balances only.

`compound` - the system will accrue interest on outstanding principal and interest buckets/balances.

FeeChargeLogic.description:
Indicates how to allow the fee.

`onTopPeriodicPayment` - the fee will be added on top of the upcoming amortized payment. It means that the upcoming
payment will be higher than others.
For example: first payment amount is $50 periodic payment plus $10 origination fee, total of $60. Second and onward payments' amount is $50.

`blendWithPeriodicPayment` - the fee will part of the upcoming periodic payment. It means that all expected payments
will be equal (except for the last one.)
For example: first payment amount is $50, $10 of which is the origination fee and $40 is amortized payment. Second and onward payments' amount is $50.

`chargedAtOrigination` - the fee was charged at time of the origination. The fee will not be allocated to future amortized payments.

dueDateType.description:
`business` - means that due dates must fall on business date only. If a due date falls on non-business date,
the due dates will be adjusted in `dueDateAdjustment` direction.

`calendar` - means that due dates can fall on any dates.

dueDateAdjustment.description:
When a due date falls on non-business date, the due date is moved `backward` or `forward` until it falls on
the closest business date. For example, a due date falls on Sunday the 06/16/2019. If `dueDateAdjustment=backward`,
the due date will be adjusted to 06/14/2019. If `dueDateAdjustment=forward`, the due date will be adjusted to 06/17/2019.

dailyInterestCalculationMethod.description:
`360` - this loan amortization method assumes that there are 360 days a year and 30 days in each month.
The daily interest rates are calculated by taking the annual interest rate and dividing it by 360. This value
must be used if `periodType=fixed.`

`365` - this loan amortization method assumes that there are 365 days a year and actual number of days between periods.
The daily interest rates are calculated by taking the annual interest rate and dividing it by 365.

originationFeeAPRCalcOverride.description:
If `noOverride` the APR will be calculated as if the origination fee will be calculated per the
`originationFeeChargeLogic`. If `atOrigination` the APR will be calculated as if origination fee
was collected at origination regardless of the `originationFeeChargeLogic`.

AmortizationMethod.description:
Loan amortization method.

`equalPayments` - the system will amortize the loan or draw making recurring payments equal (except maybe for the last payment).
Most installment loans are expected to use this method.

`interestPaymentsBalloonPrincipal` - the system will amortize the loan or draw making recurring payments equal to interest only
and the last payment will include the entire principal. Keep in mind that if you set `interest.periodAccrualDurationType=actual`,
the recurring payment amounts will be different every period for monthly and twice monthly frequencies. This is because a month
can have 28, 29, 30 or 31 days and interest accrued will vary based on the number of days in the month.

There are additional limitations to be aware for `interestPaymentsBalloonPrincipal`. For installment loans, Autopay can only be
aligned to due dates. It means that `autoPay.allowedFrequency.isDueDatesAvailable` must be set to `false`. This way the system
will only allow Autopay to be aligned to the loan frequency and due dates.

maxAPR.description: Indicates whether the loan has a maximum APR

periodAccrualDurationType.description:
`fixed` - each period is assumed to be fixed number of calendar days.
For `monthly` frequency we assume 30 days between any two consecutive due dates.
For `twiceMonthly` frequency we assume 15 days between any two consecutive due dates.
For `overyTwoWeeks` frequency we assume 14 days between any two consecutive due dates.
For `weekly` frequency we assume 7 days between any two consecutive due dates.

`actual` - we calculate actual number of days in a period. For example, for `monthly` frequency
number days in a period can be 28, 29, 30 or 31.

For line of credit we only support `actual`.

statementCloseToDueDatePeriod.description:
Number of calendar days between statement close date and a due date.
Typically, 14 or 21 days. Applicable for line of credit only.

interestRateExceedsMax.description: The interest rate exceeds the maximum annual interest rate.

numberPayments.description: The number of expected payment due dates.

totalPaymentsAmount.description: The total amount of expected payments.

periodicPaymentAmount.description: The amortized periodic payment amount expected to be paid by the borrower on due dates.

totalInterestAmount.description:
The total amount of interest the loan should accrue. Because of rounding issues, the total of expected
payments `interestAmount` might be different from `totalInterestAmount`.

totalDiscountAmount.description: The total amount of discount at origination as a result of promo rates.

originationFeeAmount.description: The amount of the origination fee.

totalOtherFeesAmount.description: The total amount of non-origination fees that are expected to be charged on the loan.

date.description: The due date of the expected payment.

amount.description: The amount of the expected payment.

principalAmount.description:
The portion of the `amount` allocated to principal.
Available only for `paymentType=periodicPayment`.

interestAmount.description:
The portion of the `amount` allocated to net interest.
Available only for `paymentType=periodicPayment`.

interestBeforeDiscountAmount.description:
The interest amount that was accrued before promo rate(s) or any discount.
Available only for `paymentType=periodicPayment`.

unroundedPrincipalAmount.description:
The portion of the `amount` allocated to principal. Available only for `paymentType=periodicPayment`.
This value is unrounded.

unroundedInterestAmount.description:
The portion of the `amount` allocated to net interest. Available only for `paymentType=periodicPayment`.
This value is unrounded.

unroundedInterestBeforeDiscountAmount.description:
The interest amount that was accrued before promo rate(s) or any discount. Available only for
`paymentType=periodicPayment`. This value is unrounded.

dynamicFeeDetails.description: When `paymentType`=`dynamicFee` this will contain details of the dynamic fee.

dynamicFeeTypeId.description: The dynamic fee type identifier in the system.

apiName.description: The API name of the dynamic fee. For example: 'lateFee' or 'breatherFee'.

displayName.description: The display name of the dynamic fee as shown to the borrower in the UI. For example: `Late Fee` or `Breather Fee`.

aprEffective.description: The calculated effective APR for the loan.

aprNominal.description: The calculated nominal APR for the loan.

aprEffectiveExceedsMax.description: The effective APR exceeds the maximum APR.

aprNominalExceedsMax.description: The nominal APR exceeds the maximum APR.

forgoneInterestAmount.description: Forgone interest amount due to the specified `interestCapAmount`.

LineOfCreditAmortization.description: Line of Credit loan amortization details
LineOfCreditAmortization.title: Line of Credit amortization details

DocumentStatus.description:
The document status. The status can be displayed in UI.

`draft` - the document was rendered or created but has not accepted or rejected yet.

`accepted` - the document was determined to be valid and was accepted.

`rejected` - the document was determined to be invalid and was rejected.

autogenerated.description:
`true` if this document is generated automatically by a Peach system, `false` if this
document is created and uploaded manually by a human. If left blank then this value is
guessed from the document type.

isHumanBorrowerUpload.description:
`true` if this document was uploaded by a human borrower--meaning that a borrower (or
their representative) used a browser to upload this document directly. To put this
another way, this document was *not* uploaded by an agent and was *not* uploaded by any
automated system.

description.description: The description for the document. Normally displayed in UI.

rejectionReason.description: The reason why the document was rejected. This is a free text. Normally displayed in UI.

archived.description: Set to `true` if the document has been archived.

personId.description: The borrower's identifier that the documents belongs to.

loanId.description: The loan identifier that the documents belongs to.

templateVersionId.description: Peach internal template identifier that was used to render the document.

evidenceId.description:
The evidence document identifier. For example: when a borrower enables Autopay, the evidence
document will be the snapshot of UI page.

fileName.description:
The file name of the document. If the document is rendered from a template by the Peach system,
the file name will be generated automatically.
If the document is created from a file, it will be the name of the file that was uploaded.
Normally displayed in UI.

contentId.description: The document content identifier. Use this identifier to get the document content.

contentType.description: The document content type. For example, PDF or JPEG.

contentLength.description: The document content length in bytes.

sensitiveData.description:
Set this flag to `true` if this document has sensitive information, such as PII. The flag is used for
proper authorization of access to the information.

conversionSourceId.description: The original document identifier that was used as a source for conversion to a specific format.

uploadedBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for uploading the document.
Can be an borrower, agent, or automated system process.

verifiedBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for verifing the document.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

updatedBy.description:
Details of the user who last updated the document.
Can be an borrower, agent, or automated system process.

caseId.description: The identifier of the case associated with the doc upload link

contactId.description: The identifier of the contact to which the doc upload link will be sent

CaseApprovalConditions.description:
Set of steps’ statuses that must be met before case outcome can be set
to approved. Currently, we support “and” only between the steps.

refId.description: The globally unique identifier of the workflow type.

name.description: A short name of workflow. For example: bankruptcy or identity theft.

description.description: Description of the workflow type. Used internally.

steps.description: List of step types that comprise a workflow of this type.

createdBy.description: User identifier who created the workflow type.

updatedBy.description: User identifier who last updated the workflow type.

refId.description: The globally unique identifier of the workflow step type.

descriptionShort.description:
A short description of the step. Displayed to agents in the UI.
Can be a sentence.

descriptionLong.description:
Additional details on how to complete the step. Normally displayed
to an agent when clicked on “more info” or “?” or “i” icons.

decisionQuestion.description:
Decision question is what leads to the “accepted” or “rejected” outcome
of the step. This question is displayed to an agent next to the outcome
of the step. The questions can lead to accept/reject or to yes/no answers.

version.description: Version of the workflow step type.

workItems.description: List of work item types that comprise this workflow step type.

createdBy.description: User identifier who created the workflow step type.

updatedBy.description: User identifier who last updated the workflow step type.

refId.description: The globally unique identifier of the workflow workitem type.

version.description: Version of the work item type.

descriptionShort.description:
A short description of the work item. Displayed to agents in the UI.
Can be a sentence.

descriptionLong.description: Additional information required to complete the work item.

createdBy.description: User identifier who created the workflow item type.

updatedBy.description: User identifier who last updated the workflow item type.

StatusChangeHistory.description: The status change history of workflow steps and work items.

updatedBy.description:
Details of the user who last updated this work item.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

descriptionShort.description: A short description of the step. Displayed to agents in the UI.

descriptionLong.description: Additional details on how to complete the step.

decisionQuestion.description: Decision question that leads to the outcome of the step.

updatedBy.description:
Details of the user who last updated this workflow step.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

workItems.description: List of work items that comprise this workflow step.

name.description: Short name of the workflow.

steps.description: List of workflow steps that comprise the workflow.

processingComplete.description:
Only returned when query parameter `sync` is set to `true`. Indicates if the extra processing has finished yet.
If it is not done in 20 seconds, the request will return and this value will be set to `false`.

obligationAmount.description: The amount obligated to be paid by the borrower for the period.

fulfilledAmount.description: The total amount of payments and service credits applied to the period.

remainingAmount.description:
The total amount remaining to be paid by the borrower after accounting for payments
and service credits applied in the period.

paymentsAmount.description: The total amount of payments applied to the period.

capitalizedAmount.description: The total amount capitalized at the end of the period.

serviceCreditsAmount.description: The total amount of service credits applied to the period.

overpaymentsAmount.description:
In the case that loan policy allows, this represents the amount of overpayments applied to the period.
Overpayments will only arise when an obligation is completely fulfilled.

unassignedAmount.description:
This is a special amount that is only applicable to first obligation for loan types with `obligationFulfilledCalculation==postStatement`.
It stores any payment amount that was made before the first statement date and not allocated to any obligation.

dueDate.description: The due date of the obligation/period.

isFulfilled.description: `true` if the borrower has completely fulfilled the obligation amount for the period.

isOverdue.description: `true` if the borrower is currently overdue on the obligation amount for the period.

isOpen.description:
`true` means that the obligation is still "open" and the `obligationAmount` is not final. The obligation amount
can potentially change until the period ends. `false` means that the obligation is "sealed" and the `obligationAmount`
is final.

isLateFeeBlockedByPyramidingConfig.description:
Pyramiding of late fees is a situation where a borrower (who has been previously charged a late fee) pays the current amount due
on a loan without the prior month's late fee included, and the payment is applied to the late fee first, leaving an overdue balance
on the current month's payment, resulting in another late fee.

- If the late fee was configured to allow pyramiding effect, this attribute is not used and will be `false` always.
- If the late fee was configured to prevent pyramiding effect (`pyramidingLateFeesAllowed=false`), this attribute:
  - `true` - means a late fee was blocked (aka not charged in the period) because of the late fee pyramiding configuration.
    But otherwise would have been charged.
  - `false` - means a late fee was charged because the loan was overdue, or a late fee was not supposed to be charged because
      the loan was current. To clarify, `false` doesn't necessarily mean that a late fee was charged in the period. To understand
      whether a late fee was charged in the period, you should check the dynamic fees endpoint or applicable database table(s).

ObligationLoanGracePeriod.description:
Loan’s grace period details. Only Loans created with `isGracePeriodEligible=true` will populate details in this object.
See `gracePeriod` object for Draw-specific grace period details.

fullBalanceAmount.description:
This attribute is only used for grace period benefit logic.
This amount is the full statement balance amount (also called “new balance”) as of the date when the obligation is
“sealed” (aka when `isOpen` is set to `false`).
Line of credit (and Draw) obligations are "sealed" on the statement date.

fullBalanceMinusOverdueAmount.description:
This attribute is only used for grace period benefit logic.
This amount is the full statement balance amount (also called “new balance”) minus any overdue amount as of the
date when the obligation is "sealed" (aka when `isOpen` is set to `false`). Line of credit (and Draw) obligations are
"sealed" on the statement date.

totalFulfilledOnDueDateAmount.description:
This value is only used for grace period benefit logic. The value will be set one calendar day after the due date.
The amount of the obligation for the period fulfilled by service credits and borrower payments as of the end of the
due date. This is a sum of `fulfilledAmount` and `overpaymentsAmount`.

isGracePeriodEligible.description:
The grace period status of the obligation period.
`true` - means that the period is/was eligible for the grace period benefit and interest didn't accrue in the period.
`false` - means that the period was not eligible for the grace period benefit and interest accrued in the period.

ObligationGracePeriod.description: Data used for grace period logic.

fullBalanceAmount.description:
This attribute is only used for grace period benefit logic.
This amount is the full statement balance amount (also called “new balance”) as of the date when the obligation is
“sealed” (aka when `isOpen` is set to `false`).
Line of credit (and Draw) obligations are "sealed" on the statement date.

fullBalanceMinusOverdueAmount.description:
This attribute is only used for grace period benefit logic.
This amount is the full statement balance amount (also called “new balance”) minus any overdue amount as of the
date when the obligation is "sealed" (aka when `isOpen` is set to `false`). Line of credit (and Draw) obligations are
"sealed" on the statement date.

totalFulfilledOnDueDateAmount.description:
This value is only used for grace period benefit logic. The value will be set one calendar day after the due date.
The amount of the obligation for the period fulfilled by service credits and borrower payments as of the end of the
due date. This is a sum of `fulfilledAmount` and `overpaymentsAmount`.

isGracePeriodEligible.description:
The grace period status of the obligation period.
`true` - means that the period is/was eligible for the grace period benefit and interest didn't accrue in the period.
`false` - means that the period was not eligible for the grace period benefit and interest accrued in the period.

gracePeriod.description: Draws' grace period details. Only draws that were created with `isGracePeriodEligible=true` will be included in the list.

isOverdue.description: `true` if the borrower has any obligation overdue on the loan.

overdueAmount.description: The total overdue amount across all obligations on the loan.

daysOverdue.description:
