Number of calendar days overdue starting from the due date of the earliest overdue obligation to
the current date.

isOverdue.description: `true` if the borrower has any obligation overdue on the loan.

overdueAmount.description: The total overdue amount across all obligations on the loan.

daysOverdue.description:
Number of calendar days overdue starting from the due date of the earliest overdue obligation to
the current date.

RepaymentNotificationTrigger.description:
A description of the conditions that trigger a communication. NOTE: `autopayExpectedPaymentChangedAmount` will never occur for LOC,
because autopays are finalized after the statement date and not updated again.

RepaymentEngineInteractionSubject.description: The `InteractionSubject` for the notification that is sent to the borrower.

DayType.description: Whether day field refers to weekends and holidays or only business days.

oneOf.description:
The number of days offset from the due date that a notification is sent. Should be negative for reminders and positive for
overdue notices.

When `subject=loanRightToCurePersonalUnsecured`, then `loanType.rightToCureBuffer` will be used to
compute the offset.

When `subject=autopayAmountChanged`, then `loanType.autopay.amountChangeNotificationBuffer` will be used
to compute the offset.

When `subject=promoProgramReminder` or `promoProgramEligibilityAtRisk`, the reminder will trigger `daysOffsetDueDate`
after the `PromoProgram` end date, which is why the value should be negative for the reminder and positive for `promoProgramEligibilityAtRisk`.
This object controls the exact date on which the loanOverdue reminder is sent. Note that the offsets are absolute.

weekly.description:
If the notification type has `trigger=loanOverdue` and `isDueDatesAvailableWeekly` is true on this loan type,
then this offset will be used for loans with weekly payments.

everyTwoWeeks.description:
If the notification type has `trigger=loanOverdue` and `isDueDatesAvailableEveryTwoWeeks` is true on this loan type,
then this offset will be used for loans with payments that are due every two weeks.

monthly.description:
If the notification type has `trigger=loanOverdue` and `isDueDatesAvailableTwiceMonthly` is true on this loan type,
then this offset will be used for loans with monthly payments.

twiceMonthly.description:
If the notification type has `trigger=loanOverdue` and `isDueDatesAvailableTwiceMonthly` is true on this loan type,
then this offset will be used for loans with twice monthly payments.

singleTerm.description:
If the notification type has `trigger=loanOverdue` and `isDueDatesAvailableSingleTerm` is true on this loan type,
then this offset will be used for loans with a single term payment.

companyId.description: The company identifier for this notification type.

promoType.description: Only used for notifications with subject `promoProgramReminder` and `promoProgramEligibilityAtRisk`

loanOverdueWindow.description: **DEPRECATED ATTRIBUTE** Window in which to start sending this notification. Only used for `trigger=loanOverdue`.

from.description: Days after the loan is overdue to start sending this notification type.

to.description: Days after the loan is overdue to stop sending this notification type.

sendChannels.description:
The channels to send the notification to. By default, the notification is sent to `text` and `email`
channels.

The system always attempts to send to *all* specified channels. As long as at least one contact of the 
specified channels is available to send to then the notification will considered successful. An error is
thrown if all three channels are unavailable for the borrower.

allOf.description: The ID of the active version of the template. This is the version that will be used when rendering the template.

language.description: The ISO 639-1 two character code of the email language.

LoanTypeIdNullable.description:
The Loan Type ID to which this template is associated. By configuring
a Loan Type for a Template Descriptor it is possible to use completely different 
templates for different types of loans.

sensitive.description:
If `true`, then all interactions and documents created from this template will have 
the `sensitive` field set to `true`. Such interaction and documents cannot have their 
content viewed except with a special permission (`interaction:read.sensitive`). 

Usually this would be used to prevent employees without need to access 
private information from accessing it.

enabled.description:
If `true`, then this template is disabled. Attempts to send messages with this
template will be rejected. (Return `400` responses from the API.)

name.description:
An optional human-friendly name for templates. Only the `Custom1`-`Custom20`
family of subjects can have a custom name.

activeVersionId.description: The ID of the active version of the template. This is the version that will be used when rendering the template.

ContentTextTemplate.description:
A valid Jinja template to use for the content text body. This is used, for instance,
for the body of a plain text email or text message.

ContentHtmlTemplate.description:
A valid Jinja template to use for the content HTML body. This is used, for instance,
for the body of an HTML email.

This is simply ignored when the channel does not need HTML content.

The context variables available to this template are the same as the context available to 
`contentTextTemplate`

SubjectLineTemplate.description:
A valid Jinja template to use for the subject line. This is used, for instance,
for the subject line when sending emails.

This is simply ignored when the channel does not need a subject.

The context variables available to this template are the same as the context available to 
`contentTextTemplate`

ContextObject.description:
The data used to render the template. Provided in JSON format, it must be a mapping 
of context variables to values. 

The context variables of `borrower`, `loan`, `case` and `statement` 
do not need to be provided since the system will automatically add these objects
to context assuming you provide `personId`, `loanId`, `caseId` and `statementId` to 
the endpoint.

For example if your provided the context...

```
{
  "dateSigned": "Aug 27, 2021"
  "lenderName": "Peachy Lender"
  "paymentMethod": "bankAccount"
  "paymentMethodLastFour": "1110"
  "supportEmail": "support@peach.com"
  "supportPhone": "888-888-8888"
}
```

...then a template like `Hello from {{lenderName}}!` would render like `Hello from Peachy Lender!`

OverrideTemplateId.description:
The template version ID (like `TV-AAAA-BBBB`) *or* template descriptor ID (like `TD-AAAA-BBBB`)
to use.

If a template descriptor is given, then the current template descriptor's `activeVersionId` is
used.

This should be used in special cases where you do not want to use the implicit template selected 
by the `subject` and `channel` fields.

channel.description: Templates with the same subject can have multiple versions per channel. For example: `paymentFailed` can have `email` and `text` message (aka SMS) versions.

personId.description: The unique identifier of the Borrower. Can be Peach or a lender's external identifier. The borrower attributes will be used as dynamic fields in the template.

loanId.description: The unique identifier of the Loan. Can be Peach or lender's external identifier. The loan attributes will be used as dynamic fields in the template.

caseId.description: The unique identifier of the Case. Can be Peach or lender's external identifier. The case attributes will be used as dynamic fields in the template.

schemas-AssociatedLoanId.description:
The ID of a Loan. This marks a particular loan as associated with this interaction.

Hydrates to the `loan` context variable for use in the template

schemas-AssociatedLoanIds.description:
The IDs of several loans. This marks several loans as associated with this interaction.

Hydrates to the `loans` context variable for use in the template

SendIsTransactional.description:
If `true`, then sent this interaction as "transactional". 

Transactional interactions are those which are sent via an automated system in response 
to an event or some action taken. e.g., an email sent to confirm a payment was made is transactional;
likewise an email sent to confirm a password change is transacrtional. Examples of
non-transactional messages would be: those sent by an agent in response to a customer request,
for collections, or for marketing.

It's important to mark these messages correctly, because different laws may apply to messages
depending on if they're considered "transactional".

Additionally, a transactional interaction may be sent with different "From:" and "Reply-To:" fields depending on configuration.
The purpose here being that it may be desirable to send messages from an email address
that is clearly marked as "unmonitored", so that recipients do not try to respond
directly to those email addresses.

channel.description:
Specifies the channel(s) to send the message on. 

If an array is provided then the message will be sent to the most appropriate contact
for each specified channel. As long as at least one contact is found, the message
will be sent, if at least one contact could be found then an error will be returned.

personId.description:
The Borrower ID of the borrower to which this message should be sent.

Hydates to the `person` context variable for use in the template
being rendered for send.

contactId.description:
The Contact ID of the borrower to which this message should be sent.

If not provided then the system will try to select an appropriate
contact based on the type of message being sent. (e.g., if this
is an email select the primary email address; if this is a
text message select the borrower's mobile phone.)

caseId.description:
Mark a particular case as associated with this message.

Hydates to the `case` context variable for use in the template
being rendered for send.

statementId.description: Mark a particular statement as associated with this message.

attachments.description: List of document IDs for documents to attach to the outgoing email.

useTemplate.description:
Only applicable when `channel=mail`. If `false`, will not generate content from a template and will instead
only use the documents referenced in the `attachments` field.

interactionExternalId.description:
The external ID of the interaction that will be created as a
result of this request. Subsequent attempts to send with the
same external ID will be blocked.

sendAt.description:
This attribute determines when the message should be sent.
If set to `null`, and the message's timing conflicts with
Compliance Guard's time-of-day restrictions, Communicator
will automatically reschedule it to an allowable time.
If this auto-rescheduling occurs, the sendAt field in the
Interaction response will show the new scheduled time, and
the Interaction status will be marked as `scheduled`.

To bypass auto-rescheduling, input the current time for
`sendAt` when calling the endpoint.

**Additional Information:**
- Regardless of when the message is scheduled to send, its
content will be generated immediately upon calling this endpoint.
- You can manually set a future send time of up to 7 days in the future.

sendJitter.description:
The maximum number of seconds to add to the send time for this communication.
The actual time added will be between 0 and this value.
This is useful for spreading out the delivery
of a large batch of messages over a period of time in order
to avoid delaying other time-sensitive communcations.

strictUndefined.description:
If `true` an error will be returned if the template contains
a variable that is not defined in the context. For historical
reasons this is `false` by default, but it is recommended
to set this to `true`.

overrideRecipient.description:
The recipient to which this message should be sent. This should be used in special
cases where you cannot create a `Contact` and use `contactId`.

WARNING: It is not recommended to use this field. Instead use `contactId` to specify the contact.

You can only use this field if:
- The interaction channel is `email`
- A `borrowerId` is specified
- A `previousInteractionId` is specified, to an email interaction belonging to that borrower
- That previous interaction was sent "from:" the same email address as the one you want to send to.
Currently only email addresses are supported for this field.

crmDefaultTypeId.description:
The ID of the borrower verification type used when an agent initiates a borrower verification via the CRM.
The borrower verification type is the configuration which specifies how many of a particular type of verification question to ask when an agent verifies a borrower's identity.

statusTransition.description:
Enables lenders to control whether Peach's system will automatically intervene and transition the status of `pending` transactions to `successful` according to the `transitionLogic` configuration.

- `auto` - Peach's system will automatically transition `pending` transactions to `succeeded` after a specified period of time as defined by `externalTransactions.transitionLogic`
- `manual` - Lender is responsible for transitioning the status of external transactions via API.

transitionLogic.description:
Required for statusTransition = `auto`. Defines the logic used to determine when the external transaction’s status will transition from `pending` to `succeeded`, assuming no other status changes occur in the meantime.

- `numDays`` - Peach's system will wait a specified amount of time in order to automatically transition the status of the transaction from `pending` to `succeeded`.
  **NOTE**: any transactions whose status is not pending will be excluded from the logic to automatically transition the status of a payment.

- `holdDays`` - Peach's system will adhere to the holdDaysEndDate on the transaction and automatically transition the status of the transaction from `pending` to `succeeded` at the end of the hold day period.
  **NOTE**: Peach will only transition transactions with status = `pending`.

dayType.description:
Defines whether the system should calculate the automatic status transition based on calendar or business days. NOTE: this is a required attribute for products whose statusTransition is set to `auto` AND the transitionLogic is set to `numDays`.
This value cannot be set when type=holdDays.

numDays.description:
Defines how many days the system will wait to automatically update the transaction's status if transitionLogic.type = numDays.
This value cannot be set when transitionLogic.type=`holdDays`.
The system will transition the status of the transaction on the Nth day.
For example, if a transaction is created on Jan 1 and numDays = 3, the
transaction's status will automatically transition on Jan 4.

CompanyConfigOpenHours.description:
An object describing the times in which this company is "open".

This is used in multiple places:
- This is displayed on the contact us page.
- When closed, phone calls are sent to voicemail or rejected.
- When closed, webchats cannot be started.

normal.description:
A specially formatted string describing the open hours of the company.

A day-time descriptor is a day or days of the week followed by a space " "
and an "hours". With a "day" being the first three letters of the day of
the week. With "hours" being either `Closed`, `24hours`, or
a 24-hour time range like `9:00-18:00`.

For example:
- `"Mon-Wed 3:00-13:00"` indicates an open time from 3am to 1pm on
  Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday.
- `"Fri 24hrs"` indicates that on Friday the company is open for 24 hours.
- `"Thu closed"` indicates on Thursday the company is closed all day.

Day-time descriptors can be combined with a `;` to fully define a week
of open times.

If no open hours are configured the company is considered always closed.

holidays.description:
The list of holidays on which the company has special open hours. Holiday
hours supercede the "normal" weekly hours.

oneOf.title: Custom Holiday
oneOf.description:
An object describing the holiday.

Note that repeating, annual holidays cannot currently be specified; you must
specify each year's holiday.

date.description: An ISO 8601 date (not date-time) on which this holiday occurs

name.description: The name of the holiday

hours.description: The hours in which the company is open on this holiday

oneOf.title: Match Country Holidays
oneOf.description:
An object indicating this company should match "standard" holidays
for the country indicated.

Note that adding this will add multiple holidays to your open hours
configuration.

matchCountry.description:
The ISO 3166 2 or 3 character country code of the country to match.

See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes

The list of holidays for a country matches those used by the python
package "Holidays".

See: https://python-holidays.readthedocs.io/

hours.description: The hours in which the company is open on these holidays

intensityLimits.description: Keys are strings where each number is a period in days

collectionCaseTypeId.description: Public ID of the case type to be used when creating a new collection case.

inspectionProcName.description: The name of the inspection procedure to run on the borrower's account.

totalOverdueAmountThreshold.description:
The sum of overdue amounts of all overdue loans has to exceed this
value for the collection case to be created.

nPastCollectionsThreshold.description:
Create a collection case if the number of past collections exceeds
this number.

nOverdueNoticesRequired.description:
The number of different loan overdue notices required to be sent
before a new collection case is created.

loanDaysOverdueThreshold.description:
Number of days to wait before creating a new collection case.
The number depends on the loan's due dates frequency.

interactionDaysPassedThreshold.description:
Number of days to wait after the last loan overdue notification
was sent. The number depends on the loan's due dates frequency.

enableReviewTask.description:
By default, when a collection case is created automatically, a task of type `reviewAutoCreatedCase`
is created in taskrouter—the assumption being that usually a human should
review automatically created cases.

To disable the creation of this task set this config to `false`.

closeOnlyWhenPaidOff.description: If true, keep the collection case open even when the overdue loan is charged off or frozen.

subdomain.description: Subdomain of the remote log in URL.

disableTaskTypes.description:
List of task types to disable.

When a task type is disabled the system functions as normal except no task
is created.

Note that some task types which are allowed to be disabled here probably would be
better served disabled elsewhere. For instance, disabling `answerInboundVoiceCall`
would mean that incoming voice calls are still able to be received by the Peach
system, but cannot be answered by agents! In this case, it would be better to
set the config `communication.enableInboundVoiceCall=false`.

disableTaskRouter.description:
If `true` disable all task routing features.

i.e., Agents will not log in to task system. Tasks will not be created.

channelCapacities.description:
The capacity configured for each task for channel type.

The default capacity for:
- `default` is `2` (i.e., tasks without a channel)
- `voice` is `1`
- `chat` is `3`

enableCaseOwnership.description:
Enable optionally assigning an owner to Case objects. This will be
used during task routing to prefer to match tasks relating to cases
with their owners.

criteria.description:
The criteria used to determine whether monitoring should be enabled for a borrower.

Monitoring will be enabled:
- `borrowerStatus`: if the borrower `status` is `active`
- `borrowerAndLoanStatus`: if the borrower `status` is `active` and the borrower has loans with `status`=`active`

scraCaseCreationCriteria.description:
The criteria used to determine whether a SCRA case should be created for a borrower.

A SCRA case will be created:
- `borrowerOnly`: Upon borrower identity match, SCRA case will be created even if there are no loans that are qualified per
                  SCRA regs. If there are eligible loans, the case will associate them.
- `borrowerAndLoan`: Upon borrower identity match, SCRA case will be created only if there are qualified loans per SCRA regs.

CompanyConfig.title: Company Config
CompanyConfig.description:
The company configuration object is the main location to store configuration
settings to control the functionality and appearance of the Peach
applications which this company users.

signing_key.description: Document signing key in PKCS 12 format.

signing_key_password_token.description: Token corresponding to the signing key password.

signer_contact.description: Signer's contact information to be added to the signature.

no_review_task_for_autocreated_cases.description:
If `true` then assume that cases automatically created via Compliance
Guard do not need to be reviewed by a human. If `false` or unset, then
whenever Compliance Guard automatically creates a case, create a
corresponding task for an agent to review the newly created case.

no_review_task_for_autoupdated_cases.description:
If `true` then assume that cases automatically updated via Compliance
Guard do not need to be reviewed by a human. If `false` or unset, then
whenever Compliance Guard automatically updates certain cases, create a
corresponding task for an agent to review the updated case.
Note that only a subset of automatically updated cases will generate a
review task even with this setting enabled. Those are `bankruptcy` and
`militaryDuty`.

disablePaymentProcessing.description:
When set to `true`, Peach will not process payments or allow creation of transactions where `isExternal=false`.
Existing internal transactions will be canceled on their scheduled date. Lenders can continue to create and process external transactions.
Use `scheduleAutopayTransactions` to control whether external autopay transactions will automatically be created by Peach.

scheduleAutopayTransactions.description:
Only applicable if `processedByPeach=false`.
`true` - the system will create transactions in scheduled status based on Autopay plan expected payments (aka AEPs).
`false` - the system will not create Autopay transactions based on Autopay plan expected payments. In this case, the lender is expected to create applicable transactions.

processedByPeach.description: Whether Peach handles payment processing for this company.

allowedCreditCardTx.description: Controls how credit cards can be used.

payment.description: If true, regular loan payments are allowed with credit cards.

downPayment.description: If true, down payments are allowed with credit cards.

bypassCollisionCheck.description: Allow the creation of multiple payment instruments with the same details within the same company.

transactionLimitAmount.description: Maximum amount for a single transaction

maxNumberNewPaymentMethodsIn30Days.description:
If a borrower has created a Payment Instrument this many times in the past 30 days,
they will be blocked from creating anymore. This does not apply to `external` instruments, or instruments created with `force=true`.

externalTransactions.description: Enables lenders to configure treatment of external transactions by Peach's system.

requireBorrowerIdentity.description: Require new borrowers to have identity information.

addressValidation.description: Vendor to use for address validation.

allowPartialAddress.description: If `true`, Address Line 1 is Optional, otherwise it is required for loans managed by Peach

forceCaseIdOnAgentActions.description: If true, a loan action made by an agent must come with a case ID.

enabled.description: If false, data will not be indexed in elastic search

Company.description:
The company object represents a company of Peach which uses some of Peach's applications.

It contains metadata about the company and configuration settings for how the applications
should function.

slug.description:
A slug to be used to match this company in other environments (dev/sandbox/etc).
It will also be used for FE hosting and the default DNS entries created for it.

domainName.description: Base web domain being used in communications/email/etc

shortDomainName.description: Base web domain being used in communications/email/etc

name.description: Alternate name for the company

brandName.description: The name of the company for presentation to the end consumer—e.g., in emails.

agentAuthType.description: Type of agent authentication, e.g. `basic` or `google`

agentAuthValueType.description: When using `authType=basic` (i.e., user/password authentication), require this method of authentication (e.g. `email`)

femaPolicy.description:
If set to `true`, automatically create Supercases when a disaster is detected in the region
of a borrower's address.

bankruptcyServiceId.description: The service that will be used for bankruptcy monitoring (no monitoring if is null)

deceasedServiceId.description: The service that will be used for deceased monitoring (no monitoring if is null)

femaServiceId.description: The service that will be used for FEMA disaster monitoring (no monitoring if is null)

scraServiceId.description: The service that will be used for SCRA military monitoring (no monitoring if is null)

ofacServiceId.description: The service that will be used for OFAC monitoring (no monitoring if is null)

rndServiceId.description: The service that will be used for OFAC monitoring (no monitoring if is null)

status.description: The status of the company.

enabled.description: If enabled, balance check will be performed based on the configuration prior to processing bank account payments.

checkOffsetDays.description: Number of days before payment to check for the balance

zone.description:
Thresholds represented as multiple of the scheduled payment amount.

`balanceRed` - account balance is less than scheduled amount. \
`balanceYellow` - account balance is more than the scheduled amount but not by much. \

value.description: The percentage value for the specified zone (1 = 100% of the scheduled payment, 1.2 = 120% of the scheduled payment, etc.).

condition.description:
`balanceNA` - means that the payment method used cannot check balances. \
For example: debit card or bank account that was never connected to a balance check (or was disconnected manually by the borrower).
It means that "account link" status is "inactive" or the account link object is empty.

`balanceBroken` - there is a balance connection object, but it’s broken - due to an error. \
  It means that “account link” status is “active”, but there is an errorCode exists.

`balanceGreen` - account balance is more than `balanceYellow` and significantly more than the scheduled amount.

action.description:
`debit` - Debit the account. \
`reschedule` - The system will reschedule the payment to "payment due date + `rescheduleBufferInDays`". \
`cancel` - Cancel the payment.

rescheduleBufferInDays.description: Number of days buffer to reschedule the payment.

transactionType.description:
The transaction type.

`payment` - payment made by the borrower or by a service agent per borrower request.
Can be one-time payment, future payment or Autopay.
Successful payments reduce loan balance.

`serviceCredit` - service credit issued by a service agent or supervisor. Successful service
credits reduce loan balance.

balancesOrder.description:
When loan is in `active` status, the following buckets are relevant for waterfall:
`overdueFee`, `overdueAccruedInterest`, `overduePrincipal`, `dueFee`, `dueAccruedInterest`, `duePrincipal`, `nonDueFee`, `nonDueAccruedInterest`, `nonDuePrincipal`.

When loan is in `chargedOff` status, the following buckets are relevant for waterfall:
`chargedOffPrincipal`, `chargedOffAccruedInterest`, `chargedOffFee`

When loan is in `accelerated` status, the following buckets are relevant for waterfall:
`nonAccrualPrincipal`, `nonAccrualInterest`, `nonAccrualFee`

During payment application, when any fee bucket is reached (nonDueFee, dueFee, etc.), fees in that bucket are paid down in the following order:

1) Origination fee or Draw fee

3) Modification fees

4) Late fees

transactionType.description:
The transaction type.

`payment` - payment made by the borrower or by a service agent per borrower request.
Can be one-time payment, future payment or Autopay.
Successful payments reduce loan balance.

`serviceCredit` - service credit issued by a service agent or supervisor. Successful service
credits reduce loan balance.

loansOrder.description:
`highestInterestRate` - the loan or draw with the highest interest rate

`lowestInterestRate` - the loan or draw with the lowest interest rate

`oldestLoanDate` - the oldest loan or draw

`newestLoanDate` - the newest loan or draw

`highestOutstandingBalance` - the loan or draw with the highest outstanding balance

`lowestOutstandingBalance` - the loan or draw with the lowest outstanding balance

CreditAgenciesIdentifiers.description:
You can report to one or more credit reporting agencies. Make sure to set identifiers for each agency you
plan to report in the `metro2` object.

This endpoint sets identifiers for loans with the same `loanTypeId` (aka portfolio). If you have more than
one loan type (meaning different portfolios), you need to create identifiers for each `loanTypeId`.

In addition, you need to create file upload details using `Create credit agency` for each credit agency.
The file upload details need to be set once per credit agency, and all `loanTypeId` (aka all portfolios)
will be uploaded to the same location.

equifaxProgramIdentifier.description:

Portfolio type.

C=Line of Credit

I=Installment

M=Mortgage

O=Open

R=Revolving

Interest type indicator.

`F` - means that the interest is reported as fixed.

`V` - means that the interest is reported as variable/adjustable

Required when reporting medical debts and returned checks from providers of medical services, products or devices
03=Oil Company

(other non-banking financial institutions)

skipSegments.description:
Segments to include data for. The returned data also depends on the loan type configuration for each loan.
If a loan type specifies a segment to be skipped it will not be included, even if this parameter says
to include it.

LoanType.description:
A Loan Configuration is a representation of a Loan Product and its specific
settings and configurations

externalId.description: An optional client unique identifier for the loan product

name.description: An optional name for the loan product

assetDisplayName.description: The asset display name. For example: Loan, Line of Credit, Lease, Credit Card.

txDescriptorAssetDisplayName.description:
Text that will be used in transaction descriptor.
The descriptor is shown in customer online bank account or statement.
The text must be limited to 4 characters. If more than 4 characters are set, the logic will trim the text and use only first 4 characters.
For example: LOAN, LINE, CARD, PLAN, etc. The full description will look like: LOAN PYMT, CARD PYMT.

description.description: An optional description for the loan product

currency.description: The currency used in loans of this type.

timezone.description:
The optional timezone configuration for the loan type, represented as a valid tz code
string such as "UTC" or "America/Los_Angeles". If `null`, the timezone defaults to the
timezone configuration on the company.

sendFirstPaymentWithdrawalNotice.description:
Indicates if the system should send Payday First Payment Withdrawal Notice to the Borrower via email and text message at
least 3 business days prior to the scheduled payment.

sendConsumerRightsNotice.description:
Indicates if the system should send Payday Consumer Rights Notice to the Borrower via email after two consecutive
failed debit attempts.

achDebitTimingShiftOnNonBusinessDay.description:
Controls ACH transaction creation timing when `autopay.achDebitTiming="hitOnDueDate"`.
Not applicable for transaction types other than ACH or when `autopay.achDebitTiming="initiateOnDueDate"`.

overpaymentAmountLimitFactor.description:
The multiplier will be used to calculate the maximum amount allowed to be scheduled as one-time payment.
For example:

If the value is 1.2 and the current outstanding balance is $200.00. The maximum amount that a one-time payment is allowed is $200.00 * 1.2 = $240.00

openToBuyCalculation.description: Defines the lender’s configuration to determine the “Open to Buy” amount. Only applicable to `lineOfCredit`.

calculationType.description:
This calculation determines whether transactions’ `status` and/or `holdDaysEndDate` are used when calculating open-to-buy.

transactionStatus - open-to-buy will take into account transaction status only. Open-to-buy will not be adjusted if the
transaction status is in [initiated, pending] regardless of the transaction’s `holdDaysEndDate`.

transactionHoldDays - open-to-buy will take into account transaction hold days only. Open-to-buy will not be adjusted
if the transaction status is in [initiated, pending, succeeded] AND the transaction is within holdDaysEndDate.

transactionStatusAndHoldDays - Open-to-buy will take into account transaction status and hold days period. Open-to-buy
will not be adjusted if the transaction status is in [initiated, pending] AND the transaction is within hold days periods.

 openToBuyCalculation=transactionStatus

| tx status   | within hold days window   | after hold days window    |
|-------------|---------------------------|---------------------------|
| Initiated   | Open-to-buy not adjusted  | Open-to-buy not adjusted  |
| Pending     | Open-to-buy not adjusted  | Open-to-buy not adjusted  |
| Succeeded   | Open-to-buy adjusted      | Open-to-buy adjusted      |


 openToBuyCalculation=transactionHoldDays

| tx status   | within hold days window   | after hold days window    |
|-------------|---------------------------|---------------------------|
| Initiated   | Open-to-buy not adjusted  | Open-to-buy adjusted      |
| Pending     | Open-to-buy not adjusted  | Open-to-buy adjusted      |
| Succeeded   | Open-to-buy not adjusted  | Open-to-buy adjusted      |


 openToBuyCalculation=transactionStatusAndHoldDays

| tx status   | within hold days window   | after hold days window    |
|-------------|---------------------------|---------------------------|
| Initiated   | Open-to-buy not adjusted  | Open-to-buy adjusted      |
| Pending     | Open-to-buy not adjusted  | Open-to-buy adjusted      |
| Succeeded   | Open-to-buy adjusted      |Open-to-buy adjusted       |

originationFeeAPRCalcOverride.description:
If `noOverride` the APR will be calculated as if the origination fee will be calculated per the
`originationFeeChargeLogic`. If `atOrigination` the APR will be calculated as if origination fee
was collected at origination regardless of the `originationFeeChargeLogic`.

originationFeeDisplayName.description: The display name of the origination fee as shown to the borrower in the UI. For example: "Origination fee" or "Set up fee".

isRefundAllowed.description: Whether a borrower can receive a refund.

multi.description: Multiple loans (or draws for Line-of-Credit loans) payment waterfall application

multiPrioritizeNonDueEqually.description:
`false` - means the system will always honor the multi waterfall.
`true` - when there are multiple draws, waterfall logic will prioritize payment allocation in the amount
 of the next upcoming payment for each draw before allocating the remainder to the next draw in the waterfall order.
 For example, if two draws have an upcoming payment of $100, the system will allocate $100 to both draws before applying
 the remainder to the principal of the first draw in the waterfall.

multiPrioritizeOverdue.description:
`false` - means the system will always honor the multi waterfall.
`true` - when there are multiple draws in overdue status, waterfall logic will prioritize payment allocation to draws with oldest overdue obligation.

managedByPeach.description: If true, this loan will be completely managed by the system including amortization, interest accrual etc.

items.description:
An array of three or four elements mapping a state to a debt validation notice template and trigger.

If only three elements are included the fourth is assumed to be `"loanActivation"`

automatedDebtValidationNotification.description:
Some states require automatic debt validation notices to be sent to borrowers. We are aware of in the following states: Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Nevada, Tennessee, Wyoming, Arizona, Puerto Rico, DC.
Peach can automatically send the debt validation notices based on two triggers:

  1. On loan activation event - `loanActivation`:
     The notice will be sent (once) when a loan is activated.
  2. On first overdue event - `loanFirstOverdue`:
     The notice will be sent (once) when a loan becomes overdue for the first time.

Please configure which of the states you'd like to elect into receiving the automatic debt validation notice. Use the option where the state is left blank to specify the default option for remaining states (or remove the "catch all" entirely).
Below is an example with a list of states and corresponding templates:

```
[
  ["IL", "US", "debtValidationNoticeAutomatic", "loanActivation"],
  ["MD", "US", "debtValidationNoticeAutomatic", "loanActivation"],
  ["MA", "US", "debtValidationNoticeAutomatic", "loanFirstOverdue"],
  ["MN", "US", "debtValidationNoticeAutomatic", "loanFirstOverdue"],
  ["NV", "US", "debtValidationNoticeAutomatic", "loanFirstOverdue"],
  ["TN", "US", "debtValidationNoticeAutomatic", "loanActivation"],
  ["WY", "US", "debtValidationNoticeAutomatic", "loanActivation"],
  ["AZ", "US", "ArizonaDebtValidationNotice", "loanActivation"],
  ["PR", "US", "PuertoRicoDebtValidationNotice", "loanFirstOverdue"],
  ["", "US", "debtValidationNoticeAutomatic", "loanFirstOverdue"],
]
```

Supercase.description:
A supercase allows for the management of many subcases. It is useful, for
instance, when there is an issue which effects a large group of borrowers.

name.description: Name of the supercase.

description.description:
A description of the supercase and/or the precipitating event
of the supercase.

eventStartedAt.description:
The date and time at which the precipitating event took place. For instance, in the
case of a bug, the earliest date at which the bug affected customers; in the case
of a disaster, the date at which the disaster occurred.

statusUpdatedAt.description: The date and time at which the status was last updated on this supercase.

subcaseTypeId.description:
The ID of the case-type which will be used when creating new subcases for this supercase.
When a population is committed (by settings its `isDraft: false`) subcases of this type
are created for all members of the population.

Notes:
- This is different from the `supercaseType`
- This must be NOT null in order to commit a population.

subcaseName.description: The name of the subcase which will be used when creating new subcases for this supercase.

createdBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for creating the supercase.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

autoCreated.description: True if the supercase was created by some automated method.

femaDisasterDetails.description: The details of the associated FEMA disaster.

incidentType.description:
Type of incident such as fire or flood. The incident type will
affect the types of assistance available. For more information on
incident types, please visit: www.fema.gov.

lastRefreshAt.description: Date the record was last updated in the FEMA API data store.

paProgramDeclared.description:
Denotes whether the Public Assistance program was declared for this
disaster. For more information on the program,
please visit: www.fema.gov.

hmProgramDeclared.description:
Denotes whether the Hazard Mitigation program was declared for this
disaster. For more information on the program,
please visit: www.fema.gov.

femaMonitoringEndDate.description: If set, the FEMA supercase monitoring will stop after this date.

Population.description:
A supercase may affect many borrower-loans. A supercase population represents one instance
of adding borrower-loans to a supercase. It's important to keep track of which borrower-loans
were added at which time, because different actions may need to be taken depending on
when a borrower-loan is added to a supercase.

isDraft.description: `True` if this is the draft population of the supercase.

supercaseId.description: Identifier of the supercase that the population belongs to.

caseId.description: The ID of the subcase with which this borrower-loan is associated

borrowerId.description:
The borrower ID of a borrower affected by this supercase.

You must specify a borrower in addition to a loan because a loan might have multiple borrowers
and only one of them might be affected by this supercase.

loanId.description:
The loan ID of a loan affected by this supercase. The loan must be associated with the
specified borrower.

createdBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for creating the member.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

attachments.description: An optional list of documents to attach to the outgoing email.

createdBy.description:
Details of the user responsible for creating the supercase.
Can be an agent or automated system process.

completed.description: Set to `true` if operation is completed.

casesProcessed.description: The total number of processed and/or ineligible subcases.

casesFailed.description: The number of cases on which the operation failed.

casesIneligible.description:
The number of cases on which the operation could not succeed due
to external factors. For example, if your operation requires the
subcase to be open to have any meaningful effect, then a closed
subcase would be considered ineligible.

errorLog.description: List of error reports for each failed subcase level operations.

operationType.description: The different types of bulk operations.

requestBody.description: The body of the bulk operation request

operationType.description: The different types of bulk operations.

requestBody.description: The body of the bulk operation request

operationType.description: The different types of bulk operations.

The different types of bulk operations.
